loans.name: Kory Pankaritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY PANKARITA” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de fruta, elaboración de cajas de madera, venta de mantas, producción de calzados, costura de ropa deportiva, transporte, comercio de aretes, comercio de decoraciones. 

La señora Justina indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer  ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años iniciando el mismo con los prestamos que sacó de la institución.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de mercadería (compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
The “KORY PANKARITA” communal bank will start its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Villa Exaltación center. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors in which Justina is the president. The association members have various businesses. Among them are: selling fruit, making wooden boxes, selling blankets, making shoes, sewing sports clothing, transportation, selling earrings, selling decorations.  

Justina indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, joining at the invitation of a friend. At present she has a business selling food. She has done this for years, starting with the loans she took out from the institution.  

The loan she will take out now is to increase her merchandise (to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.). She will get all of this at the market and after preparation, she will sell it at her sales stall. This work allows her to generate resources to help her family as much as possible, as she is single and has four children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the meetings.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
El Sr Aldo es soltero, tiene 26 años, vive con su Papa en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo,su Mama y Hermana están trabajando en España. El es un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor, que no tiene miedo a ningún tipo de trabajo.
Nos comenta que hace 5 años tiene una ferretería en su domicilio el cual mantiene con la ayuda de su papa mientras el trabaja en otras cosas. Cuenta que la mejor manera de ganar clientela es tratarle bien a la gente.
El Sr agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza puesto en su persona. El solicita el crédito para abastecer su ferretería con caños, mangueras y demás articulos para sanitarios.
texts.en:
Aldo is single, twenty-six years old, and lives with his father in the city of Coronel Oviedo. His mother and sister work in Spain. He is a hard-working and energetic young man that is not afraid of any type of work.
He tells us that he has had a hardware shop in his home for the past five years, which he maintains with the help of his father while he does other work. He says the best way to win customers is to treat all people well.
Aldo is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the confidence it has placed in him. He requests the loan to supply his hardware shop with pipes, hoses, and other bathroom items.

loans.use: to purchase pipes, hoses, and other bathroom items.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has one child. Mildred owns a boutique which has been in operation for one year. Mildred also owns a mobile money transfer shop.

She was introduced to Milango Financial Services by her friends. Mildred is applying for a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase handbags and clothes for sale. Her main challenge is competition. She would like to invest the extra income into the business.

loans.use: to purchase handbags and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia de 33 años es soltera tiene un hijo de 6 años que cursa el primer año de primaria en una escuela pública de la localidad; Olivia desde antes de cumplir cinco años tuvo un problema en la columna el cual hasta la fecha no le permitido caminar, su mamá siempre la tuvo en terapia física y psicológica de lo cual ella le da gracias a Dios y a su mamá por toda la atención que ella tenido y lo cual le ha permitido tener una vida normal. Para Olivia nada es imposible porque tiene  una meta bien establecida y la cual está dispuesta a lograr enfrentando cualquier obstáculo que se le pueda presentar su meta y mayor ilusión en la vida darle una educación y una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo Cristian  que la que ella recibió,  su discapacidad no es un obstáculo para que ella pueda lograr su meta ella trabaja como promotora de productos de belleza por cátalo de empresas reconocidas en México, La forma en la que ella trabaja es tocando puerta por puerta ofreciendo los productos que ella vende y de esta manera poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de ella y su hijo, ella vive en casa de su mamá  al igual que otro hermano y está buscando tener su propio espacio el cual le permita a ella y a su hijo mejorar su calidad de vida por ello solicita el apoyo para iniciar la construcción de un cuarto.
texts.en: Olivia, thirty-three years old, is single with a six year old son who currently attends his first year of school in a local public school. Since before she turned five, Olivia has had a problem with her spine which, to this day, does not allow her to walk. Her mother always had her in physical and psychological therapy. She is grateful to God and her mother for the attention she has received, and for being able to have a normal life. Nothing is impossible for Olivia because she has a well established goal which she is determined to achieve, confronting whatever obstacle which may present itself. Her greatest dream in life is to provide an education and a better quality of life to her son Cristian than that which she received. Her disability is not an obstacle for her to be able to achieve her goal. She works selling catalog beauty products from recognized businesses in Mexico. The way she works is by going door to door offering the products she sells. In this way, she is able to cover the costs of her and her son’s basic necessities. She lives in her mother’s house, along with another brother, and is looking to have her own space in which she and her son will be able to improve their quality of life. For this reason she requests the loan to begin the construction of a room.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a poultry farmer who lives in Changamwe, Kenya. This business has been in operation for 9 years. She employs one other person in her farm. Beatrice also owns a boutique in the town of Mombasa. 

Beatrice is married and has five children, all aged above eighteen years and independent. Her main challenge is the rising cost of poultry feed and drugs. She is applying for a loan of 60,000 KES to purchase broiler feed, drugs, and feeders. 

Beatrice looks forward to starting the layers farm in the future. The income obtained from this venture will help meet her basic needs, pay fees for her orphaned grandchild, and provide savings for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase broiler feed, drugs, and feeders.

loans.name: Yajaira Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Yajaira Vanessa tiene una buena venta de cobijas y cobertores en esta temporada ya que mucha gente le compra por mayoreo. Solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercancía y así tener la oportunidad de tener más ganancias en su negocio y para la familia; ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene. 
Atiende el negocio todos los días y su esposo le ayuda cuando no tiene trabajo, solo tiene un hijo y es pequeño de edad. 
Desea invertir en su negocio ya que es una buena temporada para las ventas de cobijas y cobertores.
texts.en:
Yajaira Vanessa has a good sale of blankets and bedspreads in this season since many people buy wholesale. She requests a loan to invest by purchasing merchandise and have the opportunity to have more earnings in her business and for her family, especially since it is the source of income that she has.
She sees to her business every day, and her husband helps her when he has no work. She has one child who is still young.
She hopes to invest in her business since it is a good season for selling blankets and bedspreads.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as clothing and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia y su esposo cuentan con un negocio familiar en el cual los dos como pareja unida la manejan y atienden a sus clientes. Este negocio es de reparación de aparatos electrónicos y quien realiza el arreglo es el esposo y ella es quien maneja las finanzas del negocio. Julia solicita un préstamo para comprar partes como cables, tornillos, pantallas, botones y mas para que al momento de realizar la reparación tenga lo necesario para que el trabajo quede en buenas condiciones. Los aparatos mas solicitados para arreglar es televisiones, dvd, estéreos , para esta familia es su fuente de ingresos por lo que desean invertir para sea prosperado.
texts.en: Julia and her husband have a family business which the two of them, as a united couple, manage and in which they tend to their customers together. Their business is repairing electronic items. Her husband is the one who does the repairs, and she is the one who manages the finances of the business. Julia is applying for a loan to buy parts such as cables, screws, screens, buttons, and more, so that at the time of a repair, they will have everything necessary so that the work can be done well. The items for which they receive the most requests for repairs are televisions, dvd players, and stereos. For this family, their business is their source of income, so they want to invest so that it will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy parts for their business

loans.name: Rhona

texts.en:
Rhona owns a salon which has been in operation for one year. She lives in Mombasa, Kenya, is married, and has two children. She began the business from her personal savings and her salary.

Rhona learned of Milango from her friends and is applying for a loan of Ksh 16,000 to purchase shampoo, weaves and braids. Her main challenge is finding clients during low seasons, and her ambition is to open two more salons. Rhona will save the extra income for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Guayaibyty Poty. Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Paraguarí, se reúne un grupo de mujeres con el fin de conocer más sobre la Fundación Paraguaya, luego de esa reunión les gusto bastante interesante, es por eso que ellas decidieron realizar la reunión para formar el comité. El grupo lleva por nombre Guayaibyty Poty, debido a que así se llama la compañía en que viven ellas, han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de respeto mutuo, actualmente se encuentran en el tercer ciclo con calificación excelente, integrado por  11 mujeres.
Una de las miembros es la señora Norma, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida. Comenta que gracias a su negocio y a la buena atención que le da es que ha podido seguir creciendo. Dice que le va muy bien, ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos acuden hasta su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, fideos, arroz, y demás artículos de primera necesidad. Comenta que esto le será de gran ayuda en su negocio para poder cumplir con sus clientes
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí, a group of women gathered together with the intention of learning more about Fundación Paraguaya. After their meeting, they found the program to be quite interesting so they decided to form a committee. The group chose the name Guayaibyty Poty, since it is the neighborhood in which they live. They made the commitment to stay united as a group and to work in an environment of mutual respect. The group is in its third loan cycle and has earned an excellent rating. There are 11 women in this group.

One of the members is Sra. Norma. She manages a well-stocked food pantry. Norma says that thanks to her business and the good service she provides, she has been able to continue growing. She is doing very well since most of her neighbors come to her business.

Norma is requesting a loan to buy sugar, noodles, rice, and other basic necessities. She says the loan will be a great help to her business so that she can satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, rice, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Triphena

texts.en:
Triphena lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has two children. Triphena owns a food kiosk that has been in operation for the last eight years. She learned of Milango from her friends and joined in order to access credit.

Triphena is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to add food stock to her business. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and some customers not paying on time. She will re-invest the capital into the business.

loans.use: To add food stock to her business.

loans.name: Leidy Johana

texts.es: La señora Leidy es una ama de casa madre de un hijo de 4 años de edad, a sus 21 años la señora Leidy desea emprender su propio negocio de venta de comidas rápidas puesto que tiene conocimiento en esta área con el fin de apoyar económicamente en su hogar y brindarle un mejor bienestar a su hijo y esposo. La idea de la señora Leidy es adecuar en el exterior de su casa (en la acera) un carro de venta de comidas todos los días en las noches. La señora Leidy necesita para iniciar su negocio de la compra del carro para vender este tipo de comidas y los insumos para prepararlas. El sueño de la señora Leidy es tener su propio restaurante y brindarle a su hijo una excelente educación.
texts.en:
Sra. Leidy is a homemaker and mother of a four-year-old child. At 21 years of age, Sra. Leidy wants to start her own business of selling fast food since she has knowledge in this area. She wants to contribute financially to her household so that she can provide a better well-being for her son and husband. Her idea is to sell from a vending cart that will be set up on the sidewalk outside of her home where she can sell every night of the week.

In order to start her business, Sra. Leidy needs to buy a vending cart for selling this type of food and the supplies for preparing her dishes. Her dream is to have her own restaurant so that she can provide her son an excellent education.

loans.use: to purchase a food cart and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for ploughing and planting of her maize farm.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es: El señor Carlos Mario a sus 44 años de edad es padre de un hijo de 17 años, se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de leche, esta actividad la aprendió desde hace aproximadamente 12 años cuando trabajaba con su hermano. La jornada del señor Carlos Mario es de todos lo días desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m. El señor Carlos Mario necesita de la compra de una vaca lechera con la cual puede aumentar la capacidad de producción de su finca y poder vender una mayor cantidad de leche y así mejorar el bienestar de su familia. El sueño del señor Carlos Mario es ver crecer su finca y poder generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos Mario is 44 years old and the father of a 17-year-old son. He has been selling milk for the past six years. Carlos learned this trade approximately 12 years ago while working with his brother. He works every day from 5am to 6pm.

Sr. Carlos Mario needs to buy a dariy cow so that he can increase the production capacity on his farm and be able to sell a larger quantity of milk. As a result, he will improve the well-being of his family. His dream is to grow his farm so that he can generate jobs directly in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Unión Y Fuerza Group

texts.es: Valentina tiene 36 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos los cuales aún son menores de edad. Lleva 2 años como socia de Edaprospo y se dedica a la artesanía de pulseras con el cual lleva 4 años en este negocio. Comenzó con la finalidad de poder superarse y obtener ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado abastecerse con algunos electrodomésticos para su hogar. Sus ingresos los destina a los gastos de alimentación y al pago de agua y luz. Su plan para el futuro es abrir un local propio para su negocio de artesanía. Valentina piensa usar el reciente préstamo en la compra de mercadería ya que por campaña navideña sus ventas se incrementan. Ella pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Unión y Fuerza” con el cual lleva 4 meses como presidenta del grupo el cual esta conformado por 8 socias y que se formo por parte de la visita de uno de los analistas.
texts.en:
Valentina is 36 years old, single, and has three young children. She has been a member of EDAPROSPO for two years and has been in the business of selling handcrafted bracelets for four years. Valentina started working with the intention of succeeding and generating income to cover her needs. Through effort and work, she was able to purchase a few appliances for her home. Her income goes toward paying for food, water, and electricity. Valentina’s plan for the future is to open her own shop for her craft business. She plans to use this loan to buy merchandise for the Christmas season so that she can increase her sales.

Valentina is a member of the Communal Bank “Unión y Fuerza” (Unity and Strength) where she has served as president for the past four months. The group consists of eight members and was formed by one of the analysts.

loans.use: to buy craft merchandise to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
14 mujeres de la ciudad de Paraguarí se han reunido con el propósito de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo lograr el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que ven en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación una gran oportunidad para salir adelante.
Una de las miembros es la señora Isabel, quien comenta que se dedica a la costura. Este ha sido el medio de mantener a su familia. Comenta que siempre está muy atareada y llena de trabajo, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos. Ella desea seguir con su negocio, y por eso solicita el crédito para poder comprar telas, hilos y demás insumos de costura.
Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que les brinda, pues es una oportunidad de crecimiento muy importante.
texts.en:
Fourteen women from the city of Paraguarí have gathered so that they could work together and experience individual growth. They are hardworking and determined women who view the Program of Women Entrepreneurs with Fundación Paraguaya as a great opportunity to move forward.

One of the members is Sra. Isabel who says that she works as a seamstress. This enables her to support her family. Isabel says that she is very busy and always has work, which allows her to generate a very good income. She wants to continue with her business so she is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, thread, and other sewing supplies.

Isabel is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for providing her with a very important opportunity to grow.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un señor de 56 años el cual vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde hace 3 años Edwin se dedica a una porqueriza. Desde que inició este proyecto los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

En estos momentos lo que desea Edwin es solicitar un préstamo por ¢400,000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para comprar cerdos y alimento, que necesita para su proyecto de porcicultura. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.  

Edwin forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido un microcrédito que le han permitido crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 56-year-old man who lives with his family in a rural community of Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón.  Mollejones is a community located 150 kilometers to the south of the province of San José, the capital of Costa Rica.  It is 850 meters above sea level.  There they grow vegetables and coffee, and also do other work such as raising cattle and pigs for fattening.  There are also other projects of organic agriculture and hydroponic vegetables.  In addition to agriculture, in the community there are auto repair shops, a supermarket, small restaurants (coffee bars), and a furniture store.

Edwin has worked in a pigsty for three years.  Since he began this project the results have been good because he has had great success in the community, and the income he has generated has helped him get his family ahead.

What Edwin wants now is to request a loan of 400,00 CRC to buy pigs and feed, which he needs for his pig-raising project.  With this he hopes that his small business grows and comes to generate more income to improve his living conditions.

Edwin is part of Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  As a member it has received a micro-loan that allowed them to grow as small business entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Luciernagas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUCIERNAGAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Juana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de fruta tejido de corpiños, venta de pantalones, venta de sacos, venta de yines.

La señora Juana,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente lo venderá en la ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Luciernagas” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Juana. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as selling fruit, making bodices, selling trousers, selling bags, and selling jeans.

Sra. Juana says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization upon receiving an invitation from a promoter. Juana currently has a business of selling vegetables and has been working for many years. She learned this trade from her family.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying vegetables, which she acquires in bulk in La Ceja. She then sells her goods at the fairs. By working in this manner, she is able to generate income to support her family. Juana is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Juana said that she enjoys the health services.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Yuli Andrea

texts.es: La señora Yuli Andrea a sus 25 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración desde su casa de un plato típico de la región Antioqueña llamado tamal, este producto lo comercializa en el municipio del Santuario localizado al oriente de Antioquia, este negocio brinda los ingresos necesarios para el sustento familiar. La señora Yuli Andrea necesita de la compra de insumos para realizar su producto tales como maíz, verduras y condimentos, con lo anterior, la señora Yuli Andrea podrá mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos y así tener la oportunidad de brindarle una buena educación a su hija y cumplir su sueño de tener un restaurante.
texts.en: At 25 years old, Ms. Yuli works from her home preparing a typical dish of the Antioqueña region called "tamal." She sells this product in the municipality of Santuario, located in the western part of Antioquia. This business provides the necessary income to sustain her family. Yuli Andrea needs to purchase ingredients for making her product, such as corn, vegetables and condiments. This will allow Yuli Andrea to improve her sales and will provide her with an opportunity to offer her daughter a good education and to reach her dream of owning a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like corn, vegetables and condiments

loans.name: El Girasol Group

texts.es:
Maximina cuenta con 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja tiene 5 hijos que se encuentran estudiando el mayor se llama miguel y esta cursando 6° de primaria, Yulissa esta en 4°, Jacqueline en 2°, Jazmín en 3° de preescolar y José Antonio tiene 3 años de edad, 	su esposo se llama pablo es albañil.

Ella es comerciante muy trabajadora ya tiene 3 años vendiendo frutas y verduras sale a vender a los pueblos cercanos e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de verduras y frutas como son: jitomate, chile, cebolla, plátanos, manzana, mandarina, jícama, etc.


Maximina pertenece al grupo el girasol el cual esta integrado por 11 personas 10  mujeres y un hombre las cuales serán mencionadas a continuación: mercedes, Roselia, Noelia, Gisela, Demetrio, Sandivel, Maria, Brenda Liz, Maximina, Ivan, Maria, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de calzado, pollos, productos de abarrotes, comida, venta de cosméticos, ropa, etc.
texts.en:
Maximina, 30, lives with her partner and they have 5 children, most of whom are in school: Miguel, 6th grade; Yulissa, 4th grade; Jacqueline, 2nd grade; Jazmin, preschool; and Jose Antonio who is 3 years old. Her husband, Pablo, is a mason.

She is a hardworking merchant and has been selling fruits and vegetables for 3 years. She goes out to sell in nearby towns. She will use the loan to buy fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, peppers, onions, plantains, apples, mandarin oranges, jicama, etc.

Maximina belongs to the lending group El Girasol, which is made up of 11 members - 10 women and 1 man. They are: Mercedes, Roselia, Noelia, Gisela, Demetrio, Sandivel, Maria, Brenda Liz, Maximina, Ivan and Maria. They all work in commercial activities like selling shoes, chickens, groceries, food cosmetics, clothing, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, peppers, onions, plantains, apples, mandarin oranges, jicama, etc.

loans.name: Emprendedores De Vitarte Group

texts.es: El grupo Emprendedores de Vitarte, está conformado por la unión de varias mujeres emprendoras. Todas las integrantes del grupo desarrollan distintas actividades de forma conjunta y solidaria, dentro de un ambiente de compañerismo, respeto y unión. La señora Verónica es una de ellas, tiene 32 años, ella es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que son menores de edad y dependen de ella, se dedica a la venta de Comida hace un año, comenzó por unos  amigos de su localidad, que le pedían que cocinara para ellos. Con esta venta genera los ingresos que pueden pagar los gastos que se da día a día en su hogar, como la compra de los alimentos y de los gastos de colegio que paga mensualmente. Con el reciente préstamo ella quiere formalizar y registrar su pequeño negocio y estar en regla con sus documentos
texts.en:
The Emprendedores de Vitarte group is made up of the union of several women entrepreneurs.  All the members of the group work in different activities in a coordinated and supportive way, in an atmosphere of companionship, respect, and union.

Verónica is one of the women.  She is 32 years old and single, with two minor children who are dependent on her.  She has worked selling food for a year.  She began because of some friends in her community who were asking her to cook for them.  With this sale she generates the income that can pay the daily expenses in her home, such as buying food, and the monthly school expenses she pays.

With the recent loan, she wants to formalize and register her small business and have her documents in order.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 44-year-old mother of four from the Negev. While she has only an elementary school education, Nora has succeeded in opening a small store. Along with a business partner, Nora has been able to garner customers from her area and develop a strong business activity that has much larger potential. Nora and her partner have decided to expand their market and include household supplies, trinkets and minimarket items. 

Nora needs this loan to assist in paying for expanded stock and to upgrade her store. 

Nora wants to provide a secure future for her children and make sure they have the ability to achieve a full education.

loans.use: to expand inventory and upgrade her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a screen and music mixer for his karaoke business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand inventory and upgrade her store.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
Jhon de 24 años, está casado con Sarita de 22 años, fruto de esta relación nació su primer hijo, por lo que están contentos viviendo en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de Chuvivana del distrito de Pichari. Jhon, es un hombre lleno de sueños y con ganas de sobresalir por el bienestar de su familia.
Él es agricultor, desde muy joven sus padres le enseñaron como se trabaja en el campo. Desde entonces cultiva café, con el deseo de que un día pudiera producir en buenas cantidades, pero para que eso ocurra él está decidido sembrar por lo menos en unas 4 hectáreas más. Generalmente trabaja realizando el ayni (ayuda mutua con sus vecinos) mas que nada en los trabajos de mantenimiento, pero en temporadas de cosecha siempre requiere de peones quienes le facilitan en la extracción de sus productos. Luego çel se encarga de procesarlos, secarlos y comercializarlos. Aunque ahora sus productos ya lo recogen los acopiadores en su propio terreno de producción, ya no tiene esa dificultad de trasladarlos hacia su distrito. En un futuro desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes así poder tener un ingreso más. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Jhon está feliz por haber encontrado en su banco comunal personas de confianza. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles él invertirá en el pago a sus peones que realizaron el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola.
texts.en:
24-year-old Jhon is married to 22-year-old Sarita. The fruit of this relationship is their first son. Because of him they are happy living in their own house, which is located in downtown Chuvivana in the Pichari area. Jhon is a man who is full of dreams and the desire to get ahead for the wellbeing of his family. 

He is a farmer, and at a very young age his parents taught him how to work in the field. Since then he has cultivated coffee with the hope of one day being about to produce in large quantities, but for this to happen he has decided to plant at least 4 hectares more. 

Generally he gets ayni (mutual help from the neighbors) mostly for maintenance jobs, but during harvest times he always needs laborers to help him pick his products. Then he is in charge of processing them, drying them, and selling them. Although right now collectors have already picked up his products from his farmland, he doesn't have the difficulty of moving them into their area anymore. 

In the future he wants to open a grocery store so that he can make more income. This will be his second credit with MFP, and because of this he promises to be punctual in his loan payments. Jhon is happy to have found trustworthy people in his communal bank. He will put the 2,500 nuevos soles towards the payment of the laborers who maintain his farmland.

loans.use: to contract laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire field hands

loans.name: Quinahue Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Quinahue” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran, atención de almacenes, peluquería, venta de verduras, preparaciones de productos artesanales y productos de amasandería, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Recoleta.
Elizabeth integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al final, en la tercera fila. Ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda. Usa su cabello corto, anteojos y una polera deportiva. 
Se dedica a la venta de joyas, desde hace 22 años. Ella manda a transformar y a realizar joyas exclusivas de oro, plata, acero quirúrgico y fantasía. 
Vende sus productos por catalogo, ya cuenta con clientela fija en la ciudad de Temuco.
Su horario de trabajo es flexible, sin embargo trabaja todos los días de la semana.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras y las joyas que envía a reparación y a fabricar, las realiza en un taller.
Con el crédito comprará joyas, argolleros y pesas para el oro. 
Una de las metas para su negocio a corto plazo es comprarse un computador, que le permita promocionar sus productos. Y su meta más a largo plazo es instalarse con un local establecido. 
Elizabeth vive junto a su marido y uno de sus sueños es casarse por la iglesia, ya que solo está casada por el civil. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se deben a la independencia económica y de horario que le brinda su trabajo.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha podido invertir en su negocio, aprender nuevas estrategias de organización de sus gastos y por otro lado disfruta gratamente de la compañía de las demás emprendedoras. El grupo es honesto, respetuoso y comprometido.
Recoleta es una de las 34 comunas de Santiago (capital de Chile) y se encuentra ubicada en el sector centro-norte del Santiago, región metropolitana. Cuenta con un activo comercio, destacando el barrio comercial de Patronato que ha acogido principalmente a comerciantes árabes (en un principio) y coreanos (en la actualidad).
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Quinahue” and is comprised of 19 entrepreneurs who dedicate themselves to different business, such as store-keeping, hairdressing, selling vegetables, preparing artisanal products, preparing baked goods, etc. They all come from the commune of Recoleta.

Elizabeth is a member of the communal bank, who is seen in back of the photo in the third row, second from the right. Use her short hair, glasses and sporty shirt to spot her. She has been selling jewelery for 22 years. She orders and makes original jewelery from gold, silver, and surgical steel, as well as costume jewelery. She sells her products by catalog, and already has a fixed clientele in the city of Temuco. Her work schedule is flexible, but she does work every day of the week. Elizabeth purchases her merchandise from distributors and has a workshop she uses for the jewelery she sends to be made or repaired. She will use this loan to buy jewelery, rings, and weights for gold. One of her business goals is to buy a computer, which would make it possible to promote her products. Her most long-term goal is to establish a permanent location for her business.

Elizabeth lives with her husband and one of her dreams is for them to marry in the church, as they currently have only a civil marriage. She is motivated to continue with her business due to the economic independence and work schedule.

She is very happy and grateful for the support offered by Fondo Esperanza, as it has made it possible for her to invest in her business, learning new strategies for organizing expenses. On the other hand, she has also greatly enjoyed the company of the other entrepreneurs. The communal bank is an honest, respectful, and committed group.

Recoleta is one of the 34 communes of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and is located in the north-central sector of the Santiago metropolitan region. Commerce there is active, especially in the commercial neighborhood of Patronato, which has hosted primarily Arabs (in the beginning) and Koreans (nowadays).

loans.use: to buy jewelery, rings, and weights for gold

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Juan Bautista Del Carmen

texts.es:
Juan Bautista es un señor de 49 años el cual vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde hace algún tiempo Juan Bautista se dedica a su microempresa donde vende gorras, sombreros y camisetas. Inició este proyecto desde el año 2003 y los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente tiene seis maquinas para su negocio.

En estos momentos lo que desea Juan Bautista es solicitar un préstamo por ¢600,000 (seiscientos mil colones) para comprar más materiales para su taller, los cuales necesita para su proyecto. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.  
Juan Bautista forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido un microcrédito que le han permitido crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista is 49 years old and lives with his family in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Patanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is located 150 kilometers south of the province of San Jose, the capital of Costa Rica. It is 850 meters above sea level. There, the people cultivate vegetables and coffee and also raise beef cattle and pigs. There are also some organic farming projects and hydroponic vegetable gardening (growing plants in water, without soil). In addition to agriculture, the community has mechanic shops, a supermarket, small restaurants (low-cost eateries) and a furniture store.

For some time, Juan Bautista has owned a small business where he sells caps, hats and T-shirts. He started his business in 2003 and the outcome has been good since he has been very well received in his community and his earnings have helped him to move his family forward. Currently he has six machines for his business.

Nowadays, Juan Bautista would like to request a loan of 600,000 colones to purchase more materials, which he needs for his shop. With this sum he expects his small business to grow and begin to generate more income so he can improve his living conditions.

Juan Bautista is part of the “Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce” Communal Bank, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. As a member, he has received a loan that has enabled him to grow as a small business man.

loans.use: to buy materials for his small business.

loans.name: Rosales Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSALES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Antonia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de mantillas, chompas y gorros, costura de overoles, artesanía y venta de mantas, elaboración de mantas a grochet, tejido de awayos.

La señora Antonia,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de promotoras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de overoles que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su hermano mayor.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en Oruro y la Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosales" is in its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the regional office Alto Lima.  It is made up of seven members and is directed by agoverning board headed by Señora Antonia.  The members have various businesses among which are blanket, sweater and hat sales, sewing overalls, making and selling blankets, crocheted blankets and woven awayos [general purpose cloth]. 

Señora Antonia says that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and was invited to join the institution by the organizers.  Currently she has a business sewing overalls that she has had for years.  She learned this trade from her older brother.  

She is requesting a loan to increase her capital (purchase fabric) that she buys in La Ceja and then uses to make her overalls.  She will sell them in Oruro and La Paz.  This work allows her to generate income to support her family.  She is married and has two children.   

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she said that she likes the savings and the training.

loans.use: purchase fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a moto-taxi

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Miracia is one of the members of the Group Dios Es Mi Pastor 1 & 2 (God is My Shepherd), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Miracia sells miscellaneous souvenir products in her business, such as paints, jewels, accessories, and others. This is the first loan she has requested from Esperanza, and she is planning to expand her business inventory for this Christmas. She is very excited to be part of this group, because she knows there are a lot of hardworking women whose lives are being changed by these loans, and she wants this to happen to her too.

With this new investment, Miracia will be able to produce more and increase her sales. She started her business about 7 years ago with a small amount she saved. She tells us that her challenge is to have her house, because she is a single mother with 3 children and she needs to work hard to give her children everything they could need. She is planning to reinvest her profits in the business to make it bigger and sustainable. Her dream is to see all her children become professionals and good people.

loans.use: To buy souvenirs like jewels, painan, and others.

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Susana is one of the members of the Group Dios es Mi Pastor 3 & 4 (God is My Shepherd), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, This group is located in one of the rural area called Batey, populated by Haitian immigrants who came to the country to work in the sugar field plantation. Most of the members in this group are Haitian citizens.

Susana sells miscellaneous products in her business, such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and accessories. With this loan, she is planning to invest in her inventory, because in the Christmas season all products are in high demand. Susana is very excited to receive her 8th loan from Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loans, and thus taken a step towards expanding her business.

She tells us that her most important challenge is to set a store where she can sells all her items, without going outside and walking in her communities and others nearby. She enjoys being at home with her long-term partner and 5 children; right now just two of them live together with her and their father. She is planning to reinvest her profits in her business, and to get clothes and shoes for her children. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Jennifer Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Amistad se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar vive la señora Jennifer, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, todavía no tienen hijos. El marido trabaja en un depósito de gas.  Esta en el Banco Comunal desde que se inicio el grupo, es la tesorera del Banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en la institución. 

Ella para ayudarse y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la cría de animales, para lo cual y con la ayuda de los créditos ha construido un pequeño galpón donde mete hasta 200 pollos cada tres meses, en la actualidad tiene esta cantidad de pollos que los piensa vender en la época de Navidad Y Año Nuevo.  Cuando están listos los lleva a entregar a los comerciantes del mercado de Calceta, lleva con esta actividad por más de 6 meses y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar alimentos para los pollos que tiene en su granja. 

Sus sueños son tener un carro y una familia bien formada.
texts.en:
The Friendship Community Bank meets every other week in the beautiful city of Calceta, a city known by the name of "Calceta without equal" for the beauty of its women and because, for the citizens, there is no city more beautiful in all the world.

Mrs. Jennifer lives in this place. She is 21 years old and lives with her common-law husband. They do not yet have children. Her husband works at a gas station. She has been in the community bank since it began, and she is the treasurer, and she likes it for the help the institution has provided to her.

To help herself, and also her husband with the expenses of the home, she works raising animals. With the help of loans, she has built a small shed where she raises up to 200 chickens every three months. She currently has that amount of chickens and she plans to sell them around Christmas and New Year's. When the chickens are ready, she will deliver them to the market to be sold by the merchants of Calceta. She has done this work for more than 6 months and it is going fairly well for her. This loan is to buy food for the chickens she has on her farm. Her goals are to have a car and a nice family.

loans.use: buy chicken food

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 62 años, es un hombre trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Elena de 46 años y fruto de esa relación tiene a su única hija Davita de 19 años, a quien desea brindar una buena educación. Carlos, es un hombre muy laborioso, con su puesto de trabajo trata de sobresalir adelante. Es comerciante y tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en su comunidad. La bodega de Carlos es muy concurrido por sus compradores, empieza abrir las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar los productos indicados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores. Lleva 02 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias para poder hacer crecer aún más su negocio y solventar a su familia. Este sera su crédito número 01 con MFP, esta contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero. Se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles podrá comprar abarrotes para poder incrementar su negocio como: arroz, azúcar, conservas, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros,
texts.en:
Carlos, 62, is a hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife, Elena, 46, and their daughter, Davita, 19, who they want to receive a good education.  Carlos works hard to get ahead.  He is a merchant and has a grocery store in the community and many customers.  He opens very early in the morning to receive the first shoppers who know they will find what they need.  What he enjoys most about his work is being able to talk to customers and using his persuasive conversations to generate more customers.  

He has been in business for two years and believes that the hardest part of his job is having to be on his feet all day long.  He plans to use the loan to buy more groceries for the business and stock the store.  He hopes to be able to make a better profit in the future so he can grow and take good care of his family.  This is his first loan through MFP and he is happy about receiving this financial support.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time and plans to use the 2,000 PEN to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas, sweets and other items.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, canned goods, sodas and sweets.

loans.name: Carmen Idilia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Amistad se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 52 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijas, tres mayores de edad y la menor de 16 años,  dos de ellas viven en su casa y estudian  en Universidad y colegio.

Ella trabaja de empleada pública en una institución del estado, pero además se dedica al comercio ya que vende ropa  y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además ella tiene un negocio de alquiler de carpas las cuales son utilizadas en actos sociales por sus clientes. Ella vende en sus ratos y días libres,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días.  Tiene más de 5  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y para mandar a elaborar otra carpa ya que estas le dejan muy buenas ganancias. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijas terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The 'La Amistad' (Friendship) community bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta.  This city is known as 'Calceta la sin par' (Calceta, the city with no equal) because of the beauty of its women and because, as far as the locals are concerned, there is no more beautiful city in the world.

Here we meet Carmen.  She is 52 years old, separated, and has four daughters.  Three of her daughters are grown up and her youngest is 16.  Two of her daughters live at home and are studying at university and high school.

Carmen works as a civil servant in a State institution.  She also sells clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  In addition, she has a business renting out marquees which are used by her customers at social events.  Carmen makes her sales in her free time and on her days off.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She has been in business for more than five years and is doing very well.

Carmen will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.  She will also have another marquee made as they make her very good profits.  This is her fourth loan cycle with her community bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Carmen's dream is for her daughters to finish their education.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics and to have a marquee made

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Amistad se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Diana, tiene 29 años de edad es madre soltera de una  niña de 5 años  de edad, la misma que estudia en escuela. Vive con su hija en su casa, pues con mucho esfuerzo pudo tener su casa propia.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y con esto ha podido salir adelante con su hija, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda de vestir.  Sale a recorrer tres días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esa hora su hija está en la escuela, deja  sus productos a crédito y cobra  cada 8 días, su mercadería la va a comprar cada vez que necesita a Guayaquil ya que según el allá le sale más barato, lleva dos años en este negocio.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa de niños. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha dado el grupo.
 
Su sueño es que a su hija no le falte nada.
texts.en:
The 'La Amistad' (Friendship) community bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta.  This city is known as 'Calceta la sin par' (Calceta, the city with no equal) because of the beauty of its women and because, so far as its residents are concerned, there is no more beautiful city in the world. 

Here we meet Diana.  She is 29 years old and a single mother.  She has a 5-year-old daughter who attends school.  She lives with her daughter in her own home.  With a lot of effort, she was able to acquire her own house.

Diana is a very good mother and housewife who sells all kinds of clothing.  This has enabled her and her daughter to get by in life.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from home.  Her customers come to her whenever they need to buy clothes.  She goes out three days a week: mainly in the mornings as this is when her daughter is in school.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment weekly.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs it because she says that it works out cheaper there.  She has been in this business for two years.

Diana will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing.  She has been a member of her community bank for three loan cycles.  She is her group's president and she likes it because of the help that they have given the group.

Diana's dream is that her daughter will not want for anything.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Silvia, a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic, is the coordinator for her group, Group Dios es mi pastor 5 & 6 (God is my shepherd), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Silvia and her long-time partner live in a batey with their two children. A batey is a small, rural community built by a sugar company to house their field workers. Silvia has a successful business selling used clothes from house to house. Used clothes are very popular in the Dominican Republic, because most of the pieces are in perfect condition and have very good prices. With this new loan, her fifth from Esperanza International, she will buy two bags of used clothes.

Silvia's main goal is to build a concrete roof for her house. She thanks you for lending!

loans.use: to buy two bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Vernia María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Amistad se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Vernia, tiene 61 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  cuatro hijos todos mayores  de edad, uno de sus hijos aún vive en su casa, aunque ya está casado vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, toldos, entre otras cosas. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, ella sale a recorrer todos los  días pero solo en las mañanas ya que a esta hora es mucho más fresco el día, deja  sus productos a crédito y cobra por cada 8 días, su mercadería la va a comprar cada vez que necesita a Santo Domingo ya que allá le sale más barata la mercadería, lleva más de cinco años en este negocio y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar ropa de todo tipo y sabanas. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad que le han brindado en el Banco para recibir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para ir a realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The 'La Amistad' (Friendship) community bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta.  This city is known as 'Calceta la sin par' (Calceta, the city with no equal) owing to the beauty of its women and because, so far as its residents are concerned, there is no more beautiful city in the world.

Here we meet Vernia.  She is 61 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  The couple have four children who are all adults.  One of her children still lives at home though he is already married.  He lives with his wife and children.  Vernia's husband is a farmer.

In addition to being a great housewife, in order to earn some money of her own, Vernia sells all kinds of clothing, sheets, canopies and other products.  She makes her sales door to door and to order.  She goes out every day but only in the mornings as the day is much cooler at that time.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment weekly.  She buys her merchandise in Santo Domingo whenever she needs it as it works out cheaper there.  She has been in this business for more than five years and it is doing fairly well.

Vernia will use this loan to buy all kinds of clothing and sheets.  She has been a member of her community bank for two loan cycles and she likes it because of the opportunity that they have given her to receive loans. 

Vernia's dream is to buy a car in which to work.

loans.use: to buy clothing and sheets

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa de 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Efraín de 49 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarle un mejor provenir. Blanca y su esposo son el sostén de sus hijos. Blanca desde muy niña trabajó en las tierras de sus padres y hoy es toda una conocedora del labor que se realiza en el campo, es campesina y cuenta con un terreno donde tiene cultivado plantas de cacao, y otras plantas nativas de la zona selvática. Viene trabajando 25 años y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y del apoyo de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de Santa Rosa; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es hacer el mantenimiento de cacao como: desyerbar, fertilizar sus cultivos; para que siga obteniendo mejores cosechas. Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP y está contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo financiero. En su banco comunal se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus pagos puntualmente.  Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar abono para hacer el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y con el resto contratará peones para desyerbar los desmontes.
texts.en:
Blanca is from the town of Santa Rosa.  She is 46 years old and a hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband, 49-year-old Efraín, and their three beloved children who she would like to provide with a better future.  Blanca and her husband provide for their children.

Since she was very young, Blanca worked on her parents' land.  Now she is really knowledgeable about agricultural work.  She is a farmer and has a plot of land where she grows cacao plants and other native rain-forest plants.  She has been working for 25 years and, at harvest time, she has the support of her children and laborers who help her to pick her fruit more quickly.  What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting her fruit as this is when she feels that the months of hard work are providing their reward, in the quality of her fruit.  She considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products from the farm to the warehouse centers which are located in the town of Santa Rosa.  This is where they offer her the best price for her produce.  Right now, Blanca's main priority is caring for her cacao by weeding and fertilizing her crops so that she can enjoy better harvests.

This will be Blanca's eighth loan from MFP and she is happy to know that she will, once again, have financial support.  She pledges to continue making her repayments punctually through her community bank.  Blanca will use her 1,000 soles to buy manure with which to maintain her crops.  She will use the rest to hire laborers to weed her clearings.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire laborers

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Amistad se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a don Juan, tiene 34 años de edad, está separado y de esta relación que tuvo tiene un hijo de 11 años el mismo que  estudia en escuela. El y su hijo viven en la casa de sus padres.

Él para ganar el sustento diario se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y también a la agricultura, tiene cultivos de cacao y maíz, siembra en toda época del año ya que cuenta con bombas de agua para poder regar sus cultivos en toda época del año. En cuanto a la ropa su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, el sale a recorrer los fines de semana días en los cuales entrega y cobra ya que el resto de la semana se dedica a sus cultivos, la mercadería la entrega a crédito y cobra por cada 8 días, su mercadería la va a comprar cada vez que necesita a Guayaquil y a Huaquillas,  lleva más de seis años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar ropa de todo tipo y abonos para los cultivos. Esta desde el segundo ciclo que se formó el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad que le han brindado en el Banco para recibir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un carro para ir a realizar sus recorridos y tener una muy buena producción
texts.en:
The 'La Amistad' community bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta.  This city is known as 'Calceta la sin par' (Calceta, the city with no equal) owing to the beauty of its women and because, so far as its residents are concerned, there is no more beautiful city in the world.

Here we meet 34-year-old Juan.  He is separated and has an 11-year-old son from his relationship.  His son attends school.  Juan and his son live in his parents' house.

In order to make a living, Juan sells all kinds of clothing and also farms.  He grows cacao and corn.  He grows all year round as he has water pumps which enable him to irrigate his crops year round.  As regards his clothing business, he makes his sales door to door and also to order.  He goes out to sell his products and collect payment on weekends as he is working with his crops during the rest of the week.  He delivers his merchandise on credit and collects payment weekly.  He buys his merchandise in Guayaquil and Huaquillas whenever he needs to.  He has been in this business for more than six years and it is doing very well.

Juan will use this loan to buy all kinds of clothing and fertilizers for his crops.  This is his second loan cycle as a member of his community bank and he enjoys it because of the opportunity that they have given him to receive loans.  

Juan's dreams are to own a car which he can use for his work and to enjoy good production.

loans.use: to buy clothes and fertilizer

loans.name: Leticia María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Amistad se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leticia, tiene 42 años de edad está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 19, 17, 15 y 9 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en Universidad, uno en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es médico.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa de todo tipo, Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda de vestir, ella sale a recorrer tres días a la semana y a veces los sábados, deja a crédito y cobra en dos o tres partes, su mercadería la va a comprar cada vez que necesita a Guayaquil y también le envían desde España donde tiene familiares que le envían todo tipo de mercadería, lleva tres años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar zapatos, pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa de niños. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y responsable.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para recorrer sus productos.
texts.en:
The 'La Amistad' (Friendship) community bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta which is known as 'Calceta la sin par' (Calceta, the city with no equal) owing to the beauty of its women and because, so far as its residents are concerned, there is no more beautiful city in the world.

Here we meet Leticia.  She is 42 years old, married, and has four children aged 19, 17, 15 and 9.  Her two eldest are in college, one is in high school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a doctor.

Leticia is a very good mother and housewife who sells shoes and all kinds of clothing.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from home.  Her customers come to her house when they need to buy clothes.  Leticia goes out three days a week and sometimes on Saturdays as well.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment in two or three installments.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs it and also receives some from Spain where she has family members who send her all kinds of merchandise.  She has been in this business for three years and it is doing very well.

Leticia will use this loan to buy shoes, pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothes.  She has been a member of her community bank from the beginning and she likes it because the group is very united and responsible.

Leticia's dream is to buy a car which she can use to transport her products.

loans.use: to buy shoes, pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: La señora Amanda es propietaria de un taller de confecciones ubicado en un espacio de su casa en el cual elabora y comercializa ropa interior para niño y niña. La señora Amanda genera tres empleos directos y cuenta ya con varios años de experiencia en este oficio. Actualmente, la señora Amanda esta separada del padre de sus dos hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad, por lo que tiene que trabajar arduamente para generar los ingresos para su familia. La señora Amanda requiere con urgencia de la compra de una maquina estampadora que le permita terminar a tiempo su producción de fin año y cumplirle a sus clientes con los pedidos. A futuro el sueño de la señora Amanda es tener muchas más maquinas para generar más empleos directos.
texts.en: Amanda owns a dressmaking workshop which is located in her home.  Here she makes and sells children's underwear.  Amanda creates three direct jobs and has several years experience in this business.  She is currently separated from the father of her two children, who are 11 and 7 years old, and so she has to work hard to make income for her family.  Amanda urgently needs to buy a stamping machine which will allow her to complete her end-of-year production on time and fill her customers' orders.  Amanda's dream for the future is to have many more machines so that she can create more direct jobs.

loans.use: to buy a stamping machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and grow potatoes

loans.name: Wendy Pamela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Amistad se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Wendy, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 7 años de edad el mismo que estudia en  escuela. Actualmente está en su sexto mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. Su marido es dueño de un taxi en el cual trabaja.

Ella en sociedad con su esposo, además de su taxi tienen una sala de entretenimiento, en el cual jóvenes y adultos se distraen un momento y se desestresan del trabajo o de sus estudios, ella trabaja todos los días en este local el mismo que es alquilado ya que aún no han podido comprar un  local propio, allí también ella vende refrescos, sodas y bocadillos,  además de videojuegos, lleva seis años con su negocio y les va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar sodas, jugos y bocadillos. Lleva tres ciclos en el  Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de gran ayuda.

Su sueño es tener un local propio para no tener que pagar arriendos.
texts.en:
The 'La Amistad' (Friendship) community bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta.  This city is known as 'Calceta la sin par' (Calceta, the city with no equal) owing to the beauty of its women and because, so far as its residents are concerned, there is no more beautiful city in the world.

Here we meet Wendy.  She is 25 years old, married, and has a 7-year-old son who is in school.  She is currently six months pregnant with her second child.  Her husband owns a taxi in which he works.

Wendy works in partnership with her husband.  In addition to the taxi, they also have an entertainment center where young people and adults can have fun and de-stress from their work or their studies.  Wendy works there every day.  The premises are rented as they have not yet been able to buy premises of their own.  Wendy also sells soft drinks, soda, sandwiches and video games there.  She has been in her business for six years and it is doing very well.

Wendy has been a member of her community bank for three loan cycles.  She is the bank's secretary and she likes it because they loans are quick and very helpful.

Wendy's dream is to own her own premises so that she no longer has to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice and sandwiches

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 52 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Manuel está solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de semillas de maíz, ya que es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Jose aumentara la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, para que al ingerirlos sus clientes no corran peligro de adquirir alguna enfermedad. 

Y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes, alcanzara la meta de venta que se ha propuesto para cada mes. Y además dará a abasto con todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su numerosa familia.

Manuel es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 52-year-old man who lives with his family in a community in the southern zone of Costa Rica, in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on agricultural and livestock production, particularly the growing of tubers, coffee, corn and beans, and livestock raising.

Manuel is requesting a loan for 500,000 colones so that he can care for his crops, buying fertilizer and fungicide to protect his corn seed crops as it is a reliable and sustainable choice.  With these fertilizers, Manuel will increase the soil's capacity to absorb different nutritional elements.  He will use the fungicides to avoid fungus appearing on his plantations so that his customers will not risk ingesting them and becoming ill.

In this way, Manuel will provide good-quality produce to his customers.  He will reach the sales goal that he has set out for each month.  He will also be able to meet his obligations and payments so that he can provide for his large family.

Manuel is a member of the Danta community loan company, one of 150 community loan companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides for growing corn

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo, de 44 años; es un hombre trabajador; vive en su propia casa y trabaja arduamente para poder tener un buen futuro. La actividad a la que se dedica Cirilo es la de fabricar muebles en su carpintería ubicada en la ciudad de Santa Rosa. Cirilo lleva 25 años elaborando todo tipo de muebles como: camas, mesas, sillas, roperos, etc. La gente de su localidad lo conoce por sus buenos trabajos que realiza. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder elaborar con mucha dedicación, ya que desde muy pequeño aprendió a conocer el trabajo de la carpintería; considera que lo más difícil es cuando se le termina la madera y a veces se retraza un poco en la entrega de su trabaj. Por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la institución MFP, para que pueda seguir trabajando comprando maderas para elaborar muebles.  Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP, está dispuesto a seguir cumpliendo con sus cuotas puntualmente. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles podrá comprar madera para realizar su trabajo elaborando muebles como: camas, mesas, sillas, entre otros.
texts.en:
44-year-old Cirilo is a hard-working man who lives in his own home and works hard so that he can enjoy a good future.  Cirilo makes furniture in his carpentry workshop which is located in the town of Santa Rosa.  He has spent the last 25 years making all kinds of furniture such as beds, tables, chairs, wardrobes, etc.  The people in his town know him for the good work that he does.  What he most enjoys about his work is being able to make his products with a lot of dedication as he learned the carpentry trade when he was very young.  He considers the most difficult part of his work to be when he runs out of wood and then becomes a little late in delivering his products.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from MFP, so that he can continue working, buying wood with which to make furniture.

This will be Cirilo's eighth loan from MFP and he is prepared to continue making his repayments on time.  He will use his 3,000 soles to buy wood so that he can carry out his work, making furniture such as beds, tables, chairs, etc.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Alejandro Bienvenido

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive don Alejandro, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 9, 8 y 2 años, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. La mujer se dedica a las labores de la casa.

Él para poder llevar lo necesario a su hogar desde pequeño se dedica a las faenas de la pesca, cuenta que desde hace 12 años con los ahorros que tenia y con ayuda de sus padres pudo adquirir una lancha en la cual realiza sus actividades de pesca, el junto a otra persona se embarcan en la noche y no regresan sino hasta el otro dia con los frutos que el mar les ha dado, para luego entregar estos productos a comerciantes que llegan hasta este lugar para llevar el pescado a otras ciudades.
 
Este crédito es para comprar materiales de pesca y combustibles elementos indispensables para realizar sus faenas diarias. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad de recibir los créditos. 

Sus deseos son siempre tener buena pesca y que no les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Jaime Roldos communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo (Manta) canton.  This place is know for its beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Most of the inhabitants here are very hard-workers, and they dedicate themselves to tasks related to the sea.

Alejandro, age 29, lives here.  He is in a common-law-marriage, and he has three children; ages nine, eight, and two.  The two older ones go to school.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores.

In order to bring home the necessities for his household he has, ever since he was little, devoted himself to fishing.  He says that 12 years ago he used the savings he had, and with help from his parents, he was able to get a small boat.  He uses the boat to fish.  Together with another person he embarks in the night and does not return until the next day with the fruits that the sea has given him.  He then delivers these products to merchants who come to this place to take the fish to other cities.
