This loan is to buy fishing materials and indispensable fuel in order to carry out his everyday business activities.  He has been in the bank since its beginning, and he likes it because of the opportunity to receive loans.

His dreams are always to have good fishing and that his children will lack for nothing.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and fuel.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Fabián, de 43 años, natural de Santa Rosa, vive en casa propia con su esposa Celsa de 41 años, padres de 02 hijos, Karina de 17 años y Ana de 13 años, quienes son la felicidad de su hogar. Fabián, es un hombre de mucho provecho, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo es labrar la tierra, pues es campesino y cuenta con un terreno en la cual tiene cultivos de  cacao y café. Viene trabajando 16 años y es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el agro; Fabián en tiempos de cosecha busca el apoyo de los jornaleros para que le apoyen en las extracciones de los frutos. Sus plantas más rentables son: los granos de cacao y café, por lo cual las empresas acopiadoras le pagan muy bien por cada kilogramo. El problema de su trabajo radica en, no poder combatir con los insectos quienes dañan los frutos de las plantas. Con el crédito solicitado priorizará en comprar plantas de cacao para incrementar  sus cultivos y así pueda aumentar su producción. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, por tanto agradece su colaboración para seguir trabajando. En su banco comunal es puntual con sus pagos y se siente alegre por trabajar con personas responsables. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles podrá comprar plantas de cacao para incrementar  sus cultivos y así pueda aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Fabián is 43 and a native of Santa Rosa. He lives in his own house with his wife of 41 years, Celsa. They are the parents of two children, 17 year old Karina and 13 year old Ana, who bring happiness to the house.

Fabián is a high-functioning man. He puts a lot of care into the work he does. His job is working the land, since he is a country person and has a field where he cultivates cacao and coffee. He has been working for 16 years and he knows the meaning of hard work in agriculture. During the harvest, Fabian looks for the support of day laborers who can help him with fruit picking. His most profitable crops are coffee and cacao beans, which gathering companies pay very well for per kilogram. The problem with his work stems from the fact that he cannot fight the insects that want to hurt the fruits from the plants. 

With the requested loan he will prioritize the purchase of cacao plants in order to boost his crops and thereby increase his production. This will be his second loan with MFP, and he is very grateful for their collaboration, which allows him to continue working. At his communal bank he is punctual in his payments, and he feels happy to work with responsible people. With the 3,000 nuevos soles he will be able to buy cacao plants to boost his crops and thereby increase his production.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants.

loans.name: Tauva

texts.en:
Tauva is 39 years old, married, and has five children. Tauva bakes and sells cakes in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Tauva needs a loan of 1,500 WST to to purchase flour,sugar,baking powder , cooking oil and baking pans. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tauva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tauva's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase flour,sugar,baking powder , cooking oil and baking pans

loans.name: Bella Virginia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bella, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, algunos están comprometidos pero aun viven en su casa, uno de sus hijos sufre de diabetes al igual que su esposo el cual ya no trabaja por lo mismo.

Ella para ganarse su sustento diario y así con esto sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de fundas de hielo y helados, los mismos que a veces ella prepara o compra en una fábrica de la localidad, este pequeño negocio lo tiene en su casa desde hace varios años y es con esto se ha ayudado para salir adelante, en la actualidad desde hace tres meses también está preparando almuerzos pero solos los fines de semana,  le está yendo muy bien en este negocio y está obteniendo buenas ganancias.

Este crédito es para comprar fundas plásticas, helados y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda. 

Ella está repitiendo su crédito en el Banco ya que con el  que recibió logro comprar ciertas cosas necesarias para poner el negocio de comida el cual le está dejando buenas ganancias, con lo cual ha mejorado su vida.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida diaria.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Jaime Roldos meets every fortnight in Jaramijo Canton (Manta). This area is known for the beautiful beaches that surround its coasts. The majority of the residents are very hard working and much of their work is related to the sea. 

It is here that we meet Señora Bella. She is 52 years old, married and she has 6 grown-up children. Some of them are engaged but still living at home. One of her children suffers from diabetes, as does her husband who no longer works for this reason.

To earn a living and get her family ahead in life she sells bags of ice and ice cream that she sometimes makes herself or else buys at a local factory. She’s had this small, home-based business for several years now and she’s used it to help get ahead. For the past three months she has also been making lunches, but only at the weekend. This business is going very well for her and she is making good profits.

This loan is for buying plastic bags, ice cream and supplies for preparing her food. She is the founding member of the Communal Bank and she likes it because the loans are a great source of help.

She is taking another loan with the bank as with her previous one she managed to buy the necessary things to start her food business, which is delivering good profits and improving her life.

Her dream is to get ahead in her business and daily life.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, ice cream and supplies.

loans.name: Apaula

texts.en:
Apaula is 58 years of age and is married, with four children.
Apaula owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of products in the local community. She has two years' experience in this business.    Apaula needs a loan of WST 1500 to to pay for  box of noodles,soft drinks,cigarette, lollies, snacks , can fish and mutton flaps. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 300 or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Apaula joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Apaula 's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to pay for  box of noodles,soft drinks,cigarette, lollies, snacks , can fish and mutton flaps

loans.name: Gloria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de  13, 11, 7 años y  un bebé de 10 meses  de edad, la mayor estudian en colegio y los dos que siguen en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que además de cuidar de su hogar trabaja en una empresa de la localidad, pero también para generar más ingresos se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja en la empresa y los fines de semana se dedica a sus ventas, las cuales las realiza puerta a puerta y también les vende a sus compañeros del trabajo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene tres años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es compra otra lancha para su esposo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Jaime Roldos meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo (Manta) canton, this place is known for its beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Here, the majority of inhabitants are very hard-working and work in tasks of the sea.

In this place we met Gloria, she is 33 years old, married, and from this relationship has four children.  The children are 13, 11, and 7 years old and a baby that is ten months old.  The eldest is in high school and the next two are in school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a very hard-working woman since besides taking care of her household she works at a factory in town.  Also, to generate more income she sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies accessories).  She works everyday - Monday through Friday she works at the factory and on weekends she sells her products.  She sells the products door to door and she also sells them to co-workers.  She sells on credit and then collects every fifteen days.  She has been selling products for three years and it has been going very well for her.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.  This is the fourth cycle at the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to buy another boat for her husband.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Phillipa

texts.en:
Phillipa is 21 years of age and is married, with one child.
Phillipa owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty hand-woven products to tourists and local community members. She has one year of experience in this business. Phillipa needs a loan of WST 1,000 to to purchase more pandana leaves. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 250, or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Phillipa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Phillipa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase more pandana leaves

loans.name: Edith Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Edith, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 10 y 2 años de edad, los tres mayores  estudian dos en colegio y uno en escuela. El marido es carpintero.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja los últimos tres días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella aprovecha las ofertas que hay ya que estas le dejan mejores ganancias por que luego vende a precio normal, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos. Tiene tres  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The communal bank Jaime Roldos meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo (Manta) canton, this place is known for its beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Here, the majority of inhabitants are very hard-working and work in tasks of the sea.

In this place lives Edith, she is 33 years old and is in a common law marriage with four children.  The children are 14, 12, 10 and 2 years old.  The three eldest are in high school and one is in school.  The husband is a carpenter.

She is a housewife and to have her own resources she sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies accessories).  She sells door to door the last three days of the week.  She sells her products on credit and collects every eight days.  She takes advantage of the special offers and then makes a bigger profit by selling these products at normal price later on.  The best selling items are the perfumes and cosmetics.  She has been selling these products for three years and it has been going very well for her.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and miscellaneous items.  This is the fourth cycle at the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and miscellaneous goods.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

La señora Flor es socia fundadora del Banco comunal es la secretaria del Banco y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 24 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tiene tres hijas de 6, 4 y 1 años de edad, la mayor  estudian en  escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo tenga los recursos necesarios para poder realizar un gran trabajo,  el junto a otra persona se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, salen en la madrugada y regresan  al otro dia para luego entregar los peces a comerciantes que llegan hasta la playa misma. También utiliza una parte del crédito para surtir una pequeña tienda de víveres que tiene en su casa, lleva dos años con su tienda y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y víveres para surtir su tienda.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran barco y que su tienda sea mucho más grande y surtida.
texts.en:
The communal bank Jaime Roldos meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo (Manta) canton, this place is known for its beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Here, the majority of inhabitants are very hard-working and work in tasks of the sea.

Flor is a founding member of the communal bank and is the secretary of the bank.  She likes the bank because interest rates are lower than other credit institutions.  She is 24 years old and is in a common law marriage.  Together they have three daughters aged 6, 4, and 1.  The eldest is in school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  

She is a great housewife who wants the loan so that her husband will have the necessary resources to accomplish a great feat.  Her husband and another person will go out to the high seas in their tiny vessel to accomplish their sea tasks.  They leave at dawn and return the following day to deliver the fish to merchants who come to the beach.  She also uses a part of the loan to stock a tiny store with provisions that she has in her home.   She has had this store for two years and it has been going very well for her.

This loan is to buy nets, rope, fuel, and provisions to stock her store.

Her dreams are to have a big boat and that her store be much bigger and better stocked.

loans.use: to buy nets, rope, fuel and provisions.

loans.name: Mujeres De Choxbajan Group

texts.es:
La señora Marcela es casada, tiene 43 43 años de edad, cursó el quinto grado de educación primaria,tiene 2 hijos, se dedica al crianza de animales domésticos, cerdos y pollos de engorde, inicio este negocio con un capital pequeño y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia.

organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de pollos de engorde y cerdos, así mismo, la alimentación de los mismos, espera en el futuro tener una negocio grande. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la agricultura, a la crianza de animales, la artesanía y al comercio.
texts.en:
Marcela is married and is 43 years old. She attended primary school up to the 5th grade. She has two children. She makes a living breeding domestic animals, such as pigs and chickens. She started this business with a small amount of money and has six years of experience so far. 

She organizes a group to apply for a loan which she will use to purchasing chickens and pigs, as well as animal feed for them. She hopes to have a big business in the future. The other members of the group work in agriculture, animal husbandry, crafts, and commerce.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and chickens.

loans.name: San Francisco De Asís Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Graciela de 45 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son dependientes y 2 independientes. Tiene 8 meses siendo socia de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de bebidas como cerveza y gaseosa con el cual lleva 4 años en este negocio.
Comenzó con la venta de gelatinas y helados con la idea de obtener ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades. También se dedica a la venta de juguetes, el cual recién comenzó hace poco tiempo con la finalidad de aumentar sus ingresos. Hasta el momento con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa y aumentar su mercadería. Sus ingresos los destina a los gastos de alimentación y para sus ahorros. Su plan para el futuro es seguir creciendo con su negocio hasta el punto de poder abrir un local propio. Graciela piensa usar el préstamo en la compra de mercadería ya que por campaña navideña sus ventas se incrementan. Ella pertenece a la alcancía comunal “San Francisco de Asís” el cual esta conformado por 7 personas con el cual lleva 8 meses como presidenta del grupo.
texts.en:
Graciela, 45, is single and has four children two of which are independent and two still dependent.  She’s been a member of Edaprospo for 8 months and she sells beverages like beer and soft-drinks, a business she’s had for four years.

She started out selling gelatin snacks and ice-cream with the idea of earning income to cover her needs.  She also sells toys, an activity she started a short time ago aiming at increasing her income.  To date with effort and hard work she’s managed to build a house and increase her merchandise.  She uses her income for food costs and to save.  Her plan for the future is to continue growing in her business until she reaches the point of being able to open her own locale. 

Graciela plans to use the loan to buy merchandise because sales increase during the Christmas season.  She belongs to the “San Francisco de Asís” communal bank which has 7 members; she’s been President of the group for 8 months.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 32 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora, convive con Víctor de 36 años y tienen 04 hijos y juntos habitan en su propio hogar donde reina la armonía. Gloria, trabaja arduamente desde hace 06 años, abrió una tienda de abarrotes, en donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Su puesto le genera buenas ganancias económicas, ella abre las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas en espera de sus primeros compradores. Menciona que la clave de captar consumidores es atender amablemente y apoyarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes. Si embargo, lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. En su negocio le va muy bien ya que gracias a ello  puede solventar con los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará suministros en cantidad para su puesto de ventas; con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su  bodega. Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP  y esta contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar con su trabajo. En su banco comunal es responsable y solidaria con sus compañeros. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará suministros en cantidad para su puesto de ventas como: arroz, azúcar, conservas, bebidas, etc.
texts.en:
Gloria, 32, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with Víctor, 36, and they have four children.  They all live together in their own home where harmony reigns.  Gloria has been working hard the last six years.  She opened a grocery store where she offers a variety of basic staple items.  Her stand generates good economic profits.  She opens her business’ doors very early in the morning awaiting her first customers.  She mentions that the key to capturing consumers is to treat them kindly and support them in their purchases.  What she most enjoys about her work is satisfying her customers.  She’s been in business six years and considers the most difficult part having to remain standing all day.  She does well in her store and thanks to it she’s been able to pay her children’s educational costs.

She will use the requested money to buy stock items in quantity for her sales stand.  In time she hopes to enlarge her store.

This will be her MFP loan #8 and she’s happy to know that she’ll have financial support to continue with her work.  She is a responsible, supportive member of her communal bank.  She will use the 1000 new soles to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, canned goods, beverages, etc. in quantity for her stand.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Tafaoga

texts.en:
Tafaoga is 29 years of age and is married, with three children.

Tafaoga owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Tafaoga needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 750, or US $313 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tafaoga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tafaoga's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Natalia Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señora Natalia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive en un hermoso lugar de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera de mayor importancia del país, por su actividad económica, tiene una gran riqueza cultural, gastronómica, su gente es amable y mantiene las tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora. Natalia tiene 21 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una niña de 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora en una panadería, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Ella se dedica al comercio informal, vende cobijas, edredones, sabanas y mas mercadería, esta actividad la realiza hace un año y medio, hace 6 meses labora también ejerciendo su profesión que es la de oficial de enfermería.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito el mismo que lo va a invertir en la compra de cobijas, sabanas y edredones para crecer en su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Natalia is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Victorious Women) communal bank.  She lives in a beautiful place in the city of Cuenca.  This city is the country’s third most important because of its economic activity.  It has great cultural and gastronomic riches.  Its people are kind and maintain their parents’ traditions.

Natalia is 21 years old, married and has a 2-year-old daughter.  Her husband works in a bakery.  She does not own a house, she is a renter.

She is an informal merchant; she sells blankets, comforters, sheets and other merchandise.  She’s been in this business a year and a half and six months ago also started working in her profession which is nursing.

This is her fourth loan and she will use it to buy blankets, sheets and comforter to expand her business.  Her goal is to have a locale to sell her merchandise in.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es: Jesusa, de 30 años de edad, madre de 02 hijos por quienes vela a diario y en futuro prometedor hacer de ellos hombres de bien, ella esta casada con Valerio de 38 años y cuentan con casa propia situada en la localidad de Santa Rosa. Jesusa abrió su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes, empezó vendiendo sus productos en la casa de sus padres y con el transcurso del tiempo más sus ahorros acumulados compró su propio lote de terreno donde actualmente se sitúa la bodega de la señora Jesusa. Ella es una mujer de mucho trabajo que lleva 03 años en la actividad que realiza y señala que uno logra su propósito a base de paciencia. Hoy se siente a gusto con la actividad que realiza y con los buenos ingresos que obtiene, es mas ella tiene casi todo de los productos lo que sus clientes requieren y a esto sumarle el detalle que ella las pone y la buena atención al cliente y hace que la bodega de Jesusa sea tan concurrida pues no hay cliente que no desearía  ir a comprarle una migaja de sus productos. Ella necesita el crédito para seguir prosperando y prestando buen servicio a sus consumidores. Necesita comprar productos de abarrotes para su negocio y sabe que lo logrará gracias al apoyo de los financistas. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP, por ello agradece a los financistas quien les  le brinda ese apoyo de seguir trabajando. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará, productos de abarrotes como: conservas, variedades de bebidas (gaseosas), verduras, entre otros.
texts.en:
Jesusa, 30, is the mother of two children that she watches over daily and hopes to make into upstanding citizens in the future.  She’s married to Valerio, 38, and they have their own house located in 
Santa Rosa. 

Jesusa opened her own business, a grocery store, selling products in her parents’ house and as time passed used her accumulated savings to buy her own lot where she currently has built her store.  She is a very hardworking woman who has had this activity for three years and she points out that one can reach one’s goal based on lots of patience.  Today, she feels good about the activity she carries out and with the good income she earns.  In fact, she stocks almost everything her customers need and when you add the good customer service Jesusa provides this makes her store one of the most popular since there isn’t any customer who wouldn’t want to come by to purchase even the smallest crumb from her.

She needs the loan to continue making progress and providing good service to her consumers.  She needs to buy more groceries for her store and knows that she’ll be able to accomplish this thanks to support from the lenders.  This will be MFP loan #5 and she is grateful to the lenders who provide this support so that she can stay in business.  She will use the 1000 new soles to buy groceries like: canned goods, assorted beverages (soft-drinks) and vegetables, among others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Aida Yanina

texts.es:
La Señora Aída es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive en un hermoso lugar de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera de mayor importancia del país, por su actividad económica, tiene una gran riqueza cultural, gastronómica, su gente es amable y mantiene las tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Aída tiene 31 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 12 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión pintor, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad. 

La Señora. Aída se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas, esta actividad la realiza hace 8 años y hace apenas 6 meses también labora como cocinera en un negocio de su mamá.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana. Su primer crédito lo va a invertir para iniciar en la venta de chuzos (carne en palito) y comida rápida va a comprar carne, papas, salchichas y otros víveres.

Su meta es terminar su casa y comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Aída is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Successful Women) communal bank.  She lives in a beautiful place in the city of Cuenca.  This city is the country’s third most important because of its economic activity.  It has great cultural and gastronomic riches.  Its people are kind and maintain their parents’ traditions.

Aída is 31 years old, married and has three children who are 14, 12 and 2 years old.  Her first two children attend a school in the city.  Her husband is a painter by profession and the house they live in is theirs.

Aída sells cosmetics of various brands; she’s been in business 8 years and just six months ago started working as a cook in a business of her mother’s.

This is the first loan she’s taken with the communal bank which she was invited to join by her sister.  She will use her first loan to start selling ‘chuzos’ (skewered meat) and fast food.  She will buy meat, potatoes, sausages and other foodstuffs.  Her goal is to finish building her house and to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy meat, potatoes, sausages and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 32 years of age and is married, with three children.

Sina owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Sina needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 250, or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Sina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sina's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Elizabeth Pilar

texts.es:
La Señora. Elizabeth es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive en un hermoso lugar de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera de mayor importancia del país, por su actividad económica, tiene una gran riqueza cultural, gastronómica, su gente es amable y mantiene las tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora. Elizabeth tiene 24 años, es madre soletera de un niño de 4 años de edad, vive con sus padres quienes son comerciantes en una casa arrendada.
  
Ella al igual que sus padres se dedica al comercio, vende toda clase de ropa y trabaja de lunes a sábados sin horario fijo, su mercadería vende recorriendo la ciudad.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermanal. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de blusas, pantalones, camisetas y ropa de niños para surtir su negocio.
 
Su meta es  tener una boutique.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Successful Women) communal bank.  She lives in a beautiful place in the city of Cuenca.  This city is the country’s third most important because of its economic activity.  It has great cultural and gastronomic riches.  Its people are kind and maintain their parents’ traditions.

Elizabeth is 24 years old and the single mother of a 4-year-old son.  She lives with her parents who are merchants in a rented house.

She and her parents are merchants.  She sells all sorts of clothes and works Monday through Saturday with no fixed schedule.  She sells her merchandise throughout the city.

This is the first loan she’ll take out with the communal bank that she was invited to join by her sister.  She will use the loan to buy blouses, pants, t-shirts and children’s clothes to stock her business.  Her goal is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en:
Tasi is 54 years of age and is married, with seven children.

Tasi is engaged in a plantation business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has four years of experience in this business. Tasi  needs a loan of WST 2,800 to purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxone. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 300, or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Tasi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tasi 's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxone.

loans.name: Mujeres De Choxbajan Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Veronica es casada, tiene 24 años  de edad, cursó  los 5 años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la venta de artículos de costura, a la mercería, vende hilos de diferentes clases, telas para blusas, adornos para delantales, entre otros. Inició este negocio con un capital pequeño ya hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de mercería para su negocio, consistente en hilos de alta ceda, hilos carrizo, adornos para delantales, cipers, y entre otros productos. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio, agricultura, y a la agropecuario.
texts.en:
Verónica, 24, is married.  She attended fifth grade in elementary school.  She has a son.  She sells sewing supplies and notions.  She sells various kinds of thread, fabric for blouses, decorations for aprons, among others.  She started the business with a small amount of capital and to date has four years’ experience.  Her husband, who is a merchant, supports her efforts.

She organized a group to request a loan that will help her buy merchandise consisting of high-quality silk thread, wicker thread, decorations for aprons, zippers, among other products for her business.  The rest of the members are merchants, farmers and raise livestock.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ligia Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Ligia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es desde 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, Cuenca es muy rica en historia, cultura y tradiciones, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Ligia tiene 37 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 6 hijos  de 22, 19, 17, 14, 12 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo es soltero, su segunda hija es casada y viven independientemente, su tercer hijo trabaja, dos de sus hijos están estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. ligia se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa usada encontrándose en esta actividad hace 13 años, también vende ropa nueva pero solo bajo pedido hace seis meses, su mercadería la vende recorriendo la ciudad en su tiempo libre,. También se dedica a la limpieza de una casa actividad en la que labora medio día.

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa usada para crecer en su negocio. 

Su meta es llegar a tener su propio capital y no tener que pedir prestado.
texts.en:
Ligia is a member of the “Mujeres Luchadoras” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that has been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity since 1999.  Cuenca is very rich in history, culture and traditions.  It has a varied cuisine and its residents maintain the culture and tradition of its peoples.

Ligia is 37 years old living in a common law relationship and has 6 children who are 22, 19, 17, 14, 12 and 7 years old.  Her oldest son is single, her next daughter is married and they live independently.  Her third son works, two of her children are attending secondary school and her youngest attends a local little elementary school.  Her husband works as a private employee.  She does not own a house, she rents.

Ligia sells all types of used clothes; she’s been in business 13 years.  She’s also been selling new clothes for the last six months but only on prior order.  She sells her merchandise throughout the city in her free time.  She also works half days cleaning a house.

This is the third loan she’s taken in the communal bank and will use it to buy used clothes to increase her business.  Her goal is to have her own capital and not have to ask for loans.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Seleisa

texts.en:
Seleisa is 37 years of age, married, and has eight children.

Seleisa runs a plantation business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has four years of experience in this business.   Seleisa needs a loan of WST $1,750 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Seleisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks.  This is Seleisa's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Sandra Maricela

texts.es:
La Señora Sandra es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es desde 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, Cuenca es muy rica en historia, cultura y tradiciones, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Sandra tiene 41 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 17, 12 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

La Señora. Sandra trabaja en la elaboración de todo tipo de tejidos, esta actividad la realiza en sus tiempos libres y vende a sus amigas y conocidas. También labora en la atención de una tienda de comestibles, esta actividad la desempeña hace un año y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.
 
Este es su segundo crédito en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda.

Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the “Mujeres Luchadoras” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that has been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity since 1999.  Cuenca is very rich in history, culture and traditions.  It has a varied cuisine and its residents maintain the culture and tradition of its peoples.

Sandra is 41 years old, married and has three children who are 17, 12 and 2 years old.  Her first two children attend a local secondary school. Her husband works as a security guard.  They don’t own a house, they rent.

Sandra works making all sorts of woven items in her free time; she sells them to her friends and acquaintances.  She also works tending to a small grocery store that she’s had for the last year.  She works Sunday through Sunday from 7 in the morning until 9 at night.

This is the second loan she’s taken in the communal bank and she will use it to buy foodstuffs for her store.  Her goal is to grow more in business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Solema

texts.en:
Solema is 52 years of age, married, and has five children.

Solema runs a plantation business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has four years of experience in this business.  Solema needs a loan of WST $2,400 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and machetes.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Solema joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks.  This is Solema's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Los Innovadores Group

texts.es:
LOS INNOVADORES  es un grupo formado  en el distrito de Ventanilla Callao,  lo integran 07  socias una de ellas es la Sra. Judith  que tiene su negocio  de comidas a base de pescado,  fue su hermana quien le dio la idea de vender ese tipo de alimento, debido a que en la zona por donde  vive  nadie vendía  ese tipo de comida,  empezó preparando pocas porciones y con poco capital la puerta de su casa fue el lugar ideal por estar ubicada en una zona transitada , con una mesa y algunas sillas empezó lo que hoy es  su propio negocio, los platos que prepara y que tienen más demanda son pescado frito, chicharrón de pescado y bebidas. La mayoría de sus clientes le compran para llevar ya es conocida por el lugar y cada día  le va mejor es así que puede cubrir algunas necesidades de su familia comprar algunos artefactos y mejorar sus utensilios para una mejor atención, su meta más próxima es habilitar un lugar más amplio dentro de su casa para poner su negocio y así brindar más comodidad a su clientela, el préstamo obtenido le será de mucha ayuda para comprar bebidas gaseosas debido a la cercanía del verano este producto tiene mucha demanda y quiere comprar por cantidad para tener en reserva.

*Judith  viste polo rojo es la quinta persona de la derecha.
texts.en:
“Los Innovadores” (The Innovators) is a group formed in Ventanilla District in Callao.  It has 7 members.  One of them is Judith who sells meals based on fish.  Her sister gave her the idea of selling this type of food because no one sold this type of food in the zone where they live.  She started out preparing just a few portions with little capital.  She sold at her doorstep since her house is located in a place with many passersby.  She set up a table and a few chairs and started what today is her own business.  

The dishes she prepares that are the most sought-after are: fried fish, ‘chicharrón de pescado’ [deep fried breaded fish filets] and beverages.  Most of her customers buy food to go.  She’s well known in the area and every day she does better and is able to cover some of her family’s needs buying some appliances and improving her utensils to provide better service.  Her near-term goal is to set up a more spacious locale inside her house to set up her business and provide more comfort for her customers.

The loan obtained will be of much help to buy soft-drinks because summer is near and this product is in high demand and she wants to buy it in quantity to have some in reserve.

*Judith is wearing a red polo shirt and is the fifth person on the right.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Taume

texts.en:
Taume is 43 years of age and is married with nine children.

Taume runs a fishing business, catching and selling ocean-caught fish.  She has four years of experience in this business.Taume needs a loan of WST $2,500 to purchase a new canoe, a fishing net , spears  and flash light. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Taume joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks.  This is Taume's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a new canoe, a fishing net , spears  and flash light

loans.name: Camilla

texts.en:
Camilla is 28 years of age and is married with 3 children. She runs a plantation business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 2 years of experience in this business. Camilla needs a loan of 1500 WST to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Camilla joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Camilla's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 48 years old and is married with 5 children. She runs a plantation  business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 4 years of experience in this business. Sina needs a loan of 2500 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Sina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sina's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: 5 De Diciembre (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la  ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad de gente honesta y trabajadora con una gran variedad  en su gastronomía, con un clima variable y agradable, cada 15 días se reúnen  los 2 socios y las 10 socias del Banco Comunal 5 de Diciembre. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nevi, tiene 33 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  tres hijos de 11, 9 y 7 años de edad, todos estudian en escuela. Su marido es albañil.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (perfumes, cremas, bisutería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale a recorrer todos los  días pero solo en las mañanas ya que a esta hora es mucho más fresco y sus hijos están en clases, ya en la tarde tiene que ayudar a sus pequeños con sus tareas,  ella deja  sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva siete meses en este negocio y lo que más vende son los perfumes y las cremas.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar perfumes, cremas y bisutería sobre todo productos de oferta ya que luego los vende al precio normal y le queda más ganancias. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.

La foto perqueña adjunta es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is a city with honest and hard-working people, a great variety of cuisine, and a variable and pleasant climate.  The two men and ten women members of the 5 de Diciembre communal bank meet in Portoviejo every two weeks.  The members carry out a number of different business activities like general commerce, services, and others.  They joined their efforts to be able to access the benefits that the Fundación Espoir lends. This is the first cycle of their communal bank.  They hope to complete it very well in order to get ahead in the institution.

This is the place where we meet Nevi, age 33.  She is in a common-law-marriage and has three children; ages 11, 9, and 7.  The children all go to school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  In addition to being a great housewife, she sells Avon products (perfume, creams, jewelry, and women’s accessories) in order to earn something on her own.

She sells door to door, and she goes to work every day.  However, she only works in the mornings because it is much cooler then and her children are in school.  In the afternoons she has to help her little ones with their homework.  She leaves her products on credit, and she collects payments weekly.  She has been in this business for seven months, and the perfumes and creams sell the most.

She will use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, and jewelry.  Above all she will buy products that are on special promotion.  She will later sell them at the normal price, and she will be left with more income.

Her dreams are to get ahead and to give the best to her children.

The attached small photo is a member who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and jewelry.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is 60 years old and is married with four children. Epenesa owns and operates a business selling baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Epenesa needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Epenesa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Epenesa's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is 26-year-old married woman who resides in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Flordeliza runs a business selling seafood products including crabs, fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business four years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for boat repair. In 2011, Flordeliza become a member of GDMPC. In the future, Flordeliza wants to expand her business to gain higher profits.

loans.use: to pay for boat repair.

loans.name: Angel Roberto

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a don Roberto, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos, 4 en un primer compromiso y dos con su actual pareja que son los que viven con él y que estudian en  escuela. Su esposa es comerciante.

El tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como víveres, legumbres, así como papelería y productos de bazar entre otras cosas, allí trabaja su esposa todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 ya en tarde y noche el se hace cargo del negocio ya que en el día el también tiene un carro en el cual trabaja realizando fletes.  Tienen 18 años con este negocio y les va muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, legumbres, artículos de bazar y papelería, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.

Su meta es comprar otro carro ya que el que tienen está un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
The Proyecto 2003 community bank meets every 15 days in Jaramito (Manta), a pretty place known for its beautiful beaches.  Many hard-working local people earn their living from the sea.  

We met Don Roberto, 44, here.  He is married and has 6 children, 4 with his former wife and two with his current wife.  The children live with him.  All the children are in school.  His wife is a merchant.

Don Roberto owns a grocery store where he sells all kinds of everyday products: food, housewares, etc.  His wife manages the business, working there from 6:00am to 8:00pm.  Don Roberto takes over in the afternoons.  During the day, he operates a taxi business.  He has owned the store for 18 years and is happy with his progress.
 
Don Roberto will use this loan to stock his store.  He will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, vegetables, housewares, paper products and other everyday products.  This is his fourth round of funding with the community bank and he likes it because the interest rates are low.

His goal for the future is to buy a new car for his taxi business.

loans.use: to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is married with four children. Bernadette is 24 years old and resides in Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Bernadette owns and operates a home products sales business to earn a living. She's been in this business for one year. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Bernadette is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Bernadette hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married with 2 children. Lilian is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lilian operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years and every month she earns 1,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in her business.

Lilian has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Lilian hopes to finish the study of her children and to gain a double income from her business.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mu

texts.en:
Mu is 38 years of age and is married with 6 children. Mu owns and operates a business venture of raising pigs and chicken for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business.    

Mu needs a loan of WST $1500 to upgrade her business status. She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Mu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Mu's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest and upgrade her animal sales business

loans.name: Sepoleka

texts.en:
Sepoleka is 52 years of age and a widow with 4 children. Sepoleka owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products to the local community. She has 2 years of experience in this business.    

Sepoleka needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2010, Spoleka joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sepoleka's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Loine

texts.en:
Loine is 39 years of age and is married with 6 children. Loine owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business.    

Loine needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase weed-killers, such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Loine joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Loine's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is 27 years of age and is married with 3 children. Nellie owns and operates a business venture, baking and selling a variety of baked goods to the local community. She has 2 years of experience in this business.    

Nellie needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase baking equipment. She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Nellie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Nellie's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Liscel

texts.en:
Liscel is a married woman with two children. Liscel is 22 years old, residing in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Liscel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns 1,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Liscel has been a member of GDMPC for one year. Liscel hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 35-year-old married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 13 years old. Jacinta's husband works as a driver.

Jacinta has been in the business of raising hogs for the past 10 years. She is able to support her family through her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feed. Jacinta hopes to have a stable income so she can continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Katta

texts.en: Katta (shown in photo carrying baby), 21, is married, and resides with her husband and daughter in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a potato harvester who harvests to get a service fee. Her husband is a truck driver. Katta is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase potatoes to resell. In the future, she would like to increase capital to expand her business of buying and selling potatoes, buy the land that is next to her house to make her yard bigger, and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes to resell

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel is 34 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 17 years old. Jessel's husband works as a farmer.

Jessel has been selling firewood to her community for the past 10 years. She earns about 3,000 PHP per month with this business. Jessel plans to use her loan to buy more firewood to sell. Jessel hopes for this loan to help improve her business. She also hopes for her family's living situation to improve.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old, separated, and has one child. 

To make a living, Alicia runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-used products to the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 11,400 PHP a month for these activities.

Alicia is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Benelyn

texts.en:
Benelyn is a married woman with four children. Benelyn is 32 years old, residing in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Benelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Benelyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Benelyn wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van is 41 years old and a mother of 4 children living in Baray district. She is involved in a hog-raising business to generate income. She’s also a rice cultivator during the rainy season. She grows only rice crops and potato crops, according to her type of farmland. Presently, Mrs. Van doesn’t own any animals for working on her farmland, which causes her to meet difficulties and spend much money on renting animals. She wants to buy a cow by using a loan from our lenders. This loan will improve her business. In the future, Mrs. Van intends to develop her farming business and if she has adequate funds, to purchase extra farmland to grow different kinds of crops.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en: Chanthorn, 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is a food and drinks vendor in front of the provincial hospital. Her husband helps her sell food and one of her children is in the military. Chanthorn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to expand her business of selling food and drinks. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children's studies.

loans.use: to expand her business of selling food and drinks

loans.name: Lucibel

texts.en:
Lucibel is 33 years old and is a married woman with a 7-year-old child. She earns a living by making and selling baskets. Lucibel has been in this business for only a year. She earns 4,000 PHP per month.

Lucibel has requested this loan to purchase materials to make baskets. She hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make baskets

loans.name: Seoung

texts.en: Seoung, 31, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Seoung sells souvenirs to tourists, while her husband is a farmer. Seoung is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more souvenirs to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to expand her business. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more souvenirs to resell

loans.name: Chheoun

texts.en: Chheoun, 57, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Chheoun sells groceries while her husband provides motorbike washing services. Chheoun is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to expand her business. This will be her third loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a 30-year-old married woman with 2 children, aged 6 and 4. She sells prepaid mobile credit loads to her community. She has had this business for 5 years. Mary Joy earns about 3000 PHP per month with this business.

Mary Joy has requested a loan to purchase more prepaid load credits to sell. She hopes for her business to grow. Mary Joy also plans to start a sari-sari store business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more prepaid mobile load credits to sell

loans.name: Sopheavy

texts.en: Sopheavy, 37, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is a teacher. Her husband is a garment worker and a rice farmer. Her daughter is also employed as a garment worker. Sopheavy is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to grow rice during the dry season. In the future, she would like to purchase land to grow more rice and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to grow rice during the dry season

loans.name: Hen

texts.en: Mrs. Hen is 69 year old now. She is a widow living with a married child in her own home in Baray district. She has been in the agricultural business dedicating herself to rice husbandry for ages. It’s meaningful to say that agriculture is the sole source of her income. Because of financial problems, this old lady strives to work very hard. She aims to buy a stock of rice from local farmers to store in her house during the harvesting season and she will make it profitable when the market price of rice increases. However, Mrs. Hen doesn’t have enough capital to attain her goal. As a result, she would like to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a stock of rice soon. She is very thankful and she hopes that she will be able to improve her living condition through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice

loans.name: Teofie

texts.en:
Teofie is a 36-year-old married man from Cortes, Bohol. He has an 8-year-old child. Teofie earns a living by selling candles to the people in his community. Teofie works hard to improve his business and to continue providing for his family.

Teofie has requested this loan to buy more candles to sell. He hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more candles to sell

loans.name: Davy

texts.en: Davy, 34, is widowed and resides with her two children in the Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her daughter is also a garment worker. Davy is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and a toilet. In the future, she would like to purchase a sewing machine to sew at home, build a kitchen, and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Pheap, 47, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife. Her husband is a fisherman. All of her children are employed at a garment factory. Pheap is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase an engine for her husband to install in his boat in order to make his fishing journey easier. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business of fishing and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase an engine for her husband's fishing boat

loans.name: Tauch

texts.en:
This photo of Mr. Tauch, 67, was taken in front of his cucumber plantation. He’s going to plant this kind of crop in a new cycle after he gets free time from his rice fields. He is a loving father of 2 single children attending a local public school of Kompong Cham province.

Mr. Tauch wants to take out a loan from HKL to purchase crop seeds, fertilizer, petrol and diesel to start growing his crops. This loan will contribute to better his living condition. His business goal is to expand and improve his farming.

loans.use: to purchase crop seeds, fertilizer, petrol and diesel

loans.name: Seng Oun

texts.en:
Seng Oun, 44, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is a Khmer traditional medicine vendor. Her husband is a musician. One of her children is employed as a garment worker. 

Due to less income, Seng Oun is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run as a motor taxi when he is free from his musical work. By doing so, her husband can generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to buy a set of musical instruments for her husband for rental, build a new concrete house and support her children to study until they get a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run as a motor taxi

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
This is Eden, 53, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Wilfredo. He is her business partner and father to her only child. Eden, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eden operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Eden earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Eden hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is 27 years of age and is married with 3 children.

Lili owns and operates a business venture, catching and selling ocean-caught fish. She has many years of experience in this business. Lili needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Lili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Lili's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem, 29, is a married woman who has been living in Prey Chor district. She has a common law relationship with her husband who is skilled at building stone and wooden houses. Her husband has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses from place to place. Sem presently has three children who depend on her income. 

Sem and her husband have been paying money for taxis to get to work, or anywhere, because they don't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, Sem is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle, which will allow her and her husband to commute to their work location.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Katalina

texts.en:
Katalina is 38 years old and is married with 5 children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Katalina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Katalina's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is 26 years old with 2 children who are at school age.  She is managing a business that focuses on collecting scrap products and selling for some  private workshop. This activity has run for 10 years.  Joining our credit program in 2007, she has used loans effectively in expanding her business.  Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese dong to buy more scrap products. Profit from her business was used to buy more house devices.

loans.use: to buy more scrap products for selling.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is 29 years of age and is married with 3 children. She owns & operates a business venture, catching and selling ocean-caught fish.  She has many years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Akenese  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Akenese 's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Hinemoa

texts.en:
Hinemoa is 44 years old and she is a widow with 3 children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Hinemoa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Hinemoa's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
This is Emerita, 57, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Rizalino, a carpenter, and she is a mother to her two children. She manages their household, together with her husband, while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emerita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emerita hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
During the past six months, this group bred pigs successfully. They maintained the pigs well, away from diseases. They always give the pigs nutritious feeds and vitamins. After five months, the pigs sold out for a satisfactory price. All the group is happy and they continue to borrow to improve their businesses and earn more profit.

Ni Ketut used her loan to purchase a local pig species to make pig roll. This kind of pig is raised for two months and then sold. Ni Ketut hopes this new loan will bring more success and she will earn more profit. She plans to save all the profit for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase a local pig species

loans.name: Luzinda

texts.en:
This is Luzinda, 50, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Domingo, a driver, and she is a mother to her children. She manages their household, together with her husband, while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Luzinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Luzinda hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lotuafiafi

texts.en:
Lotuafiafi is 39 years of age and is married with 3 children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling ice cake.  She has many years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Lotuafiafi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Lotuafiafi's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 43 years of age and is married with 2 children. She owns & operates a business venture, providing new clothing services to local community members.  She has many years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase materials, a new sewing maching and needles.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.
