In 2011, Rita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Rita 's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase materials, a new sewing maching and needles

loans.name: Faosofia

texts.en:
Faaosofia is 34 years of age and is married with 4 children. She owns & operates a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish.  She has many years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST $400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Faaosofia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Faaosofia's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en: Xuyen is a 41-year-old woman with three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling soft drinks. For the past five years, she has run a soft drink stall to cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers. She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 29, is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a driver. 

Phuong supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business three years ago. She sells rice, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular rices and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular rices and beverages.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang is a 65-year-old widow. She lives with five sons in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns money with the business of making the soles of sandals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Now, Lang would like to take out a loan to invest in her business. She plans to use this loan to buy materials such as synthetic rubber to increase her production of sandal soles. She hopes that through this loan she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. This will enable her to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials such as synthetic rubber to increase her production of sandal soles.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang is 41 years old and is married. She has 3 children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by working as a mechanic. Trang earns an income to support her family by sewing hammocks and selling them in the local market. She intends to use her loan to buy canvas to make hammocks. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy canvas to make hammocks.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is a 26-year-old married woman. She lives with her son and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a mechanic. For ten years she has operated a cafe in front of her house. She would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of coffees and beverages to stock her cafe. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages to stock her cafe.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 40 and has 1 daughter.  Her husband has been earning by working as a welder. Thao has been running a general store from the front of their house for the past four years. She sells a variety of basic goods and snack foods. 

She would like to borrow money to buy a greater variety and quantity of goods, such as foods and beverages, in order to expand her current business. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Mrs. Houn is a humble villager who has been residing in Prey Chor district. She has been involved in 3 businesses: cultivating rice crops, selling fresh fish and raising pigs. Her husband is in the business of trading fish and also helps her to manage all farming work to help her relax from the bustle of her work. This couple is blessed with 3 children, one of whom is already married while the other two are students in a local school. 

Recently Mrs. Houn has applied for a loan of $1,000 to buy a hectare of farmland that can be used to grow dry-season rice because it’s located near the path of the river. She appreciates the constant support of her business.

loans.use: to buy a hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is a 40 year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 3 children. Her husband sells building materials. Tam earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 5 years. 

Tam would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 51, is widowed and has two daughters. Her first daughter is employed at a garment factory in Korea.  Sokha lives with her second daughter in Kampong Chhang Province, Cambodia. She stays home and cooks for her daughter.  Her second daughter embroiders clothing at home. Skha is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more cloth to embroider in order to make more embroidered clothing to sell. 

In the future, she would like to run a new business of selling gasoline to make more money to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to embroider

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 47 and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter.

She has been earning a living by operating a coffee shop from their house for the past seven years. She sells coffee and a variety of soft drinks and fruit juices. 

Phuong would like to borrow money to buy furniture to expand her current cafe and attract more customers. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her cafe.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business. Cherry has been in this business for 12 years. Cherry earns more income from a general store and raising pigs.

Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

Note: This picture was taken during tabu (market) day.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is a 51-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has two children. Son and his wife earn a living running a general store, which they have done for five years. 

Son would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock their store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his existing customers and attract additional customers. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions as well as enable him to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock his store.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh is a 48-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. Binh has one daughter. Binh’s husband works as a screen printer.

Binh has been in the business of making clothes for 10 years. She plans to use a loan to buy a greater quantity and quality of materials to make clothes.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and quality of materials to make clothes.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en:
Vi is a 57-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has six children. Her husband is retired. Vi earns a living running a general store, which she has done for five years. 

Vi would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. 

She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and help her to improve her family's living conditions as well as enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods and confectionery.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 52 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety store) in the Philippines and requested a 29,000-peso loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Helen has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling lobster. Helen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, 39, is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Lan and her husband support their family by running a general store in front of her house. They started this business fourteen years ago. They sell sugar, candy, shampoo, and other household items to people in their community. 

Lan is requesting a loan to expand the business by buying a greater variety of products, such as food and beverages, to stock the store and better satisfy customers. She hopes the business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, such as food and beverages, to stock her store

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 26, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. Her husband is a worker in a plastic company. She lives with her son and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thao has been in business for four years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is 41 years old and single. She lives with her parents in Ho Chi Minh City. Thuy supports her family with the income that she earns selling nutritional soup. She intends to use her loan to buy rice, shrimp, and fish to cook soup. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, shrimp, and fish to cook soup

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and range of ingredients to make sandwiches and coffee

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell in her business. Vilma has been in this business for 7 years. 

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is 43 years old and is married. She has 2 children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Ha's husband earns money by working as a driver. Ha earns an income to support her family by making clothes. 

Ha would like to take a loan to buy sewing materials to make a greater range and quantity of clothes to sell.  She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials to make a greater range and quantity of clothes to sell

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue, 47, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a taxi driver. Hue supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business seven years ago. She sells soft drinks, cakes, shampoo and other household items to people in her community. 

Hue is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, such as cakes and soft drinks, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, such as cakes and soft drinks, to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep, 58, is married and supports her family by designing and printing advertising signs. Her husband earns his income by making advertisement boards. She lives with her four children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Diep has been in business for eight years. She plans to use this loan to buy a greater quantity of plastics, papers and materials for printing. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of plastics, papers and materials for printing advertising signs

loans.name: Sok Khorn

texts.en:
Sok Khorn, 27, is married and resides with her husband in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store and sells soft drinks at home. Her husband is a Khmer traditional musician. 

Sok Khorn is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to build a concrete house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 27 years old, married, and has one child. He works in farming to provide for the necessities of his family. He is seeking a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. With the help of this loan, he'll be able to improve his farming business and recover his family’s living situation from financial constraints. He hopes to reap abundant harvests to secure his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар молодой человек в возрасте 31 года, женат имеет двоих детей. Он с детства занимается откормом скота и продажей.Раньше он помогал своему отцу, а теперь стал самостоятельным бизнесменом.Его место проживания расположено в при горном районе, поэтому его скот пасётся на пастбищах.Зафар также работает на стройке, строителем.Поэтому доход в летний период он приносит из доходов заработанных на строительстве. А в зимний период получает доход из бизнеса животноводства. Кредитуется он с 2010 года, и каждый его кредит совпадает в зимний период, когда скот дешевеет на рынке. На полученный кредит он планирует купить несколько десятков коз и баранов.
texts.en: Zafar is a young, 31 year-old man, who is married and has two children.  He has been involved in fattening up and selling livestock since his childhood.  He previously helped his father and then became an independent businessman.  Zafar's place of residence is located in a mountainous district, and this is why his livestock goes to a pasture.  He also works as a construction worker at a construction site.  This is why, he earns an income from construction work during the summer period.  And in the winter, Zafar earns his income from the animal husbandry business.  He has been obtaining financing since 2010, and each of his loans coincides with the winter period when livestock prices decrease at the market.  He plans to use this loan to purchase a few tens of goats and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase a few tens of goats and sheep

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia, a 42-year-old married mother of five, works hard to provide for her family. She has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines for seven years and also earns an income from her food-vending business. Having borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF, Amalia is now requesting a PHP 17,000 loan to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her store.

Amalia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Rowena is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 33 years old and married. She has four children.

Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Grace has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for seven years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Grace aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hamroboi

texts.ru: Хамробой ответственный и добрый семьянин. Более 3 лет он занимается куле- продажей сухофруктов. В бизнесе занимается один и сам содержит семью, и день за днем старается улучшить жилищные условия.  Приобретает товар с местных рынков, а потом реализует товар в другом районе. Имеет несколько постоянных покупателей. Имеет троих сыновей, из них двое работают в России, и отравляют денежные переводы один раз в месяц, а другой присматривает за родителями. Хамробой хотел бы получить займ для покупки шифера для кровли дома.
texts.en: Hamroboi is a responsible and kind family man.  He has been involved in buying and selling dried fruits for over three years.  He is involved in the business himself and support his family, and tries to improve their living conditions day-after-day.  Hamroboi buys his products from local markets and then sells them in a different district.  He has several regular customers.  Hamroboi has three sons, two of whom work in Russia and send money home once per month, and the other son looks after the parents.  Hamroboi wants to obtain this loan to purchase roof slates for his house.

loans.use: to purchase roof slates

loans.name: Sayragul

texts.ru: Сайрагул 44 года, замужем, имеет трех детей. Основная деятельность  семьи Сайрагул – животноводство.  В 2000 году, Сайрагул решила заняться откормом и перепродажей скота. На сегодняшний день,  хозяйство Сайрагул насчитывающее четыре дойные коровы, приносит ежемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от бизнес - деятельности Сайрагул позволили дать образование ее детям, старший из которых работает на местном мелькомбинате. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайрагул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Сайрагул планирует направить на дальнейшее расширение своей деятельности.
texts.en:
Sayragul is 44 years old, married, and has three children.  Her family's main occupation is animal husbandry.  In 2000 Sayragul decided to engage in fattening and reselling cattle.  Today, her farm has four milk cows and brings her a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  The income from her business activities has allowed her to give an education to her children, the eldest of whom works at the local flour mill. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Sayragul turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) for buying cows.  She plans to allocate the income from the loan for further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.ru: Зебунисо проживает в районе Пяндж. Ей 30 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Более шести лет она занимается шитьем. Кредит берет для приобретения новой швейной машинки, чтобы предоставить качественную услугу.
texts.en: Zebuniso lives in the Pyandj district.  She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She has a high school education.  For more than six years she has sewn for a living.  She is taking out a loan to acquire a new sewing machine in order to provide quality service.

loans.use: to acquire a new sewing machine

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 40 years old and married. She has four children.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Analyn has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from her restaurant.

Analyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 30 years old and married. She has two children.

Glenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items for her sari-sari store business.

Glenda has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Glenda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. Sarah is married and has a meat vending business in the Philippines.

Sarah requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs and cows for her meat vending business.

Sarah has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Sarah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs and cows for her meat vending business.

loans.name: Ecelyn

texts.en:
Ecelyn, 48, is married and has six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ecelyn has a meat vending business in the Philippines. Ecelyn has been in this business for 3 years. 

Ecelyn requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy pigs for her meat vending business. In the future, Ecelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy pigs for her meat vending business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Josephine has been in this business for six years. Josephine earns additional income from her food vending and dried-fish vending businesses.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 52 years old and married. She has six children.

Ma. Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Ma. Lourdes has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the spices business for five years and also earns an income from her dry goods business.

Ma. Lourdes aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Rogie

texts.en:
Rogie is married and is a father of three children. He is 48 years of age and a very industrious farmer. He has been involved in growing rice for over 10 years. He earns an income amounting to P10,000 from the sales of rice form his last cropping and has used it to improve their living situation.

He wants to earn a higher income to save for the education of his three school-aged children. For this reason, he is asking for a loan in the amount of P16,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. He just hopes to benefit from a nice and precious harvest from the next cropping season to experience an enhanced lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Firuzjon

texts.ru: Фирузджон родился 08 декабря 1989 году. Он очень умный и целеустремленный юноша. После успешного окончания школы поступил в Технологический Университет, где учится на отличные оценки. По специальности финансы и кредит. Он  во всех мероприятиях университета принимает активное участие. В свободное время увлекается футболом. Фирузджон запрашивает займ для оплаты обучения университета. Он  благодарен вам за вашу поддержку и доброту. Он очень надеется на вашей поддержке его в получении образования.
texts.en: Firuzjon was born on December 8, 1989.  He is a very smart and goal-oriented young man.    After successfully finishing school, he entered Technological University, where he earns excellent grades.  His specialization is in finance and credit. He takes an active part in all the university's events.  In his free time he plays soccer. Firuzjon is requesting a loan to pay his tuition at the university.  He is grateful for your support and kindness.  He is greatly relying on your support to receive his education.

loans.use: To pay for his education

loans.name: Analita

texts.en:
Analita is 39 years old and married. She has four children and three of them are in school. Analita works very hard to provide for them.

Analita runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Analita has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, shampoo, coffee, canned goods, etc. and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Analita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Lovyne

texts.en:
Lovyne works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lovyne requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine and repair her fishing boat.

She has been in this business for six years.

Lovyne would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine and repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 39 years old. She is currently residing at Cauayan City. Though she is separated from her husband, still she is thankful because she has been blessed with two school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer has been engaged in her sari-sari store for four years and eight months. She earns about P10,000 a month.

As she said, with the income she generates from her business, she was able to give her children a good quality of life and to continue sending them to school. Therefore, Jennifer wants to borrow a loan of P30,000 to buy additional stock of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, curls and other basic ingredients to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, curls and other basic ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 46 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, bread, canned goods, spices, oil, etc.

In the future Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marilou requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her "bibingka" (a type of rice cake) food production business.

Marilou has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her "bibingka" food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, and biscuits for her store

loans.name: Melendrina

texts.en:
Melendrina works hard to support her family. Melendrina is married and has a small restaurant business in the Philippines.

Melendrina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Melendrina has been in this business for three years now and also earns an additional income from her rice-farming business.

In the future, Melendrina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 29-year-old man from western Kenya and is married to Mary. They currently don’t have a child yet.

Michael operates a motorcycle transport business in Migori, a business he has been doing for the last three years.  He is taking a first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy a secondhand motorcycle. He will use his anticipated profits to pay back the loan without default so that he qualifies for subsequent loaning.

He desires to have a fleet of motorcycles within the town he operates in.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a coconut wine retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut wine ("tuba") to sell to customers.

Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine ("tuba") to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fuel wood

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 32 years old and has one child who is in school.

Marilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech is 37-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Akech is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a 37-year-old man from the South Rift Valley in Kenya. He is married to Mary and they have four children aged 14, 12, 7, and 3 years.

Wilfred operates a barber shop and has been doing this for seven years. This is his his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more electric razors and shaving shampoo. He intends to channel the profits back to his business to ensure it grows and makes enough income.

His hope is to make enough income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy electric razors and shampoo.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 48 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Monina runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snacks, noodles, and school supplies. 

In the future Monina would like to save enough to rent a space at a public market.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina, a 44-year-old mother of four children, is the operator of a motorcycle service that has been in operation for 7 years. She works hard every day just to meet the needs of her family. Angelina has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy wheels and interior parts for her motorcycle. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family, improve their standard of living, and save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy wheels and interior parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар замужем и любящая мать. У нее двое детей. Муж работает строителем. Сын учится в университете, а дочка еще учится  в школе. Гавхар занимается купле- продажей женских тканей. Является собственником бизнеса. Она старается расширить бизнес, чтобы быть успешным предпринимателем. С наступлением новогодних праздников продажа на рынке возрастает, и она хотела бы получить займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки женских тканей для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется в вашей поддержке и благодарна вам за помощь.
texts.en: Gavhar is married and is a loving mother.  She has two children.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Their son attends a university, and the daughter still goes school.  Gavhar is involved in buying and selling women's fabrics.  She is the owner of this business.  She tries to expand her business in order to be a successful entrepreneur.  Sales at the market increase with the onset of New Year's holidays, and Gavhar wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of women's fabrics to refill her revolving capital.  She hopes to get your support and is grateful to you for the help.

loans.use: to purchase women's fabrics and refill her revolving capital

loans.name: Melia

texts.en:
Melia is 48 years old, married, and blessed with four children. Her husband is an Overseas Filipino Worker. He works as a seaman. Melia’s children are all in school. 

With her determination to help her husband to uplift their living, Melia engages in a retailing business. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, in which she sells snack foods, beauty products, and slippers. Melia has been in this type of business for over four years. She is happy that she is managing her business well.

Melia wishes for the fast growth of her business. She wants to extend the products she sells in her village. Thus, Melia is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase beverages and additional slippers to sell. She hopes to achieve her wish and become a successful businesswoman; borrower as well.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and additional slippers to sell.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Epifania works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling herbal products in the Philippines and also earns an additional income from her food vending business. Epifania is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more herbal products to sell.

Epifania has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Agot

texts.en:
Agot is 30-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan, for four years.

Agot is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar, salt, and cooking oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is a hardworking and respectable man. He is 36 years of age and a father of three children. His wife helps him in this business. They own a small plot of land where they grow rice. They have been blessed with rich land, but it also demands a lot of attention and labor to provide a good income. For this reason, he is asking a loan amount PHP10,000 to buy fertilizers, seeds to sow and pesticides used in maintaining his plants as well as maintaining his land.

Virgilio wishes to improve their living conditions through his availed loan to secure the education and the future for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds to sow and pesticides used in maintaining his plants.

loans.name: Adhiambo

texts.en:
Adhiambo is a 58-year-old woman from western Kenya who is married to Cyprian Otieno. They have nine children and six grandchildren. 

Adhiambo is a food seller specializing in yams, and she has been in this business for the last 13 years. She makes a monthly profit of KES 10,000, with which she is able to provide for her family’s needs. 

This is her third loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to add more yams to her stock, and part of the money to pay school fees for her grandchildren. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and also to build a good house  

Her dreams is to build a good house and to pay the fees for her orphan grandchildren.

loans.use: to add more food stuff stock and pay school fees, as well as to build a house

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is 38 years old and lives in the South Rift Valley with his wife and three children, who range in age from 7 to 13 years old. For the last two years, he has earned a living by selling shoes. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd., which he will use to buy more shoes to sell. His goal is to do a better job of meeting his family's needs by expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 34 years old and married with 2 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Analyn is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Analyn has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional cameras, batteries, photo paper and other materials needed to develop pictures.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is from the village of Nagrumbuan. She is 48 years-old, married and blessed with three children. She is the operator of a motorcycle service that has been in operation for three years and six months. Anita does her best to lift her family from poor living.

As of now, Anita wants to avail a loan of P12,000 in order to purchase wheels, interior materials and for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She believes that her patience and hard work will provide a better result in achieving her goals in life and improving the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase wheels, interior materials and maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Ailyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from her pig fattening business. Ailyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Ailyn  has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional spare parts to use in repairing machines and to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of kitchen supplies and personal items to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 28 years old and married with 3 children. With 3 children in school, Amy works very hard to provide for them.

Amy runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Amy has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as spices, canned goods, eggs, etc.. 

In the future Amy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Abuol

texts.en:
Abuol is a 35 year old married woman with three children one of whom is in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Langber Bor, South Sudan for three years.
Abuol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 36 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 NWTF to buy additional goods to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and sells a variety of items, including soft drinks, eggs, bread, canned goods and spices. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zainura

texts.ru: Зайнура умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать. У неё трое прекрасных мальчиков. Она ради них работает усердно, чтобы они выросли здоровыми и счастливыми. Она более 10 лет занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Она сама является владельцем бизнеса и работает от души. У неё широкий ассортимент продуктов питания и она всегда обновляет и привозит свежие продукты. Зайнура хотела бы получить займ для покупки продуктов питания для пополнения оборотного капитала на Новом Году.
texts.en: Zainura is a smart and hardworking woman.  She is married and is a loving mother.  She has three beautiful sons.  Zainura works diligently for their sake, so that they grow up to be healthy and happy.  She has been involved in buying and selling food products for over ten years.  She is the owner of this business and puts her heart into the work.  Zainura has a wide variety of food products and always updates and brings in fresh products.  She wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of food products in order to increase her working capital for the New Year's.

loans.use: to purchase food products and increase working capital

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба мать четверых детей, которой 33 года. Она вместе со своим старшим сыном занимается откормом и продажей мелкорогатого скота. Муж Насибы на заработках в России, и каждый месяц присылает семье деньги на семейные расходы. На каждый получаемый кредит Насиба покупает скот и корм для него. Условия для содержания скота у нее хорошие и откорм скота позволяет ей получать больше дохода и возможность расходовать их на семейные расходы. На текущий кредит она планирует закупить 10 баранов и откормив их продать подороже в сезон дорожания скота.
texts.en: Nasiba is a 33 year-old mother of four children.  She and her oldest son are involved in fattening up and selling small livestock.  Nasiba's husband works in Russia and sends money home every month for family expenses.  Nasiba has used each one of her loans to purchase livestock and animal feed for it.  She has good conditions for keeping livestock, and fattening up livestock allows her to earn a higher income and have an opportunity to spend it for family expenses.  Nasiba plans to use this loan to purchase ten sheep, fatten them up and sell them at higher prices during the season of rising livestock prices.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen is 62 years old, married and has four children. For the last 20 years, she has worked very hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items such as shampoo and groceries. She is applying for a loan for PHP 22,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to secure the financial stability of her family by expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional glassware, plasticware, and other kitchenware to sell in the market

loans.name: Leon

texts.en:
Leon is a man with patience for and dedication to his work. He is 43 years old and is married with four industrious children. He is engaged in a farming business, where he plants rice as a source of income. He earned 10,000 pesos last crop and wishes to gain higher-than-usual income.

With the intent of improving his income, Leon is asking for a loan of 18,000 pesos to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes that he can produce an abundant harvest to provide for the needs of his family, and in the future he could see all his children finishing their studies.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Nyanibol

texts.en: Nyanibol is 28 years old and married. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling charcoal to the people in her community. She is applying for a loan from BRAC South Sudan to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to earn enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Majeedan's Group

texts.en:
Majeedan is a happily married lady. She is blessed with two children, ages 21 and 19. 

Majeedan is a caring lady by nature. She used to stay at home and manage her household responsibilities. She loves her family and tries to provide comfort to them by fulfilling their needs. Her husband is a scrap dealer by profession. He buys scrap materials like used bottles, metals, plastics, and old newspapers that he can resell at higher prices.

As of now, he is aiming to diversify his business. That’s why Majeedan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy more junk products like used bottles, old newspapers, empty cans, and metal to resell. This loan will help improve his business.

She is hopeful that her husband’s business will improve a lot after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy junk products for scrap business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 32 years old, married and has five children, four of whom are currently enrolled in school. For the last three years, she has worked very hard to provide for her family by selling firewood. She is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy more firewood to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to earn enough money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
Cherilyn is 28 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are in school.

Cherilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cherilyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cherilyn has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cherilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 34-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling foodstuff in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy another TV and deck for his video game business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and works hard to support her family. She buys and sells curtains in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now and earns additional income from her sari-sari (general) store as well.

Jocelyn has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more curtains, towels, etc. to sell to customers. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more curtains, towels, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya is 59 years old. She is a widow and lives in Yerevan with her son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. She has a high school education and 26 years of experience as a mathematics teacher.

After retiring on a pension, Sonya refused to be out of work, and more than ten years ago she decided to organize her own business selling women's clothes and underwear. She rents a stall in the trade market in Yerevan and buys merchandise from neighboring countries by herself. Due to her income from her business, she shares the family's expenses with her son.

Sonya says she likes her present business very much, and she is very happy that she is employed at her age.

Sonya received loans from Nor Horizon eleven times without repayment delay. This is now her third loan through Kiva. With her previous Kiva loans Sonya bought various swimsuits for her business.

Before the New Year’s holidays Sonya intends to buy winter and holiday clothes to resell. Therefore, she is seeking a 700,000 AMD loan.

loans.use: to buy winter and holiday clothes to resell.

loans.name: Chepngeno

texts.en:
Chepngeno is a resident and a farmer in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya. She is a mother of three aged between 10 and 4 years. She has been in farming for 6 years with the help of two farmhands and produces pineapples, vegetables, maize, beans and milk for the local market.

Chepngeno has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. She says the income will help her educate her children. She adds she aspires to own pure breed dairy cows and hopes to acquire these pure breeds in five years.

She sees the prevalence of diseases as the major challenge to farmers.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Mukhbira

texts.ru: Мухбира незамужняя девушка. Она активная и трудолюбивая, старается заработать много денег, чтобы помогать родителям. Более 3 лет она занимается купле- продажей конфет и кондитерских изделий. У неё широкий ассортимент сладостей. Иногда ей помогает мать. Мухбира хочет закупить новый ассортимент сладостей, перед наступлением Нового Года, так как для изготовления подарков на рынке возрастает спрос на конфеты и другие сладости. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 12000 Сомони. Она надеется в одобрении займа, так как все знают, что изготовление подарков приносит радость детям.
texts.en: Mukhbira is a single young woman.  She is active and hardworking and tries to earn a lot of money in order to help her parents.  She has been involved in buying and selling candy and confectionery goods for over three years.  Mukhbira has a wide assortment of sweets.  Sometimes her mother helps her.  Mukhbira wants to purchase a new selection of sweets prior to the New Year's holiday because the demand for candy and other sweets for making gifts is increasing.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of 12000 Somoni to achieve this goal.  Mukhbira hopes to have this loan approved because everyone knows that making presents brings happiness to children.

loans.use: to purchase sweets

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 51 years old and married with 3 children. With 2 children in school, Crispina works very hard to provide for them.

Crispina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Crispina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods, spices, bread, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Crispina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a fifty seven year old man from South Rift Valley in Kenya.  He is married to Mary, and together they have 6 children.  He is in the livestock trade business in his area. For the past ten years he has been selling cattle and goats. 

Samwel - who is the sole breadwinner in his family - is taking his first loan, which he will use to buy goats to sell in December, a month of many festivities. He intends to use the profits to diversify into farming. His hope is to grow and diversify his business and better support his family.

loans.use: To buy goats for sale.

loans.name: Akur

texts.en:
Akur is a 32-year-old married woman with four children (two of them are in school). She has had a business of selling in a grocery store in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Akur is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, sugar and maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years old. He is married and blessed with four children. He has been engaged in the farming business in their village for his family's living. His wife helps him in farming and takes a lot of care of their children. He keeps on working hard in his business to gain enough funds for the education of his children.  To acquire a higher income, he is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use to develop his business.
He is very lucky to have an agricultural business that serves as their livelihood. He hopes, as he goes on and loves his work,  that he can meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides use to develop his business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa, 46, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Marcial, a security guard, and she is mother to her two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elsa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells direct-selling products for additional income.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business.

She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elsa hopes her business will grow into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Ajah

texts.en:
Ajah is a 36-year-old married woman with three children (all of them are in school). She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Ajah is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Théoneste

texts.fr:
Théoneste est né au Rwanda et a 30 ans. Il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est 5 ans de secondaire.

Théoneste est salarie. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va acheter les matériels de construction pour le finissage de sa maison.

Théoneste voudrait continuer ses études. Avec le profit  Théoneste voudrait se marie et assure le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Théoneste was born in Rwanda and is thirty years old. He is single. His education level is five years of secondary school.

Théoneste is salaried. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to buy construction materials for the finishing of his house.

Théoneste would like to continue his studies. With this advantage, Théoneste would like to get married and assure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for the finishing of his house.

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Ms. Ty is 30 years old with two school-age children. For five years, her main business activity has been buying and selling scrap products. Every month, she gets a stable income from this business. Since joining SEDA's credit program in 2007, she has used loans to expand her business. She is currently requesting a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy scrap products in bulk. With this, she can improve her family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy scarp products  at big quantity

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a twenty five year old man from the shores of Lake Victoria, Western Kenya. He is married to Evalyne, and they have 2 children.

Charles has been running a tailoring business in his area for the last 9 years. He is taking his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy textiles for the tailoring business. He plans to reinvest the anticipated profits into his business. His dream is to build a house for his family, and also to educate his two kids.

loans.use: To buy textiles.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, age 41, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband Claro is in the Navy, and she has three children. Together with her husband and children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Ann operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Ann hopes that her business will grow in the coming years, and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to sell, and to do maintenance on her sewing machine.

loans.name: Laon

texts.en:
Laon is 40-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. For three years, she has made a business of selling foodstuffs in Bor, South Sudan.

Laon is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil to sell.

loans.name: Bester

texts.en: Bester is 32 years old, widowed, with two children aged 11 and 9 all are still going to school.She also takes care of her three young sisters. Bester is into Buying and selling clothes business in and around Masvingo.She has requesting for a loan of $1 000.00 to buy clothes for resale.She has been in business for eight years and has one employee.She says challenges being faced are of high import duty as she import her products from South Africa.With the extra income she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.Bester is planning to have bigger shop in Masvingo town.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 31 and is the mother of 4 children, aged between 14 and three years. She is a farmer and relies fully on farming income to support her family. She has been in farming for eight years, producing bananas, tomatoes, maize, passion fruits, and milk, which all go to the local market.

Peninah has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the loan will help her expand her dairy farming as well as produce farming. It will also provide income to pay for the education of her children and improve their living standards.

She says insufficient feed and low prices for farm produce are the leading challenges to farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr:
Emmanuel est né au Rwanda et a 43 ans. Il est marie avec 4 enfants de 4 à 14  ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de primaire.

Emmanuel est éleveur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va acheter une vache. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire l’élevage des vaches de race améliore. Emmanuel voudrait être le fournisseur du lait dans sa région. Avec le profit  Emmanuel voudrait  assure le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emmanuel was born in Rwanda and is forty-three years old. He is married with four children between the ages of four and fourteen, three of whom are in school. His eduction level is eight years of primary school. 

Emmanuel is a breeder. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to buy a cow.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to raise cows of a better breed. Emmanuel would like to be the milk supplier in his area. With the profits, Emmanuel would like to ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: That

texts.en:
Mrs. That operates a retail business located in her own house. She sells different types of merchandise, such as snacks, sweet things, eggs, cigarettes, and household products, to satisfy her customers in the community. She typically earns approximately $2.00 per day through her business. She is now 52 years old and has five children, three of whom are her dependents. 

Mrs. That is requesting a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase retail stock to sustain her business. In the future, she hopes to enlarge her store and sell more products.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock.

loans.name: Mellania

texts.en:
Mellania is 28 years old and married with two children, aged seven and three. Only one of her children attends school.Mellania also receives a salary from another job she is engaged in.

Mellania is into the business of buying and selling clothes in Masvingo town.She has requested for a loan of $1 000.00 to buy clothes for resale. With the income from this loan she will be able to finish building her family home.She buys her products from South Africa. She has been in business for ten years and has two employees. Mellania has says she faces the challenge of high competition.Mellania is planning to open various shops in town and surrounding areas and also intends to open a kitchenware sales shop.

loans.use: to buy  clothes for resale

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Ms. Thanh is 31 years old with three school age children. She sells traditional cigarettes. For ten years this business has provided a stable income for the Thanh family.  

After taking part in the SEDA credit program in 2007, she found that this kind of credit is very suitable for her family. Currently, she wants to borrow  9,632,000 VND to buy more traditional cigarettes to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more traditional cigarettes for sale.

loans.name: Tier

texts.en:
Tier is a 32-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Tier is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
This is Rita, 32, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Reynaldo, a driver, and they have three children. She, her husband, and their children, manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Rita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. The variety store is the place to go to buy one small container of shampoo, five PHP-worth of cooking oil, or a single egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling items individually. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Rita hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams that, through all her hard work on her business, she will be able to give her children a high-quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week, where she can share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock for her variety store.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a simple farmer with a simple dream in life--to have a happy family. But his simple dream was not achieved. Though it was not attained, because his wife left him, he still has the courage to continue life. He wants to live with his two children in comfort, so he is doing his entire best to provide them a good life.

He has been planting rice crops in his rice fields for 15 years and earned 10,000 pesos last crop. He wants to increase his rice production to meet his children’s daily needs. He is now asking for a loan amount of 15,000 pesos to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides and to pay for the cultivation of his farmland. Hopefully his fields can yield better crops to save for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to pay for the cultivation of his farmland

loans.name: Silver Group

texts.en:
Ally, who is in his late 20s, is single. He has been selling second-hand clothes for five years now.  He works from 6am to 6pm, and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Ally’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and he wants to use it to increase his stock of second-hand clothes to sell. Ally’s dream is to one day be able to buy land and build his own house.

Ally will share this loan with his loan group, "Silver", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his stock of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.fr:
Philémon est né au Rwanda et a 23 ans. Il est marie avec 1 enfant de 1  an. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire.

Philémon est éleveur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va acheter une vache. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire l’élevage des vaches de race améliore. Philémon voudrait être le fournisseur du lait dans sa région. Avec le profit  Philémon voudrait  payer le minerval de sa femme et soigner son enfant.
texts.en:
Philémon was born in Rwanda and is twenty-three years old. He is married with one child who is one year old. His education level is six years of primary school.

Philémon is a breeder. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to buy a cow.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to raise cows of a better breed. Philémon would like to be the milk supplier in his area. With the profit, 
Philémon would like to pay his wife's school fees and take care of his child.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Nely Eloïse

texts.fr: Nely Eloïse est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Nely Eloïse est mariée à un certain Chuku. Le couple a deux enfants  tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a quatre autres enfants à charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Nely Eloïse vend depuis vingt  ans des sacs de sortie et d’école dans un marché du Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Nely Eloïse contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Nely Eloïse sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Nely Eloïse is 41 years old and lives in Benin. She is married; her husband's name is Chuku. The couple has two dependent children, who both go to school. In addition to their own children, they have four other children in their care. The children live together with their parents. The couple provides for the family together.
To help support her family, Nely Eloïse has been selling school and leisure bag at a market in Benin for twenty years. Thanks to the revenues generated by this activity, Nely Eloïse can contribute to her family's various expenses.
To meet the demand from her ever-growing clientele, Nely Eloïse is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase school and leisure bags.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 35-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food stuffs in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a farmer and resident of Nkubu located in central Kenya.  She is the mother of three children, one of whom is already an adult.  She has been farming for five years and earns additional income from her retail business, selling cereals in the local market.  Her farm produces beans, bananas and maize.

Florence has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy piglets for a new venture into raising pigs.  She says she will use the income to start a dairy business in the future.  She adds that her farming income will be used to meet her family's basic needs, like educating the children, as well as to enable her to expand her farming business.  She laments the poor weather conditions, which necessitate the installation of an irrigation system.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
This is Paz.  She is 42 years old and a resident of Tanza, Cavite City in the Philippines.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her husband, Joey, is her business partner. Together, she and her husband manage the household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to meet her everyday expenses. 
 
Paz operates a junk shop.  Trash is not formally sorted in the Philippines and, while waiting for local dump trucks to collect the garbage, people scavenge trash bags and garbage dumps for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic and paper, which they sell to junk shops like Paz’s for a profit.  The junk shops then stack, clean and gather large quantities of these materials to sell to foundries, factories and others in need of these materials.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP. She will augment her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors with the funds from the loan.  She expects an increase in her income as she expands her business.  

Paz hopes her business grows more in the coming years.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members both to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials to sell in her junk shop.

loans.name: Chritine's Group

texts.en:
Chritine's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Chritine is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past year, Chritine has been working hard to manage her small hotel, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Chritine has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks to sell and will help Chritine generate greater profits, which she will use to pay her child’s school fees.  Chritine hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Chritine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has improved Chritine's future prospects by helping her learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various goods (canned foods, soaps, and condiments)

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr:
Emmanuel est né au Rwanda et a 50 ans. Il est marie avec 4 enfants de 5 à 15  ans, dont 4 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est 2 ans de secondaire.

Emmanuel est chauffeur d’un taxi voiture. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va acheter des matériels pour faire la réparation de sa voiture. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’acheter une autre voiture. Emmanuel voudrait acheter d’autres véhicules utiliser pour le taxi voiture. Avec le profit  Emmanuel voudrait  assure le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emmanuel was born in Rwanda and is fifty years old. He is married with four children between the ages of five and fifteen, of whom four are in school. His education level is two years of secondary school.

Emmanuel is a taxi driver. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to buy materials to repair his car.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to buy another car. Emmanuel would like to buy other vehicles used as taxis. With the profit, Emmanuel would like to ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his car.

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en:
Ayush is 38 years old and lives with her husband and her two children in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She is a tailor and has been in business for over six years.
