She began her business by working out of her rental apartment but now has her own tailoring shop and several regular customers.  Over the years she had made many kinds of casual clothes to sell. 

Her sewing machine is very old and has recently become impossible to use.  It is the primary tool for her tailoring business and, without it; she will not be able to continue her business.  Ayush plans to replace her existing sewing machine with a high quality sewing machine, perhaps a western brand.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase the sewing machine and continue her business.

loans.use: To purchase the sewing machine to continue her business.

loans.name: Ding

texts.en:
Ding is 20 years old.  She is married and has one child who is in school.  For three years she has run a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan.  

Ding is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase more beans, oil and sugar to sell.  She will use the income generated from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, oil and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Mrs. Han, 35, a hard-working and responsible mother residing in Pouk District, Siem Reap Province, grows rice and raises pigs to generate income. Currently engaged in harvesting her rice, she is requesting a loan from HKL to pay for farm labor, enlarge her pigpen, and buy additional piglets. She would to thank all lenders who help her attain her goal.

loans.use: to enlarge her pigpen, buy additional piglets and pay laborers harvesting and threshing her rice crops.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is married with four children, ages 7, 5, 3 and 1. To earn a living, her husband runs a barber shop. He works ten hours daily and earns a profit. Shahida herself is a housewife who stays at home and performs her household duties. She is a very caring lady. She loves doing household work and taking care of her family. She cooks delicious and healthy food for them. 

Her husband is a professional barber. He also provides hair dressing facilities to his customers which helps attract more customers. He has been in this business for over 10 years. Over the years he has steadily enhanced his business and his clientele. With the requested loan, her husband will purchase more supplies like shaving detergent, razors, chairs etc. to provide better facilities to his customers and generate more revenue. Shahida is hopeful about the further business improvement of her husband after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy shaving detergent, chairs and razors for her husband's barber shop business

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 28-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has had a business selling food stuffs in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Amer is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase salt and sugar. In the future, she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase salt and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.en:
Eleuterio is 57 years of age and is married.  He has four grown children. He is a farmer who plans to increase his rice production so that he can generate greater profits every crop season. He has been spending his income on his family's daily needs, such as food allowances and electricity bills.

He is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for use in his business. He hopes to yield better crops through his purchased inputs for the development of their living situation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in his business

loans.name: Eternel Est Ma Lumiere Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ETERNEL EST MA LUMIERE est composé de sept personnes qui sont des amies et qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sidonie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sidonie est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Sidonie a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Sidonie est mariée à un vitrier du nom de Bertrand. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Sidonie vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Pour contribuer aux diverses charges, Sidonie vend depuis neuf ans des vêtements pour enfants dans un marché du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Sidonie vend des bijoux. Sidonie s’approvisionne au Nigéria et dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sidonie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ETERNEL EST MA LUMIERE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group ETERNEL EST MA LUMIERE is comprised of seven persons who are friends living in the same district. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Sidonie, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. 

Sidonie is 29 years old and lives in Benin. She halted her studies in secondary school. She is married to a glazier named Bertrand. They have one child, who is in school and in their care. Sidonie lives together with her husband and child. The couple jointly meet the various household needs. 

To help cover the various expenses, Sidonie has been selling children's clothing for nine years at a market in Benin. Secondarily, she sells jewelry. Her supplies come from Nigeria and from a Beninese market. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her income, Sidonie and the other members of the group ETERNEL EST MA LUMIERE are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 38-year-old married woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food stuffs in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Elizabeth is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase salt and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase salt and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a twenty-one-year-old entrepreneur from Western Kenya. He and his wife, Janet, have no children.

Rafael operates a motorcycle transport business in his local area and has been doing this for the last three years. He is taking his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy a second-hand motorcycle to supplement the current one.  He will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

Rafael's dream is to own a fleet of motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: 2 Nam Ngạn Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Côi is 59 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 2 Nam Ngạn solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

Côi operates a food stall restaurant selling rice noodle dishes. Côi has been involved in this business for 8 years. The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients.

In 2010, Côi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Côi has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With the profits from the loan, Côi hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, beef, and chicken to make "phở" to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 49, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ereneo, her business partner, and they have two children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Jocelyn operates a buy-and-sell business. Basically, what she does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it for a little profit. Her products are RTW (ready to wear) clothes, personal accessories, and other similar products. She attracts customers with low prices and many options. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy RTW products and other items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jocelyn hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She dreams that, through all her hard work on her business, she will be able to give her children a high-quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week, where she can share stories of her work and  draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing for sale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 33 years old and serves as both father and mother to his two children. He was separated from his spouse, but according to him, though he was sad, he still became strong despite what had happened to their relationship. His two children motivate him to improve his crop production. He grows rice and sells it to traders in their village. He usually earns about P15,000 each harvest season of April and November.  His income was just enough to cover all their expenses, especially for school fees, so he needs to make improvements in his output.

He is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy farming inputs needed, such as fertilizers and pesticides.  Manuel would like to keep generating a good income from his business so that someday he will provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming inputs needed, such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: 119.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa lê is 27 years old, and she is married with one child, who has finished school. Hoa lê is the group leader of the 119.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

Hoa lê has a service business repairing electronics. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hoa lê faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase electrical equipment and electronic devices to resell. 

In 2009, Hoa lê joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With the profits from this loan, Hoa lê hopes to buy more supplies and equipment to help her business do well and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase electrical equipment and electronic devices to sell.

loans.name: Nyanthich

texts.en:
Nyanthich is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Nyanthich is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. In the future, she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 46 year-old farmer. He is married and blessed with three children. He wants to yield abundant income through his business but, because of his obligations to traders who have high interest rates, he was not be able to save enough for his family as well as his business.  Therefore, to avoid having debts to traders with high rates, he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from Alalay sa Kaunlaran Inc., which would allow him to purchase farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to improve his business.

He is very thankful because he can provide the essential plant care for his rice crops. Hopefully, he can gain high income so that he can support his youngest child to pursue his studies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to improve his business

loans.name: Chhouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhouk is 39 years old and a mother of two single children. She operates a business in front of a pagoda in Pouk district. She sells porridge and beef soups with noodles to the people in her community, from which she is able to earn an average of $3.00 per day. There are many customers who come to eat breakfast at her store because Mrs. Chhouk is a good cook, and makes tasty foods to serve them. 

At the present Mrs. Chhouk would like to borrow a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a motorcycle to support her in her business, and to avoid taking any taxi service. Mrs. Chhouk will strive to work harder to provide her two children with further education, so that they may find better employment.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to support her in her business.

loans.name: Askaraly

texts.ru:
Аскарали 46 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. В 2005 году Аскарали начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота, а также – в продаже фруктов и овощей. Аскарали приложил все усилия для развития своего бизнеса  и добился успеха – на сегодняшний день, благодаря упорному ежедневному труду, его ежемесячная прибыль составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аскарали обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков для откорма.  Доходы от кредита Аскарали планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Askaraly is 46 years old, married with four children. In 2005 Askaraly began his business in fattening and reselling cattle as well as selling fruits and vegetables. Askaraly made ​​every effort to grow his business and achieve success. Today by working hard everyday his monthly income is 4,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop his business Askaraly has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase four calves for fattening. Askaraly plans to invest the income from the loan into increasing the herd of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 30 year old married woman with six children, four of them are in school. She has had a business selling food in a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and wheat flour to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Mrs. Lea is a mother of 3 single children, operating a business in front of her house. She sells breakfasts like pork porridge and noodle soup, generating an income of approximately $4.00 per day. 

One among her children is now working at a garage to contribute some of his income to support the family, and he gets his payment monthly. His workplace is a bit far away from home, and he doesn’t own a motorcycle to commute to his work. Therefore, he has spent a lot of his pay for a motor-taxi service every day. For this reason, Mrs. Lea wants to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy a used motorcycle for her son for travelling to his workplace. This loan will help her family reduce some expenses and better their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her son for travelling to his workplace.

loans.name: Baasantsogt

texts.en:
Mr.Baasantsogt, 29, runs a taxi business around Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business since 2005 and he already has permanent customers. But his daily income does not always meet with his family's necessities.
 
Lately his apartment has become very uncomfortable and cold to live in, because all the window insulations have been removed and there is too much heat-loss during the winter time. Therefore he needs to make adjustments and insulation to his apartment windows. The loan he is requesting will be dedicated to purchasing the building materials to make the windows insulated.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials to make the windows insulation.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro is a small framer who lives in Roma Norte. He is married to Norma, and they have two children who attend school. He has been in the business for 25 years and this has made him an expert in this field of work. According to him, he still needs to improve his farming practices so that he will generate more output.

He has insufficient funds, so he wants to borrow P25,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.  Isidro would like to send his children to college so that someday they will earn a degree and seek better employment.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 49 years old, and married to Leah. They have three children.

He has been in the carpentry business for 20 years from which he earns a monthly income of 35,000 KES. He is applying for his sixth loan of Kenya Shillings 10,000 KES.He paid his previous loan well and in good time.He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to buy more carpentry machines, workshop equipments and provide for the family basic needs.

loans.use: To buy machines and workshop equipments for carpentry work.

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is 35 years old. He lives in the village of Kvirike, on the seaside of Georgia, with his large family: wife Irene, four children (8-, 11- and 14-year-old daughters and a newborn boy) and parents. His older children go to school,

All family members are involved in family agricultural activities, which is the main source of income for them. In particular, they have four milk cows and five calves. Irene and Ivane’s mothers produce cheese and sell them at the local market. Also the family owns 0.5 hectares of land, where citrus is grown. Ivane also has six beehives and bee families. Harvested citrus and honey are also sold at the local market to retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 650 Laris. 

Ivane requested credit for purchasing feed for livestock for the winter months. As Ivane feeds the cows with high quality natural food, he will get good milk from them and produce high quality cheese.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 44, works as a butcher in the food market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling meat since 2008 and already has her own permanent customers. Her main stock is beef, and she takes it from her permanent suppliers in countryside. 

Now she needs to increase her sock before this Lunar New Year day, the respectful Mongolian traditional holiday. Because the price of lamb increases during this holiday and sales volume is increased largely for weeks, she is taking a loan to purchase a large amount of beef from her supplier to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of beef from her supplier to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Altaibaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Altaibaatar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and his daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He works as a builder but his salary does not meet with his family's necessities. 

His wife Urantsetseg is unemployed currently and looks after her daughter at home. This year their daughter will be attending secondary school. Therefore Altaibaatar and his wife Urantsetseg decided to start a new business of clothes sales in the market during the day time. It is very beneficial to increase his family's income further.  According his plan, his wife Urantsetseg will sell casual and traditional nomadic clothes in the market. The loan Altaibaatar is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the commodities for his wife’s new business - clothes sales.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mrs. Sar, 46, is a humble villager who has been living in Pouk district. She has a fish selling business and raises poultry to earn a livelihood. She has a life partner in her husband who manages all the farming work and takes some time to catch fish from the river for her. This couple is blessed with 4 children, all of whom are single and living together at home. 

Mrs. Sar would to take out a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorcycle to use for the whole family and in their business, because they don’t own a motorcycle yet. This loan will better her family and make it comfortable to go anywhere they wish.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is thirty nine years old and is married to Benson. She runs a retail shop that has been in operation for two years. Her monthly income from the business is Ksh.5000.

This is her second loan with KADET and she has successfully repaid her previous loan. She intends to use these loan funds to buy stocks of sugar, flour, bread and cereals for her shop. Agnes hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock like sugar, bread and flour to sell

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 39 years of age and a dedicated farmer. He raises five children through his farming business. He cares a lot about his farm. He is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used to maintain his business. He has been in business for over 10 years and his monthly income is PHP12,000. 

Selling crops is his family's only source of income and Rolando is trying to increase his profits each month. He hopes, through this applied loan, he can uplift his income and uplift his business as well.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used to maintain his business.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en: Mathias is a 25 year old hardworking man who owns a butcher shop in Kagadi, Uganda. He wants a loan to buy cattle for slaughter ahead of the festive season. Having started from farming four years ago, he has managed to grow his business and wants to open up new shops in various urban areas. He also dreams of educating his two children.

loans.use: to buy cattle for slaughter

loans.name: Korandebe/bgrm Group

texts.fr:
James  fait partie du groupe Korandebe/Bgrm. Il a 26 ans et il est célibataire avec 4 enfants de 2 à 9 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

James est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture du riz en achetant d’autres champs du riz. Dans les prochaines années, James voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer se petit frère.
texts.en: James is a member of the Korandebe/Bgrm group.  He is 26 years old, single, and has four children ranging from 2 to 9 years.  Two of his children attend school.  He completed six years of primary education.  James is a rice farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers. In order to develop his business, his strategy is to increase the surface of his rice cultures through the purchase of additional rice fields.  In the coming years, James would like to be the supplier of rice for his region.  With the profits, he plans to provide for his younger brother's education.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Muzamilu

texts.en: Muzamilu is a 23-year-old hardworking man who wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for a transport business. He has been doing motorcycle transport locally (known as bodaboda) for four years. He started by working for someone else and accumulated money to buy a motorcycle. Muzamilu is married with one child, and dreams of starting up several businesses to sustain his growing family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a resident of Kagadi, Uganda, 50 years old, and a mother of five children. She lives in her own residential house and owns a retail shop in the same area that she has operated for eight years. She dreams of educating her children and turning the business into a wholesale trade.
Esther wants a loan to buy sugar for resell.

loans.use: to buy sugar for resell.

loans.name: Akuol

texts.en:
Akuol is a 28 year old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food stuffs in bor south Sudan for three years.
Akuol is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza is a Ugandan female aged 34 who owns a retail shop in Kagadi, Uganda. She wants a loan to buy sugar, soap and other merchandise for resell. Eight years ago she was doing farming from which she saved money to start a shop that has grown over the years. Inflation is affecting her business so she wishes to convert it into a wholesale shop in the future. She as a mother of four would like to see to that her children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and other merchandise for resell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina lives in the village of Akhalsopeli (west Georgia) with her family, husband Tariel and 21 years old son. She is 47 years old. Tariel is a truck driver and works in transportation of various cargos. Marina is leading the agricultural business of the family. In particular, she has 2 milk cows and 2 calves. Marina produces cheese and sells it to dairy products retailers. At the same time she cares for 400 nut trees and a half-hectare cornfield. Harvested nuts and maize are also sold to local retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris. 

Recently, Tariel’s truck got out of order and he had to stop working. Marina requested credit for purchasing spare parts to repair the truck. After repairing it, Tariel will continue to work and the family will again receive their planned income, which will be used for financing the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for truck repair

loans.name: Chanthoeurn

texts.en: Chanthoeurn, 24, is married, resides with her husband and a kid in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working as garment workers for three years. Due to less income, Chanthoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use as a motor taxi when he is free from his work at the factory to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a sewing shop at home and send her kids to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Djro-Mahuton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJRO-MAHUTON est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanne est mariée à un électricien du nom de Camille. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Jeanne mène comme activité depuis dix ans environs la vente de tissus par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire, Jeanne vend des sacs. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Jeanne s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJRO-MAHUTON, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group DJRO-MAHUTON is comprised of three persons who live in the same district. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Jeanne, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. 

Jeanne is married to an electrician named Camille. They have one child, who is in school and in their care. Jeanne lives together with her husband and child. The diverse household expenses are covered by the couple. To do so, Jeanne has had a business for ten years selling fabrics by the distribution system. On the side, she sells handbags. Her supplies come from one of the markets in Benin. This business enables her to help meet the needs of her family without much difficulty. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her income, Jeanne and the other members of the group DJRO-MAHUTON are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Esmeraldo

texts.en:
Esmeraldo is a hardworking man who has been in the rice farming business for almost 12 years. He cultivates a hectare plot of land, on which he grows rice and upon maturity, he harvests it and sells to traders. This is what his family relies on in order to sustain their basic needs, especially for school expenses of his six children. He has a large family and his income is just enough for their expenses. 

Esmeraldo aims to improve his crop production, but he has insufficient funds, so he is now asking for additional capital to buy three bags of rice seeds and fertilizers used in farming. He hopes that through his perseverance and sacrifices from his business, he will someday reap the fruits of his sacrifices and thus provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice seeds and fertilizers used in farming.

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Mrs. Yang, 28, is in the business of making bamboo baskets from the Pouk district. She is skilled in handicraft. Most of her products are bought by tradesmen who come to collect through the village. It’s easy work for her because she has learned to do it well with experience. Moreover, she is able to take time at home to look after her kid. She usually yields in the neighborhood of $2.50 per day through this business. Her husband shares his responsibility for the family by working as construction worker place to place around the province.

Mrs. Yang has applied for a loan from HKL to buy construction supplies for her husband to repair her kitchen that is broken. She is very happy with the loan given to her because it helps to better her living condition as needed.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 47-year-old married woman. She has three children with her husband, who works for a private company. Four years ago, Hanan started a small independent business from home. She started by selling clothes and added another type of product that is not even related – selling frozen food products such as frozen vegetables. For both businesses, Hanan has her own customers who keep knocking on her door asking for what she sells. Hanan has applied for a loan to expand her second business and buy one more freezer to stock more frozen food products.

loans.use: to buy one more freezer for frozen food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an over-lock sewing machine.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is 38-years of age, a hardworking and loving family man. He has been engaged in the cultivation of agricultural crops for more than eight years. Mainly, he grows rice as a source of income. He carefully takes care of his business to gain high profits. Truthfully, he is asking for the loan amount of P13,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his business.

He hopes to produce abundant crops through the farm inputs to be purchased to save for his three children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his business.

loans.name: Frontbek

texts.ru: Фронтбек 69-летний пенсионер, женат, воспитал пятерых детей.  В поисках средств дохода для своей семьи, в 1998 году Фронтбек начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Фронтбека, начатое с суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Фронтбек обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Фронтбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Frontbek is a 69 year-old married retiree, who raised five children.  In search of a source of income for his family, Frontbek started his own business of fattening up and reselling livestock in 1998.  Thanks to his persistence and tenacity, the business that was started with a sum of 1,000 som (KGS), now yields about 6,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of dairy and meat products.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Frontbek requested a loan in the sum of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a dairy cow.  He plans to invest the profits from the loan into further increasing his livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nhar

texts.en:
Nhar, 49, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer and sells rocks that she breaks from the mountain. Her husband is a construction foreman. Her daughter is employed at a garment factory. Nhar is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase rice seed and fertilizer to grow rice in the dry season.
In the future, she would like to expand her husband business and support her children to study higher.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed and fertilizer to grow rice in the dry season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shaving machines and other barber shop supplies.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.en:
Basilo’s priority in life is to make his family more economically stable. He is 53 years old and married to Candilaria. The couple was blessed with six children who are grown, wherein they are already helping him in their source of income.

He has planted and harvested rice for more than 20 years. He usually earns about PHP 10,000 every six months and he wishes to earn higher than his past profits. With his low profits, his family still feels financial constraints due to the high cost of daily necessities.

He needs to improve his crop production to grant his priority, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, pesticides and insecticides to ensure good crop production. He wants to increase the sales of his crops in order to provide a good and comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and insecticides to ensure good crop production.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in the village Natanebi (West Georgia) with her family: her husband Eduard, 7-year-old son and parents-in-law. Eduard owns a tractor and provides agricultural services to local farmers. Marine and her parents-in-law are involved in family agriculture, which is an important source of income for the family. They have three milk cows and two calves. Produced cheese is sold locally. Along with the dairy farm, the family grows maize, citrus and nuts on family-owned 0.5 hectare of land. Total average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris.

Marine requested credit for purchasing feed for livestock. After purchasing good natural feed, cows will give high quality milk. Also part of the requested credit will be used for purchasing a spare part for Eduard’s tractor, as it is out of order and needs repair.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock and spare parts for the tractor.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат, женщина 53 лет, мать семерых детей. Она вместе с мужем занимается откормом и продажей скота. Мамлакат живёт в пригорном кишлаке и поэтому её скот пасётся на пастбище, а вечером пастух загоняет их всех по домам. У неё сейчас три коровы. Кроме откорма скота она занимается производством пряжи, и вязанием зимних носков. Она хочет купить корм для них, поэтому её сумма не большая. Но планирует через три месяца получить побольше сумму для увеличения численности коров. Она рада сотрудничать с нашей организацией.
texts.en: Mamlakat is a 53 year-old woman and a mother of seven children.  Together with her husband, she is involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  Mamlakat lives in a mountainous village, and this is why her livestock goes to a pasture, and a shepherd brings livestock back home in the evenings.  Besides fattening up livestock, she is also involved in producing yarn and knitting winter socks.  Mamlakat wants to purchase animal feed for the livestock, and this is why her loan amount is small.  But she plans to obtain a larger loan in three months to increase cattle quantities.  She is happy to be partnering with our organization.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба проживает в районе Пяндж. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она более шести лет занимается скотоводством. Махбуба разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Mahbuba lives in the Pyandj district.  She is 40 years old, married and has four children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over six years.  Mahbuba breeds cattle at home.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of small livestock.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock

loans.name: Dukore/sk Group

texts.fr:
Richard  fait partie du groupe Dukore/Sk.Il a 32 ans,il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de secondaire.

Richard est agriculteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va acheter des engrais chimique et payement main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique et augmenter l’étendue des champs en achetant d’autres champs. Avec le profit  Richard voudrait construire une maison.
texts.en:
Richard is part of the Dukore / Sk.Il group  He is 32 years old and single. His level of education has been three years of high school.

Richard is a crop farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB; he will buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor.

His strategy to grow his business is to use chemical fertilizers and increase the area cultivated by acquiring other fields. With the profits Richard would like to build a house.

loans.use: buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз женщина 31 года, замужем имеет троих детей, муж работает мастером электриком на частные заказы. Дилафруз кредитуется уже второй год и она берёт кредиты на увеличение бизнеса. Она продаёт нижнее женское бельё. Товар привозит из Истаравшана и закупает у местных оптовиков. У неё очень большой разнообразный ассортимент, и поэтому имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Следующий займ, она хочет использовать на завоз зимних колгот и других женских товаров.  Она благодарна организации за понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Dilafruz is a 31 year-old woman, who is married and has three children.  Her husband works as an electrician as a private contractor.  Dilafruz has been obtaining financing for the second year now and takes out loans for business expansion.  She sells women's undergarments.  She brings her merchandise from Istaravshan and buys it from local wholesalers.  Dilafruz has a wide selection of merchandise and, thus, has regular customers.  She wants to use this loan to bring in winter tights and other women's goods.  She is grateful to the organization for the understanding and support.

loans.use: to purchase women's winter tights

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beers and sodas for resell.

loans.name: Francis Babu

texts.en: Francis, 32 years old, is married. He has three children with ages ranging from three and ten years old. He describes himself as an ambitious, polite and kind man. He operates a retail business where he sells papers. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are frequent and new. He describes his biggest business challenge to be government restrictions on paper sales and increased cost of paper sales. He will use the loan Kes 70,000 to purchase more paper bags. His business goal is to be a wholesaler of paper within five years.

loans.use: To buy more papers.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 45-year-old woman and the mother of four sons and two daughters. Her husband has a shop selling used furniture. Since they have a big family, and because of difficulties with their life, Najwa decided to help her husband support the family. They want to be able to help their kids finish school. So, almost 3 years ago, she started a small retail business at home selling cosmetics and makeup products.

Najwa has applied for a loan to buy more cosmetics products and to add perfumes to her stock. She hopes that one day she will be able to open her own store for cosmetics and accessories.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics products and perfumes.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a forty-one year-old hardworking man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house. He has been a farmer for ten years after starting with capital of UGX 300,000 and now has capital of UGX 1,500,000. His major hardships are: high fuel and transportation cost, price fluctuations and inflation. He has a goal of diversifying his farm. Alfred needs a loan to weed, plough and buy insecticides.

loans.use: to weed, plough and buy insecticides.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.en:
Bernardino is 51 years old and has three children. He likes to work hard because as he stated, he could be able to exercise as he goes on working. It is a healthy lifestyle, he added, but he cannot hide that this task is really difficult especially because he is getting old. Despite that, he patiently and humbly works and cares for his business.

As a matter of fact, he is asking a loan in the amount of P13,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use to develop his business to produce abundant crops. Hopefully, he can exceed his last crop to save for the betterment of their lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use to develop his business to produce abundant crops.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old and single though he supports his parents at home. 

He has been in the business of selling maize flour which he mills. He earns a monthly income of Kenya shilings 15,000 KES,which translates into Kenya shilings 180,000 KES per year.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and he is requesting a first loan of Kes 80,000. He plans to use this loan to buy many bags of maize for milling into flour.

He hopes to use the profits to expand his business and to mill branded maize in future.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize for milling.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma lives in Malindi, Kenya and has run a fruit business for three years. She is married and has two children who are both in primary school. She comes from an area that has a lot of fruits and therefore decided to sell the fruits in order to earn some income. She was introduced to Milango by a friend in May this year. (She had previously applied for, and repaid, a loan of Ksh 20,000.) Fatuma is now applying for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to enable her purchase more fruits. Her dream is to own/purchase a plot and keep dairy cows, a project she believes can be achieved within two years. This loan will increase the income for Fatuma and enable her to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлюда мать троих взрослых детей, которой 55 лет. Мужа нет в живых, поэтому она живёт со старшим сыном и он вместе ведёт семейные расходы. Сын работает водителем маршрутного городского такси, а его жена занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. Мавлюда вносит маленькую лепту в семейные нужды внося хоть не большой но доход с продажи сезонных домашних шлёпанцев и тапочек. На запрашиваемый кредит она хочет завезти партию зимних тапочек.
texts.en: Mavluda is a 55 year-old mother of three adult children.  Her husband has passed away, and this is why she lives with her oldest son, and they manage family expenses together.  Her son works as a driver of a municipal set-route taxi, and his wife is involved in household work and raising children.  Mavluda brings in a small contribution to the family needs, contributing her small profit from the sales of house flip flops and slippers.  She wants to use this loan to bring in an inventory of winter slippers.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of winter slippers

loans.name: Mahsudjon

texts.ru: Махсудчон парень бизнесмен , который имеет свою лепёшечную по выпечке на дому домашних национальных лепёшек. Он кредитуется в организации с 2007 года, ему всего 28 лет , но он уже смог расширить свою точку деятельности, и на получаемые доходы повышает социальное положение своей семьи. У него трое детей, жена домохозяйка, но тоже помогает в работе лепёшечной. У Махсудчона сейчас двое помощников и при большом заказе лепёшек помогает жена. На следующий кредит, Махсудчон хочет купить деревянные принадлежности для заготовки лепёшек.
texts.en: Mahsudjon is young businessman, who has his own bakery, where he bakes home-made national flatbread.  He has been obtaining financing from our organization since 2007.  Although he is only 28 years old, he has been able to expand his place of business and use earned profits to improve his family's social status.  He has three children, and his wife is a homemaker, but also helps with the bakery work.  Mahsudjon  currently has two assistants, and his wife helps out with large flatbread orders.  Mahsudjon wants to use this loan to purchase wood accessories for preparing flatbread.

loans.use: to purchase wood accessories for preparing flatbread

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru: Махмуд 54 летний мужчинка , который занимается дехканским хозяйством и откормом и продажей скота. Он живет в горном селении, где основной деятельностью населения является выращивание скота. У Махмуда сейчас на дому корова и 10 баранов. Получая кредиты в нашей организации, Махмуд значительно улучшил условия выращивания скота. Сейчас на рынке скот подешевел он хочет купить ещё две коровы, для откорма и продажи их в летний сезон. На снимке Махмуд в день выдачи с радостью выражает свою благодарность, что своевременно он сможет купить скот и достичь своих предпринимательских планов.
texts.en: Mahmud is a 54 year-old man, who is involved in dekhan farming and fattening up and selling livestock.  He lives in a mountainous location, where raising livestock is the residents' primary type of business.  Mahmud currently has a cow and ten sheep.  Receiving loans from our organization helped him to significantly improve the conditions for raising livestock.  Right now, livestock prices at the market have dropped, and Mahmud wants to buy two more cows for fattening up and subsequent sale in the summer.  On this photograph, Mahmud gladly expresses his gratitude on the day of loan disbursement for the ability to timely purchase livestock and achieve his entrepreneurial goals.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To change the old rickshaw with a new one.

loans.name: Noura

texts.en:
Recently Noura started a small business selling blankets of all sizes and clothes for children. Because she doesn’t have much capital for the business, Noura bought her products in small quantities and she ran out quickly. Now she has applied for a loan to increase her capital and buy a larger quantity of new products. She will try to buy at wholesale prices to make better profit.

Noura is 39 years old and has two daughters and a son. Her husband owns a truck to sell and distribute water.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Ajhan

texts.en:
Ajhan is a vibrant 41-year-old woman who has a big proud smile on her face as she shows her home in Iraq. She created and maintains a beautiful living space for her and her two children whom she is raising alone since her husband died. Since then she had to work twice as hard to create a respected social status.

At the end of the hallway is a separate room for her sewing, tailoring work. She developed her small business slowly, but the 20 years of experience shows in her work and in her positive attitude. 

She has and she will continue to work hard to make sure she can secure a great future for her children, and provide them the necessary means for a good education.  

Ajhan has successfully applied, received and repaid three consecutive loans in the past from Relief International-Iraq - each she used to step-by-step build up her equipment and workspace. She now took a loan of 1700 USD from RI-Iraq in order to purchase more fabric and raw materials and other small items to advance her workspace and advance her business.

loans.use: to purchase new fabric and other materials for her sewing and tailoring work.

loans.name: Reachiel

texts.en: Reachiel is 30 year-old married woman with four children — all of them in school. She has had a business selling food stuff in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Reachiel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 39 years old and lives in Kakata town. She is married and has five children between 7 and 20. They are in school and live at home. For the past five years she has been selling palm oil in the local market. One of her main challenges is that the price of palm oil is very high. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She hopes to build her house and attend college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase  more  palm oil  for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, soap, salt, beans, rice, etc to resell.

loans.name: Joie Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JOIE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Carine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Carine est âgée de 25 ans et vit au Bénin. Carine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Carine est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Marc. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Carine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la famille. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Carine exerce depuis dix ans environs la coiffure dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Carine vend des mèches. Carine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Carine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JOIE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group JOIE is comprised of three persons who are friends living in the same district. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Carine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. 

Carine is 25 years old and lives in Benin. She halted her studies in primary school. She is married to a driver named Marc. They have two children, in school and in their care. Carine lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly meet the diverse needs of the family. 

To help cover the various expenses, Carine has been a hair stylist for ten years in her neighborhood. Secondarily, she sells hair extensions. Her supplies come from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her income, Carine and the other members of the group JOIE are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her salon and provide good services for her clients

loans.name: Hilder

texts.en: Hilder, 25, is a mother of two children and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She inherited the grocery store which she is currently running from her late husband. She desires to educate herself and her children, and wants to move the business to a more permanent location and buy land to grow crops. Hilder intends to use the loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Khursanoy

texts.ru: Хурсаной жительница района Пяндж. Возраст, 45 лет. Замужем. Имеет одного ребенка. Она более шести лет занимается растениеводством. Кредит берет для закупа коровы. Хурсаной хочет заняться животноводством.
texts.en: Khursanoy is a resident of the Pyandj district.  She is 45 years old, married and has one child.  She has been involved in agriculture for over six years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a cow.  Khursanoy wants to get involved in animal husbandry.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu wants a loan to buy cows for slaughtering. He is a butcher living in Masindi, Uganda. He started by working for his father and now has his own business. His desire is to educate his children and save for a wedding. He is 32 years old and is married with four children. In the future, he intends to move the business to a more permanent location.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering

loans.name: Alymbek

texts.ru: Алымбеку 64 года. Он работал преподавателем иностранного языка в местной школе, а после выхода на пенсию  - стал работать в качестве администратора по хозяйственной части в местной сельской управе. В поисках дополнительных средств дохода для своей семьи, в 1994 году Алымбек начал свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Алымбека, его хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 10 голов баранов и 2 головы нетели. Также, он обрабатывает 1,32 га земли, где выращивает фасоль и картофель. Доходы от бизнес-деятельности Алымбек вложил  в ремонт дома. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Алымбек обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов. Доходы от кредита Алымбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Alymbek is 64 years old.  He used to work as a foreign language teacher at a local school and then, after retiring, started to work as a housekeeping administrator for the local village government.  In search of additional sources of income for his family, Alymbek started his own animal husbandry and farming business in 1994.  Thanks to his tenacity and persistence, today his business has ten heads of sheep and two heads of cattle.  Also, he works on 1.32 hectares of land, where he grows beans and potatoes.  Alymbek invested his business profits into repairs of his house.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, he requested a loan in the sum of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase sheep.  Alymbek plans to invest the profit from the loan into increasing his livestock quantities further.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 30 years old, married to Pietrina, and is blessed with two children. He has been running a private school for the past three years and has a monthly income of KES 10,000.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Benson will use the loan to renovate the school classrooms and buy chairs. With the anticipated profit from the business he plans to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to expand the school to accommodate a larger number of students.

loans.use: to renovate school classrooms and to buy chairs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy material for sewing

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her four children. She desires to educate her children and save for a wedding. Her business goal is to move her business to a more permanent location since she is now a market vendor and to hire employees to help expand her business.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Marine lives in the village Natanebi (West Georgia) with her family: husband – Eduard, 7 year old son and parents-in-law. Eduard owns a tractor and provides agricultural services to local farmers. Marine and her parents-in-law are involved in the family agriculture business, which is an important source of the income for the family. They have 3 milk cows and 2 calves. The cheese that they produce is sold locally. Along with the dairy farm, the family also grows maize, citrus and nuts on a family owned 0.5 hectare piece of land. The total average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris. 

Marine has requested credit for purchasing feed for their live-stock. After purchasing good natural feed, the cows will give high quality milk. Part of the requested credit will also be used for purchasing a spare part for Eduard’s tractor, as it is out of order and needs repair.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Koustan

texts.en:
Koustan is very kind and humble 22-year-old Iraqi woman. Her husband and their two small children live in small and modest, spotless home. While her husband works hard, she also wanted to contribute to the family's monthly income. 

To help support her family, in 2007 she started working from home on her old sewing machine mounted on a small wooden stool. To work, she sat next to it the floor.

Koustan took a loan of 1200 USD from Relief International in order to purchase a new sewing machine to replace her old one, and also to buy fabric and various accessories allowing her to not only alter old dresses but also make new ones. 

As the children grow, and she is able to work more, Koustan hopes to better support her sons and the family.   

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine.

loans.name: Tawananyasha Dzamwari Group

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Lydia from Machipisa, Harare. She is married with four children; two are attending school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Lydia runs a services business producing clothes. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenge she faces is electricity, which is in short supply in the country. 

Lydia has requested a loan of $400 to buy sewing materials ranging from fabric to sewing threads. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to support the two orphans left behind by her late sister and her own children. In the future, Lydia plans to own a factory shop for sewing.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is a 48 year old, energetic lady and part of beautiful family, a husband and two sons. Unfortunately she couldn’t help her children in completing their education. They left their education after the 5th standard and started working with their father. 

Kosar, herself, is a seamstress. She owns & operates a sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. Besides her sewing works, she also carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. Her husband is a milk man by profession. He also has some buffaloes. He takes care of them and gets their milk everyday and sells the milk to his community clients for profit.
 
Kosar is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying another buffalo that will allow him to increase the milk productivity and its profits. 

Kosar is very confident that, after investing the loan, her husband’s business will be further improved.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Aguet

texts.en:
Aguet is 29 year old a married woman with four children, and all of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Aguet is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is a responsible farmer. He began this occupation when he started accompanying his father on their farm land. He was still 19 at that time. Now he is already 49, married to Maribel and blessed with four children. 

Jesus wants to provide the necessities for his children, especially to his youngest child, currently studying. He is asking for a loan amount of PHP10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for his farming business. He hopes to produce better crops out of his loan to protect his family from an unsuitable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to improve his farming business.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion wants a loan to buy cows to sell in his butcher shop. He is a hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He started by working for other people and now has his own business. 

His desire is to educate his children and save for a wedding. He is 41 years old and married with eight children. He intends to move business to another market.

loans.use: to buy cows for his butchery.

loans.name: Kouassi

texts.fr:
Kouassi est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 4 enfants.
Kouassi travaille comme menuisier depuis 1985. Il fabrique des meubles pour tous clients dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seule. Au moment, il n’a pas de difficultés.
Kouassi a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des planches. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
 Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de financer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kouassi is a 34-year-old man. He is married to a retail merchant and has four children.

Kouassi has been working as a carpenter since 1985. He makes furniture for all-comers in a neighborhood of the city of Lome. He buys his materials in Lome, works alone and at this time is experiencing no problems.

Kouassi has requested his first credit loan from WAGES to purchase boards, as he wants to reinvest in the business.
He said that with the profits he expects to finance his children's education.

loans.use: Buy wood for furniture production

loans.name: Nonvidokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NONVIDOKPO est composé de douze personnes qui habitent la même agglomération et mènent toutes des activités. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Eugénie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Eugénie est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Fidèle. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à sa charge. En plus de leur enfant, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Eugénie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Eugénie mène comme activité depuis vingt ans la vente de blé et de sorgho dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Eugénie vend de l’huile végétale. Eugénie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Eugénie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement NONVIDOKPO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Nonvidokpo group is made up of twelve people who live in the same town and run various businesses. It is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé, with a view to raising their business volume. The representative of this group, whose name is Eugénie, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 35 years old and married to a welder by the name of Fidèle. The couple has one child who is at school and in their care. The couple also has another child in their care. Eugénie lives with her husband and the children, and the couple covers the various household expenses together. In order to do this, Eugénie has been selling wheat and sorghum in her region for the past twenty years. She sells vegetable oil as a secondary activity. She get her supplies from a town in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and increasing her turnover and income, Eugénie is, together with the other members of the Nonvidokpo group, requesting a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sorghum and cans of oil

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet wants a loan to buy second hand clothes for resale. She is a forty four year old married woman, lives in Masindi, Uganda, and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her three children. 

She desires to educate her children and buy a car or motorcycle. Her business goal is to expand into new markets.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr:
Madame Ndèye est une dame qui s’est lancé dans le petit commerce depuis dix ans .Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Son activité consiste à acheter des légumes dans les champs et à les revendre dans le marché local. C ‘est d’ailleurs pour cette raison qu’elle fait le crédit pour renforcer son activité.
Ndèye participe  à la dépense quotidienne et avec les bénéfices acquis elle souhaite aider son fils ainé qui fait du maraichage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndèye is a lady who started working in small trade ten years ago. She is married with children. Her activity is to buy vegetables in the fields for resale at the local market. This is why she sells on credit, as it helps to strengthen her business.

Ndèye helps with the daily household expenses, and she plans to use her profits to support her eldest son’s market gardening activity.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale at the local market.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is a 41-year-old Iraqi mother of two. In addition of being a wife and a mother she is also eager to work and help secure an additional income for her family. 

In her modest home she has a small, warm working space of some 2 square-meters where she creates beautiful, colorful dresses for women. She would like to manage her own working time, however this is rather difficult as the electricity in the city is often interrupted, at times the black-out is for hours. 

Bayan took a loan of 1200 USD from Relief International-Iraq in order to purchase a new sewing machine and a small generator to ensure a continuous source of power allowing her to manage her own time and work on making beautiful dresses.  

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase a generator and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make repairs to her house.

loans.name: Riak

texts.en:
Riak is 30 year old a married woman with three children, one of them is in school. She has had a business of selling food-stuff in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Riak is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and salt to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Wologuede Group

texts.fr: Le groupement WOLOGUEDE est composé de douze personnes qui mènent pratiquement les mêmes activités et résident dans le même village. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Victoire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Victoire est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Victoire n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Victoire est mariée à un certain Emile. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à sa charge. Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Victoire vend depuis huit ans des oignons dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Victoire vend de l’huile de palme et des poulets. Victoire s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Victoire sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement WOLOGUEDE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
WOLOGUEDE group is made up of twelve persons who run practically identical businesses and live in the same village. This is the second time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Victoire, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 38 years and lives in Benin. She's married to one Emile, and the couple has one school-attending child to support.

Victoire lives together with her husband and her child. The couple takes care of the various household expenses together.  

Victoire never attended school. In order to provide for her family, she's been selling onions in her region for eight years. As a secondary business, she also sells palm oil and chicken. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's towns. 

Eager to satisfy her clientele and in order to increase her revenue and income, Victoire, together with the other members of the group, is seeking a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions, palm nuts, and chicken

loans.name: Irshaad

texts.en:
Irshaad is 51 years old and attached to a clothes sewing business. She started her business to financially support her family. She is very good in her work and receives a good number of orders every month. Her husband is a milk seller. He has some buffaloes at home. He milks them everyday and sells the milk to his community clients. The quality of milk he provides is very good and he has a good number of clients in his community. 

Irshaad is the mother of 2 sons and 2 daughters. All of the children left their education without completion and now help their father in his business. Her sons help him by selling the milk to the community clients and her daughters support him by taking care of his buffaloes. 

Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo to increase the milk productivity. This will allow Irshaad's husband to sell milk in larger quantities and to make more profits. 

Irshaad is hopeful that an investment will be more productive for her husband.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Ayélé est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un maçon. Elle a 01 enfant.
Ayélé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des bazins et des liqueurs pour tous clients en ville. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficultés.
Ayélé a requis son 2nd  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bazins et des liqueurs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ayélé voudrait ouvrir d'autres boutiques. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ayélé is a 36-year-old woman.  She is married to a mason and has one child.

Ayélé has worked as a retailer since 2004.  She sells bazins [ornamental woven fabrics; damask] and liqueurs for all sorts of customers in town. She stocks up in Lomé. She works on her own. At the moment, she is not facing any difficulties.

Ayélé has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to stock up on bazins and liqueur.  She would like to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Ayélé would like to open new storefronts.  She says that with the profits, she foresees being able to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bazins and liqueurs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 35 year old married man living in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He is a teacher, and his personal goal is to build a permanent house for his family.
He is faced with the challenge of low pay which makes him unable to set up other income generating activities. His dream is to upgrade in his studies and also buy land so as to start farming .Charles needs the loan facility to buy land.

loans.use: to buy  land.

loans.name: Wendin-Yide

texts.fr:
Mme WENDIN-YIDE  est  mariée  et mère d’un(01) enfant. Il  a 03ans. Il fait la maternelle. Elle a 01 personne  en charge.

Elle vend  des mèches  depuis 03mois. Elle s’approvisionne  à Lomé et à Abidjan. Ses clients sont  les femmes et les filles.

Elle veut  s’acheter 01 carton de mèche outré et ½ carton de tissage.

 Mme remet  ses bénéfices dans son fonds de roulement. Comme  ambition, elle rêve d’avoir une grande boutique de mèches.
texts.en:
Mrs. WENDIN-YIDE is married and the mother of one child.  He is three years old.  He attends nursery school.  She has one person in her care.

She has been selling hair pieces for three months. She gets her supplies in Lomé and in Abidjan.  Her clients are women and girls. 

She want to buy one case of hair extensions and a half case of hair weavings. 

Mrs. WENDIN-YIDE puts her earnings back into her business.  She dreams of opening a large hair salon one day.

loans.use: to buy one case of hair extensions and a half case of hair weavings.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is a married man, aged 36 living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.
He deals in stationery and has been in business for three years. He used to only offer photocopying and printing services and after accumulating enough money, he bought stationery. He has a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demand. His dream is to expand the business into new markets. 
Joram needs the loan to buy stationery to sell.

loans.use: to buy stationery to sell.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor has operated his rice fields for almost 16 years. He is 45 years old, married to Rovilita and they have three children. He grows agricultural crops within their village. Melchor is an industrious and responsible man. He mainly sows rice crops and then sells them in the harvest season. He said that working on the land requires effort and patience to be able to obtain a good production of crops. This causes him to devote himself to his business.

Melchor is now requesting a loan amount of PHP10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for the cultivation of his farmland. He hopes for the better production in the next cropping season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers pesticides and to pay for the cultivation of his farmland.

loans.name: Bright

texts.en:
Bright is a determined young man of 25 who has been running his money transfer business since July 2011. He wants to use his loan money to purchase a small computer to speed up his transactions and to employ two people in his shop so that he can serve his customers faster. He also wishes to use the money to increase his working capital. 

Access to financial services in Zambia is both scarce and expensive. Close to 10 million Zambians, 80% of the population, do not have bank accounts. As most Zambians live in rural areas, distance and transportation factors hinder access to available financial services. Mobile Transactions Zambia Limited (MTZL) is an early stage company that specializes in low-cost mobile money and other financial transaction services by propagating an open network using small businesses called Champion Agents. Bright is one of the champion Agents. This is his story. 

When Bright first started his business his main focus was to get people in his community to know about the service that he provides. He started off by doing direct sales to customers in his community by distributing flyers and explaining his business to them in person. His strategy paid off because barely a month later his transactions had increased from a mere 10 transactions a day to 48 transactions a day. Because of the quick growth of his business he faces the challenge of working float (electronic and cash value of his working capital) which means he does not have enough working capital to satisfy his customers from time to time. He frequently has to close his shop and make trips to the bank to convert his electronic money to cash and vice versa. 

Bright is currently living with his grandmother who is taking care of five other people. He continues to work extra hard so that he can be able to move out of his grandmother's house and get his own place. In the next five years, Bright sees himself as a full blown businessman. He plans to open money transfer shops in two new locations. 

In Bright's video, the interview is conducted by a representative of Mobile Transactions.

loans.use: To purchase a small computer to speed up his transactions and to employ two people in his shop so that he can be able to serve his customers faster

loans.name: Soake

texts.fr:
Soake est une femme âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée å un gérant de video club. Elle a 3 enfants.
Soake travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2001. Elle vend des tubercules d’ignames pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Anié. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa principale difficulté est la mévente sur le marché.
Soake a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Soake voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Soake is a forty-seven year old woman. She is married to a manager of a video store. She has three children.
Soake has worked as a retailer since 2001. She sells yam tubers to all clients at home. She buys her products in Anié. She works alone. At the moment, her biggest difficulty is the slump in the market.
Soake requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy yams. She wants to reinvest in her business.
