In the coming years, Soake would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with the profits she foresees taking care of her family.

loans.use: to buy yams.

loans.name: Chyngyz

texts.ru: Чынгыз  36-летний фермер. Чынгыз, как младший сын, согласно кыргызским традициям,  живет со своими престарелыми родителями и заботится о них. В поисках  средств дохода для своей семьи, в 2007 году Чынгыз начал свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Чынгыза, его хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 30 голов баранов и 6 голов коров, приносящее около 9,000 сом (KGS)в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также, он обрабатывает 1 га земли, где выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы. В сезон, Чынгыз предоставляет услуги тракториста во время полевых работ.  В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Чынгыз обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Чынгыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Chyngyz is 36 year-old farmer.  As the youngest son, he lives with his elderly parents and takes care of them, according to the Kyrgyz tradition.  In search of sources of income for this family, Chyngyz started his animal husbandry and farming business in 2007.  Thanks to his tenacity and persistence, his business now has 30 heads of sheep and 6 heads of cattle, yielding about 9,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of dairy and meat products.  He also works on one hectare of land, where he grows beans and multi-year herbs.  Chyngyz also provides tractor driving services for field work during the season.  In order to further increase his livestock headcount, he requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase livestock.  Chyngyz plans to invest the profit from this loan into further increasing his livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Andre

texts.en: Andre is a 41-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He is the main source of income in the family and is trying the best he can to provide a better future for his young children with the cooperation of his wife. He has owned a metal shop for the past eleven years. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his shop. He notes that this Kiva loan will facilitate his work and increase his profits by 15%. In the future, he plans to expand his business by buying extra technological metal equipment.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Ayitchevo Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYITCHEVO est composé de dix huit personnes qui habitent le même village et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Célestine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Célestine est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Célestine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Célestine est mariée à un certain Eugène. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à sa charge. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Célestine vend depuis quinze ans de l’huile de palme dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Célestine vend des boules d'akassa (pâte faite à base de l’amidon de manioc). Célestine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Célestine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AYITCHEVO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
AYITCHEVO Group is made up of eighteen persons who live in the same village and run money-earning businesses. This is the second time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Célestine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 40 years old and lives in Benin. She's married to one Eugène. The couple has three children to support, out of which some attend school.

Célestine never attended school. In order to cover the various expenses of her family, she's been selling palm oil in her region for fifteen years. As a secondary business, she also sells "akassa balls" (a traditional beninese food, made out cassava starch). She gets her supplies in one of Benin's region.

Eager to satisfy her clientele and in order to increase her revenue and income, Célestine is seeking, together with the other members of the group, a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts to make palm oil

loans.name: Jamalat

texts.en:
Jamalat, who is a 37 year old young woman, is a mother for two sons and three daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, which is the only source of income for the family. Jamalat wants to make some repairs to her house, such as: painting, changing windows and doors, etc. As her children are growing up, she wants to add another room to her house so she can offer better living conditions to her family. 

Jamalat has an amount of money which is not enough to pay for the housing improvements, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. Getting this loan will enable Jamalat to pay for repairing her house and adding another room to her house. The loan will allow her to live with her family in better housing conditions. Jamalat is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed, instead, in the picture.

loans.use: to make some repairs to her house and to pay the expenses of adding a new room to her house.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a married man, aged 52 years, with eight children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. With the previous loan, he was able to earn a profit and used it to construct a permanent house where he now lives with his family. The profits will also allow his children to pursue their education.
In his business he is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations. His business plan is to acquire a lorry truck for the transportation of his produce. Fred wants another loan to buy cattle to resell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to resell at a profit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy maize and bean produce for resale

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié å une commerçante. Il a 2 enfants.
Kokou travaille comme revendeur depuis 2006. Il revend des pneus pour tous clients dans la zone portuaire. Il achète les produits au port autonome de Lomé. Il travaille seule. Au moment, n’as pas de difficultés.
Kokou a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pneus. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kokou voudrait ouvrir une boutique de vente de pneus. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Kokou  is a 32-year old man. His wife is a vendor. He has two children. Kokou has been working as a vendor since 2006. He buys and resells tires to the general public in the port area. He buys his goods at the autonomous port of Lome.   He works by himself. At present, he has no problems [with the business]. Kokou has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy tires. He would like to reinvest in his business. In the years to come, Kokou would like to open a store to sell tires. He says that he plans to use the revenues to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kakata. She is married. Marie stopped her education in the 7th grade. She has a 16-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past thirteen years she has been selling groundnuts and dried pepper. One of the main challenges she faces is that during the rainy season she can lose many customers. She enjoys her business during the dry season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnuts and dried pepper for her business. She plans to expand her business into a shop or store.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts and dried pepper for her business

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en: Muhannad, a 24-year-old hardworking young man, is single and living with his family. He started his own business at a young age, tailoring and sewing at home. He started by buying one sewing machine and some fabric and began working at home. Now Muhannad has applied for a loan to buy more fabric and material needed to continue tailoring and making clothes. He hopes to open his own workshop one day, so he can employ people – especially those who are in need of work.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and material needed to continue tailoring and making clothes

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 28-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He really cares for their future and is ready to do the best he can to see them graduate and attain higher educational degrees.  For that reason, he started to work in a local airport in 2007. In parallel, he works as a policeman in one of the local municipalities. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children's educational fees. In that way, they will be able to continue their education properly. In the future, he plans to focus on one industry as to make more profits and better support his family.

loans.use: to pay his children's educational fees

loans.name: Sejrogande Group

texts.fr: Le groupement SEJROGANDE est composé de vingt et neuf personnes. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupement, du nom de Philomène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Philomène est âgée de 56 ans et vit au Bénin. Philomène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Philomène est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Alexis. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et trois restent à leur charge. Philomène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Philomène exerce depuis une vingtaine d’années, la vente de divers produits dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Philomène vend de l’huile de palme. Philomène s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Philomène sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement SEJROGANDE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
SEJROGANDE is made up of twenty-nine persons. This is the first time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Philomène, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 59 years old and lives in Benin. She's married to a cultivator named Alexis.

The couple has six children, out of whom some attend school. They still have three children to support. Philomène lives together with her husband and her children. The couple takes care of the various household expenses together.

Philomène never attended school. In order to contribute to covering the expenses of her family, she's been selling various products in her region for about twenty years. As a secondary business, she also sells palm oil. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's region.

Eager to satisfy her clientele and in order to increase her revenue and income, Philomène is seeking, together with the other members of the group, her first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy various products to resell and palm nuts to turn into palm oil

loans.name: Marisella

texts.en:
Marisella is 35 and has been in mixed farming for 10 years. Her farming products include passion fruit, maize, beans, tomatoes, milk and coffee. She relies on farming for her family upkeep and as her core business.

Marisella has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and to construct a poultry unit for her new venture. She says the income will enable her to provide basic needs for her three children, ages 14, 8 and 4. Marisella is also planning on buying more dairy cows and expanding her potato acreage. She notes the challenges to be high costs of fertilizer and pests that damage crops.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds and construct a poultry unit

loans.name: Erkinoy

texts.ru: Эркиной жительница района Пяндж. Возраст, 46 лет. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. У нее среднее образование. Она занимается посевом зерновых культур. Кроме того она выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 11 лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Erkinoy is a resident of the Pyandj district.  She is 46 years old, married and has three children.  She has a secondary education.  Erkinoy is involved in growing cereal crops.  Besides this, she also grows vegetables.  She has been involved in this business for 11 years.  Erkinoy is requesting this loan for the purchase of small livestock.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya and has been in farming for the last 25 years. His farm produces potatoes, carrots and milk for the local market. He earns extra income from his retirement pension. He is married with 5 children, all adults.

Justus has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to buy a dairy cow. He says he will continue buying more quality breed dairy cows to boost his farming income. He adds the income will enable him to feed his family and educate the last born child.

He laments of the high cost of animal feed and animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motor, and head and rear lights

loans.name: Dan Michael

texts.en:
At the age of 19, and with two years of farming experience, Dan Michael dreams about having his own land to cultivate. He’s longing to work his own land because he aspires to increase his income, and have the working capital to continue farming. Thus he could help his whole family get ahead in life. He is enthusiastic to work for the sake of his family.

He is now asking for a loan amount of 8,000 pesos to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. With the loan, he hopes to gain high rice production in the next crop, which will enable him to save for his studies, as well as to lift their poor living standard.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Bidossessi Group

texts.fr: Le groupement BIDOSSESSI est composé de quinze personnes qui résident dans la même région. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Martine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Martine est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Martine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Martine est une veuve et n’a aucun enfant. Cependant, Martine a deux enfants à charge. Pour subvenir à ses divers besoins et à ceux des enfants à charge, Martine vend depuis une trentaine d’année, de la farine de manioc, et du maïs dans une ville du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Martine vend de la boisson locale. Martine s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Martine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement BIDOSESSI, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The group BIDOSSESSI is made up of fifteen people who live in the same area. This is the second time that the group has asked for financial aid from Alidé, in order to increase their activity levels. The representative of the group, named Martine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Martine is forty-six years old and lives in Benin. Martine did not attend school. Martine is a widow and doesn't have any children. However, Martine is taking care of two children. In order to provide for her various needs and those of the children in her care, Martine has sold flour, manioc, and corn for around thirty years in a city in Benin. Additionally, she sells local drinks. Martine stocks up in her area. In striving to satisfy her clients and to increase her turnover and her revenues, Martine is asking with the other members of the group BIDOSSESSI for a second loan from Alidé. Their first loan has been paid off.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Sarybay

texts.ru: Сарыбаю 54 года, женат, воспитал пятерых детей. В поисках  средств дохода для своей семьи, в 2002 году Сарыбай начал свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. На 3,0 га орошаемой земли Сарыбай выращивает картофель, кукурузу и пшеницу, а также имеет в хозяйстве 3 головы коров и 5 баранов. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Сарыбая, его хозяйство на сегодняшний день приносит от 5,000 до 25,000 сом (KGS)в сезон. Также, в несезонное время Сарыбай предоставляет услуги такси. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Сарыбай обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян пшеницы и картофеля, боронирование земли и покупку минеральных удобрений. Доходы от кредита Сарыбай планирует вложить в постройку более удобного  и вместительного сарая и постройку забора.
texts.en: Sarybay is 54 years old, married and has raised five children.  In search of income sources for his family, he started his own animal husbandry and farming business in 2002.  He grows potatoes, corn and wheat on three hectares of arable land, and also has three heads of cattle and five sheep.  Thanks to Sarybay's tenacity and persistence, his business yields from 5,000 to 25,000 som (KGS) per season today.  He also provides a taxi service during the off-season.  In order to further expand his business, Sarybay requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase wheat and potato seeds, treat land and purchase mineral fertilizers.  He plans to invest the profit from this loan into building a more comfortable and spacious barn and building a fence.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Khoni, West Georgia, with his family--which includes his wife, Keso, his 24-year-old son, and his daughter-in-law. All the family members are involved in agricultural activities. They have a milk cow, the milk of which is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold in the local market to dairy-product retailers. Also, the family owns a plot of land with 300 nut trees. Harvested nuts are sold in the local market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 laris. 

David requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. They will double the amount of cheese produced and sold. It will positively impact the income of the family. With the increased income, the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 37 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is single and has two children, ages 3 and 6. Both of them are attending school and live at home. For the past five years Annie has been selling cosmetics, soft drinks, and biscuits in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, biscuits and cosmetics for her business. She hopes to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, biscuits and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flasks of palm oil and clusters of bananas.

loans.name: Byona Biyinzika S & C Co-Operative Society Group B

texts.en:
To Musa, a 60-year-old father of 6, the only thing that adds up when it comes to business is success. From his estimation, it's only hard work that at length culminates into achievement.

Musa owns a restaurant in Kampala. He has been in this business for close to 7 years now. He offers all delicacies, but it is mostly the local delicacies, like cooked bananas, stemmed green vegetables, ground nut sauce, etc. that most of his clients are really partial to.

Musa is hoping to begin with a clean slate on the threshold of next year. He envisions expansion. This, he says, has been long overdue due to the fact that his clientele has been increasing.

Musa says this Kiva loan will come in handy in the purchase of more foods for his restaurant like bananas, cassava, maize flour, dried beans, ground nuts, rice, peas, yams, and sweet potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase more foods for his restaurant like bananas, cassava, maize flour, dried beans, ground nuts, rice, peas, yams, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Grace Ndumi

texts.en: Grace is a 23-year-old married woman. She has a son who is 3 years old. She describes herself to be talkative. Grace operates a motorcycle garage where she sells tires and does vehicle servicing. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are motorcycle owners. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for buying the spare parts. Grace will use the loan to purchase more spare parts. Her business goal is to run a similar motorcycle garage in a nearby town within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more tubes, tires and rims

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a mother of 2, ages 10 and 4, and has been farming for the last 5 years, producing bananas and eggs for the local market. She also runs a retail shop and a salon business besides farming.

Virginia has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a power saw to venture into timber sales. She says she will use the machine in lumbering with the help of employees at minimal fees. She is focusing on buying a motorcycle too, for taking supplies to the market.

She sees the access to funds as the greatest challenge to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to buy a power saw

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward lives in the village Pirveli Obcha with his family--which includes his wife, Sophia, his 11-year-old daughter, his 8-year-old son, and his parents. Along with the monthly pensions of Edward’s parents, who are retired, agriculture is the main source of income for the family. They have a small dairy farm with three milk cows and a calf. They produce cheese and sell it to local dairy-product retailers. Also, they have a pig and sell on average 12 pigs per year. In addition to the aforementioned, Edward cares for 70 nut trees owned by the family. Harvested nuts are sold locally as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 laris.

Edward requested credit for purchasing nut saplings. He will add them to the existing orchard, and after a couple of years the family will get more nuts to sell. Their income will increase, which will improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase nut-tree saplings

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 59-year-old mixed-crop farmer. He is married to Tabitha who is also a farmer. They are blessed with four adult children. He has been in the farming business for the past 10 years, with a monthly income of 10,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

David is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. David will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy a dairy cow. His hope and dream is to open a retail shop for his wife which will help them improve the living standard of their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 49 years of age, married, and blessed with five children. He has been a farmer for over 15 years. He usually plants rice and sells it when he harvested. His aspiration is to improve the quality of living for his family, but because of insufficient profits, he has not been able to provide what he aspires to. 

Nestor is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds, and to pay for the labor costs needed in planting rice. He knows that this loan will help his business to produce a bountiful harvest as long as he accompanies it with hard work.  Then it will surely lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds, and to pay for the labor costs needed in planting rice.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 45-year-old married woman with 5 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been farming for commercial purposes. She faces the challenges of seasonal changes, price fluctuations and inadequate capital. Her personal goals are educating her children and self-education. Her business goal is to hire more employees to help expand her business and produce better products. Christine needs the loan to buy agro-inputs and fertilizers for her gardens.

loans.use: to buy agro- inputs and fertilizers for her gardens

loans.name: Ishenbay

texts.ru: Ишенбаю 53 года, женат. В поисках  средств дохода для своей семьи, в 1996году Ишенбай начал свой бизнес в животноводстве. Начав  со стартовой суммы в 6,000 сом (KGS), благодаря неустанному ежедневному труду, Ишенбай смог развить хозяйство с численностью в 4 головы коров, 20 баранов и 2 лошадей с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Ишенбай обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота и кормов на зиму. Доходы от кредита Ишенбай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Ishenbay is 53 years old and married.  In search of income sources for this business, he started his own animal husbandry business in 1996.  He started with an initial sum of 6,000 som (KGS) and, thanks to his tireless daily labor, was able to grow his business to have 4 heads of cattle, 20 sheep and 2 horses with a monthly profit of 10,000 som.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Ishenbay requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for the purchase of additional livestock and fodder for the winter.  He plans to invest the profits from this loan into increasing his livestock headcount further.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and fodder

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en: Lorpu is 44 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 14, all of whom are presently in school and live at home. For the past fifteen years, Lorpu has been selling groundnut in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnut  for her business. She plans to continue to educate her children and to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnut.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly is a 38-year-old single mother who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. In addition to her primary profession of teaching, she owns a shop and has been a farmer for the last ten years. In her business, she faces the challenges of price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal weather, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. She needs this loan in order to buy salt and maize flour to sell during this Christmas season.

Molly's personal goals are to educate her children and to live up to the standards of the changing economy. Her business goal is to expand her business into a big wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy salt and maize flour to sell during this Christmas season.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 47 years old and is married to Damaris. They are blessed with three children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past five years, through which he realizes a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after having successfully repaid his previous loans. James will use this loan to service his motorcycle. With the anticipated profit from this business, he will educate his children.

James' hopes and dreams are to buy a car and to use it as a taxi, which will increase his income and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His current business is motorcycle transport, which he has been operating for the last two years. He faces challenges of price fluctuations and inflation, and high fuel and transportation costs. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home. James needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle for transportation, since he has been working for another person.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 51-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three children. One of them is working while two others are still studying. He’s doing the best he can to satisfy his family's needs and pay his children’s education fees. He has been working as a construction supervisor in one of the local companies for the past seven years. Today, he’s looking for a loan of $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his children’s university fees. He notes that education is really important, especially to empower children’s personalities and know how to deal with life's difficulties. In the future, he plans to take out more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay his children’s university fees.

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en: Zaverio is a thirty-nine-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children and building a permanent home. He has been a farmer for the last seven years. He started with capital of three hundred thousand and now has capital of two million. His major hardships are price fluctuation, high fuel and transportation costs and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a goal of diversifying his farm and expanding his farm into new areas. Zaverio needs a loan facility to buy pesticide and weed the garden.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and weed the garden.

loans.name: Twekambe Rweega Group

texts.en: Yakobo is a male aged 48, a father to 13 children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a carpentry workshop and has been making furniture for the last 21 years. He has difficulty resulting from inadequate capital and modern equipment to use in his business. He dreams of educating his children, expanding his business to new markets and acquiring modern equipment. He is a member of a group where each one guarantees the other to access a loan. He wants a loan to buy lumber for making furniture.

loans.use: to buy lumber for making furniture.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 43 years old, with one child. She has a produce business and has been running it for 10 years now. She faces a challenge of high inflation rates, and her family goal is to educate her child. She hopes to expand her business to new markets and wishes to take a loan for buying more products like rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen, aged 25 years, is a single lady who runs a photocopying business that has been in operation for two years. The business earns her a monthly income of about Kes 12,000. This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the funds to buy another photocopier machine and printing paper.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier machine.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel is a very hard-working man who has been running a farming business for over fifteen years. He is 45 years old, married, and blessed with five children. 

He is applying for a loan of P15,000 to buy farm inputs, like seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to produce more crops with this loan to lift his family from poor living.  He intends to provide a comfortable life and make them feel contented with the living he provides. With his industriousness, he knows that someday they will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya and has been producing coffee, tea and milk for the local market for 20 years running. He is married with 3 children aged 20,18, and 15.

Johnson has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, this being his second loan after the first one of 45,000 KES. He says he will build a store for keeping animal feeds so as to reduce the cost lost when the droughts persist. He adds that the additional income from good feeding will ensure the family to have a significant difference in their total income.

John says Juhudi Kilimo is helping smallholder farmers in the area.

loans.use: To construct storage for feed.

loans.name: Basima

texts.en: Basima is a 62-year-old widowed woman who is still physically strong and working to support herself. A year ago, Basima started buying and selling olive oil cans and tanks to her neighbors and friends. She is looking for an opportunity to get a contract with one of the oil presser factories to get the oil at a better price and change her target audience to the wholesale traders and shops. Basima has applied for a loan to buy more olive oil tanks and make more profit to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy more olive oil tanks and make more profit to achieve her goal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer is married and is a loving father of three children. He is an industrious and determined man. He has been growing agricultural crops for more than ten years. He grows rice as a primary source of income. He wants to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for sowing.  He is asking for a loan of P13,000 for this purpose. He hopes it will bestow plentiful profits for the assurance of their future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for sowing

loans.name: Kibui

texts.en:
Kibui is a 70-year-old businessman, and he is married to Margaret who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been selling foodstuffs for the past ten years, which earns him a monthly income of about KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully. Kibui will use the loan to buy foodstuffs for his business. With the anticipated profit he will expand the business. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a big retail shop and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for his business.

loans.name: Adol

texts.en: Adol is a 25-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Langber Bor, South Sudan for three years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, age 41 years, is married to Nicholas and is blessed with three children. She runs a car hire business that has been in operation for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of about KES 15,500.

This is her second loan with KADET and she has successfully repaid the previous loan. She will use the funds to buy spare parts for the cars. 

Lucy hopes to own a fleet of cars for hire in the future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the cars.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily has been in mixed farming for 14 years and currently employs one farmhand. Her farm produces milk and tea for the local market. She earns additional income from her retail shop business.

She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy birds for a poultry farming venture. She says the business opportunity exists and she hopes to get more income and make life better for her family.

Lily says the main challenge is in their small parcels of land, which limits farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a mother of 3 minors and is in mixed farming, with her produce of milk and tea going to the local market. She has been farming for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan of 49,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her build a zero grazing unit for her dairy animals. She is optimistic she will be able to earn more income and make her family secure financially.

Caroline notes that lack of skills, especially on handling dairy farming, is a major challenge and calls for training.

loans.use: To construct a grazing unit.

loans.name: Chepkoech

texts.en:
Chepkoech is aged 32 and has been in farming for 12 years. She is married with three children between the ages of 10 and 3 years. She gets additional income from her teaching employment with the government.

She has requested a loan of 50,000 KES which she plans to use in acquiring poultry birds for 20,000 KES and a chuff cutter at 30,000 KES for her farm. She expects her income to go up, making it easier to provide for the children's basic needs.

Chepkoech is happy with Juhudi Kilimo for their loan services, especially the provision for grace periods.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has been in active mixed farming for over 18 years in her home area of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. Her farm currently produces milk, tea and poultry for the local market with the help of one farmhand. She reiterates that farming is her only source of income.

Lucy has requested a loan of 28,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help build a zero grazing unit for the animals. She is optimistic the business will be better with the loan and hopes to be able to improve her family's living standards. She is, however, apprehensive with the poor market for the produce.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit for the dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items like sacks of maize, grain and many others.

loans.name: Joe Herry

texts.en:
Joe Herry is a young farmer from Minanga. He lives with his parents, who always help him with agriculture. His father is already old so Joe Herry is required to work their farm land. At the age of 18, he is already expert in managing farming. At the last harvest, he earned P12,000 which is not sufficient for his family to live.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, essential inputs used in farming. He hopes that this loan will allow him to sustain productive crops and receive enough income for his family to prosper.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with 2 children, aged 17 and 4 years. He has been in active farming for 3 years and produces milk and eggs for the local market. He is age 28.

Andrew has requested Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva partner, to advance him a loan of 31,200 KES to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says his focus is to own four dairy cows and to buy a motorcycle to help him in making cheap deliveries to the markets. He hopes improved farming will enable him to educate his children and give them better living standards.

He also points at the challenge poised by animal diseases as the major drawback. He is, however, keen on fully repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 41-year-old businessman. He is married to Judy, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with four children. He has been selling scrap metals for the past 20 years. He uses his monthly income of KES 15,000 to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET, Ltd. after repaying the previous loans successfully. Joseph will use the loan to buy more scrap metals for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams include opening a spare-parts shop, which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy more scrap metals for his business

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en: Ayen is a 34-year-old married woman with two children who are not in school. She has been selling fish in Bor, South Sudan, for two years. Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard has been farming for 5 years, and he produces maize and eggs, which he sells to the local market. He also operates a motorcycle business in his home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. He is 41 and married with 4 children who are all attending school.

Benard has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the income will help him to educate the children as well as to expand his farming business. He is planning on having five dairy cows on his farm.

He notes that animal disease remains his major challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, hair products, wigs, and hair oils to resell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 31 and has been farming in Nkubu for four continuous years, producing maize, beans, potatoes, pawpaws, and peas, which she sells to the local market. She also runs a retail shop, in addition to farming. She is married with three children aged 9, 6, and 2 years.

Mercy has requested a loan of 52,500 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says she will use the farming income to repay the loan before saving to expand her shop and farming activities. She hopes to grow the business and educate her children with her farming income.

She laments the challenges of inadequate rainfall and rampant animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Druscillah Moraa

texts.en: Druscillah is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 3 children between the ages of 9 and 11. She describes herself as a courageous woman. She operates a retail shop where she sells home products such as bread, salt, cooking oil, and detergent. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located at a strategic and competitive place. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stocks of home products. Her goal is to expand the business to create job opportunities for people within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her retail store.

loans.name: Aluel

texts.en:
Aluel is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling foodstuffs in Bor, South Sudan, for five years.

Aluel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and salt. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cows and goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items, such as sacks of maize

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is a farmer from the village Kvishilori, West Georgia. He is 53-years-old, married and lives with his family: wife – Gulnazi, his 29-year-old son, daughter-in-law and 2 grand daughters (3 and 5 years old). Guram’s son works as a worker in the village. His salary is the main source of income for the family. Guram takes care of a milk cow. He produces cheese and sells it at the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Guram requested credit for renovation of the family house as it is already old and needs some improvements. Guram will purchase the renovation materials and his son and he will perform the renovation work. After the renovation the family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly lives in Minanga and manages a farming business. He is 37-years-old, married and has three children. He has been working in his field for eight years and he knows that it is difficult. He wants to work in his business for the development of his family’s living.

He is now requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds to sow, fertilizers and insecticides required in performing farming. He hopes to gain high income through his loan to provide a better life to his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds to sow, fertilizers and insecticides required in performing farming.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old and married to Carren. He has been in business for the last 6 years, and he earns a monthly income of KES 96,000 by selling used clothing. He is applying for his first loan of KES 80,000 to buy more stocks of second-hand clothes. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to expand his business by opening another shop.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Moris Muthee

texts.en: Moris is a married Kiva borrower. He has 2 children, aged 3 and 4. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail shop where he sells spare parts and home products. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His shop is located in a conducive business environment. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high cost of the products he sells. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock for his retail store. His business goal is to venture into transportation services within 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his retail store.

loans.name: Adit

texts.en: Adit is a 36-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has been selling food items in Bor, South Sudan, for two years. Adit is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil to sell

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is a farmer from the village Pirveli Obcha, West Georgia. He is 43-years-old, married and lives with his family: wife Lia, 3-year-old daughter, 2-year-old son and parents. The children go to kindergarten. Koba is leading the agricultural business of the family which is the main source of income for them. 

They have a vineyard with 1000 vine trees. Koba makes wine and vodka and sells them in the village. Also the family sells nuts, harvested from family owned 100 nut trees. Along with the above mentioned, Koba and his father run small bee-keeping farm. They have 5 bee-hives with bee-colonies. Gathered honey is sold locally. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris, including the monthly pensions of Koba’s parents. 

Koba requested credit for purchasing additional 10 bee-hives and bee-colonies. He will triple the amount of gathered honey and sell it in the village. The income of the family will increase. They will be able to create better living conditions for their children and themselves.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives and bee-colonies.

loans.name: Tentuan

texts.en:
Tentuan, 36, is married to Regina and blessed with two children, aged five and two years. He runs a butcher shop that has been in operation for the past three years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 4000.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He intends to use the funds to buy stocks of meat for his butcher shop. He will use the anticipated profits to start a ranch and hopes to supply beef countrywide in the future.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Rose Muthoni

texts.en: Rose is a married woman with 2 children, ages 3 and 8. She is an ambitious woman. She operates a grocery retail business where she sells tomatoes, oranges, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a conducive business environment. She describes her biggest challenge as the high cost of the goods she buys to resell. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more tomatoes and oranges. Her goal is to diversify her business by expanding into a big retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more oranges and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items like maize.

loans.name: Chrysologue

texts.fr:
Chrysologue est né au Rwanda et a 30 ans. Il est marie avec 1 enfant de 7 mois. Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans de l’université.

Chrysologue est chauffeur d’un taxi voiture. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va acheter des produits alimentaires pour le stock de sa boutique. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’accroitre le stock de sa boutique pour éviter la rupture de stock et devenir un grand commerçant des produits alimentaire. Chrysologue voudrait offrir des services de qualité en commerce de boutique et avoir un mini super marché. Avec le profit  Chrysologue voudrait scolarise ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Chrysologue was born in Rwanda and is 30 years old. He is married with one 7-month old child. He completed three years of university.

Chrysologue is a taxi driver. This is his first loan with ACB. He is going to buy food products to stock his shop.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to increase the stock of his shop to avoid being out of stock and to become a great businessman of food products. Chrysologue would like to offer quality services at his shop and have a mini supermarket. With the profits, Chrysologue would like to pay for his children's schooling and improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy food products to stock his shop.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 26-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, sugar, and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, and oil for resale.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura lives in the West Georgian village Dimi with her family: husband – Avtandil and 21-year-old son. She is 46-years-old. Laura leads the agricultural business of the family. They have a milk cow. Laura produces cheese and sells it at the local market. Also she produces wine and vodka with the grapes, harvested from the family owned 500 vine-trees. 

Laura requested credit for purchasing materials for greenhouse construction. She will grow tomatoes and potatoes during all seasons. Harvested vegetables will be sold locally. The new business initiative will significantly increase the income of the family, which will be used for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Cosmus

texts.en:
Cosmus, aged 42 years, is married and has four children. He does dairy farming and has been doing this for thirteen years. The business earns him a monthly income of Kes. 9,900.

This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the funds to buy cattle feeds like hay and molasses and use a modern fertilization method (artificial insemination) for his dairy cows. Cosmus hopes to be a large-scale dairy farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy hay and molasses and use artificial insemination for his cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy biscuits, cigarettes, chewing gum, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane, tem 43 anos, tem 7ªclasse. Vive marritalmente e ee pai de 12 filhos.
Pratica o  negocio de vende de roupa usada na feira informal, nas quarta e sabados a mais de 12 anos.Nao tem empregados mas conta com ajuda da sua sobrinha que vive com ele,. Tem um rendimento mensal de 3000mt que aplica nas despesas da casa e na obra de reabilitacao da sua casa.
Este é o quinto emprestimo na hluvuku no valor de  de 15.000,mt para aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria os  quatro anteriores todos de 10.000,mt foram para mesma actividade. Futuramente pretende adiquirir mais emprestimos para comprar uma viatura para melhor gerir o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Luis was born in Inhambane. He is 43 years old and finished the seventh grade. He lives with his partner and has 12 children.
He's been selling secondhand clothing in the local market on Fridays and Saturdays for more than 12 years. He doesn't have any employees, but his niece, who lives with him, helps him with the business. He earns about 3,500 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses and for renovating his home.
This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to increase his stock. His four previous loans, all for 10,000 meticals, were used for the same purpose. In the future, he plans to request further loans to buy a vehicle that will help him run his business better.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Ousmane est agriculteur depuis quinze ans .Il accompagnait son père aux champs dès le bas âge ; c’est comme cela qu’il a appris le métier .Il habite un village qui se trouve à  peu près à  16 km de la ville principale.
Avec le crédit il va acheter des semences et des intrants agricoles.
Dans le futur il envisage d’ exploiter d’ autres domaine avec une quantité supérieur à celui qu’il a maintenant.
texts.en:
Ousmane has worked as a farmer for fifteen years. He accompanied his father to the fields beginning when he was very young; this is how he learned the profession. He lives in a village that is about 16 km from the main city.
With this loan, he is going to buy seeds and farm inputs.
In the future, he plans to farm more fields in greater quantity than he does now.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Gaza , tem 34 anos, tem 5ªclasse, casada e mae de 5filhos.
É  proprietaria de um pequeno estabelecimento comercial em sua residencia d e venda de produtos de primeira nacessidades comidas, artigos de higiene e bebidas. conta com ajuda duma empregada que oufere 1.500mt por mes. Tem tido um rendimento mensal de 5.000mt no qual 2.000mt envia para os seus sogros .
Este é terceiro emprestimo na hluvuku  no valor de 15.000,00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio, os anteriores de 30.000mt e de 40.000mt foram para construcao da sua casa. No futuro pretende comprar uma camioneta para facilitar o transporte dos seus produtos.
texts.en:
Florencia was born in Gaza. She is 34 years old and finished the fifth grade. She is married and has five children.
She runs a small shop out of her home, where she sells staple goods such as food, hygiene products, and drinks. She has one employee, whom she pays 1,500 meticals a month. She earns 5,000 meticals a month, of which she sends 2,000 meticals to her parents-in-law.
This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries. She used the previous loans, in the amounts of 30,000 and 40,000 meticals, to build her house. In future she intends to purchase a truck that will make it easier for her to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy staple goods for her shop.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 27-year-old a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school.

She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Amer is requesting this loan through BRAC Suth Sudan to purchase beans, sugar and milk. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar and milk for resale.

loans.name: Ntesho

texts.en:
Ntesho, age 43 years, is married to Sopilal and they are blessed with three children between 10 and 17 years old. 

He runs a butchery that has been in operation for 11 years.

This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the funds to start another butchery and hopes to start a beef supply company in the future.

loans.use: To open a new butchery.

loans.name: Alexandrea

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Moamba, tem 31 anos, tem 7ªclasse,vive na casa própria com sua familia é pai de 1 filho e responsabiliza se pelos seus pais. 
É   proprietàrio de um barco de pesca onde faz as sua actividades pesqueiras ha mais de 10 anos. Não tem empregados, mas conta com ajuda da sua esposa. tem  um rendimento mensal de 5.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. Para alêm da pesca  tem negócio de venda de capim para cobertura de casas.
Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende  comprar materiais de construcao ( areia , blocos, cimento e outros). Os  anteriores no valor 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00 e 12.000.00mt foram para o negócio. Pretende futuramente  tirar a carta de condução.
texts.en:
Alexandrea was born in the district of Moamba. He is 31 years old and finished the seventh grade. He lives in his own home with his family and has one son. He is supports his parents financially.
He owns a small fishing boat, which he's been using for fishing for more than 10 years. He doesn't have any employees, but his wife helps him with the business. He earns about 5,000 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses and to build his house. Besides fishing, he'd like to have a business selling thatch for houses.
This is his third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, with which he intends to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, etc.). His previous loans (in the amounts of 8,000, 10,000, and 12,000 meticals) were invested in the business. In the future, he'd like to get his driver's license.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga, tiene 38 años, es madre de 2 hijos, casada y socia de Finca Perú desde hace un año.
Carmen es dueña de un Restaurante, da gracias por todos los beneficios que le ofrecen, esta muy feliz en Finca ya que le ayudan a seguir progresando, recuerda que su primer crédito en Finca lo invirtió en su restaurante y siempre lo invierte bien para poder crecer, las capacitaciones le ayudan a poder tener mas conocimiento en todo aspecto, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar al por mayor para el restaurante.
texts.en:
Carmen, 38, is a member of the Morenita Huamanga community bank.  She is married and has 2 children.  She has worked with Finca Peru for a year.
  Carmen owns a restaurant and she is grateful for the opportunities the business provides.  She is grateful to Finca because they have helped her grow her business.  She says that she used her first Finca loan to start the restaurant and uses the loans she gets now to grow it.  The training that she's received has also helped her.  She will use this loan to buy bulk supplies of rice, sugar, etc. for her restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Essineta

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Inhambane, de 49 anos, fez o ensino médio. E viuva Vive na casa própria com sua familia. Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive em Inhambane.
Trabalha na Educação como Assistente Técnica ha mais de 14 anos auferindo mensalmente um valor que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Para alêm do seu ordenado tem uma pensão de viúvez e consegue  poupar 500.00mt mensalmente. Não tem empregados e conta com ajuda dos seus filhos.
Este é o seu quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar materiais de construcao ( areia , blocos, cimento e outros). Os anteriores de (3.500, 8.000.00, 7.000.00 e 5.000.00)mt todos foram para habitação excepto o segundo que foi para compra de um congelador. Futuramente pretende construir dependências de aluguer para garantir a sua reforma.
texts.en:
Essineta was born in the province of Inhambane. She is 49 years old and finished high school. She is a widow. She lives in her own home with her family. She also supports her mother, who lives in Inhambane.
She has worked in education as a technical assistant for more than 14 years, and uses her monthly salary to cover household expenses. Besides her salary, she also receives a widow's pension and is able to save 500 meticals a month. She doesn't have employees, but she can count on her children for help.
This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, etc.). She used her previous loans (for 3500, 8000, 7000, and 5000 mt) to build her house, except for the second loan, which she used to buy a freezer. In the future, she'd like to build rental units to ensure her income.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is from the village Gvishtibi, West Georgia. She is 46-years-old, married and lives with her husband Shota. Shota is a tractor driver. He works on various agricultural projects on his and the neighbors' farms. Liana is leading the agricultural business of the family. They own a milk cow and 2 piglets. Liana produces cheese and sells it at the local market. The piglets are also sold in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris.

Liana requested credit for purchasing materials for a pig house and a cattle-shed renovation as these two buildings are in bad condition and need renovation to keep the needed temperature for domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a pig house and a cattle-shed renovation.

loans.name: Nermin

texts.en:
Nermin started her sewing and tailoring work from home 5 years ago. She a 30-year-old woman who lives in Iraq with her husband, two school age children and her mother who is proud of her daughters work and accomplishments. 

To support her family, Nermin applied for, received, and successfully repaid a previous loan she took from Relief International-Iraq. At the time she purchased a new sewing machine which has been put to great use since then under Nermin's busy hands. 
 
Nermin now took a loan of 1200 USD from RI-Iraq to buy more raw materials and to improve her business with the purchase of an iron, a some small furniture items.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and furniture for her small sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of coffee, beans, rice, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Efraimo

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 25 anos de idade, fez o ensino médio, vive maritalmente é pai de 1 filho. Responsabiliza se pela sua avo que vive com ele em sua casa.
É  proprietàrio de um estabelecimento comercial na sua residência onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade ( comidas, artigos de higiene e bebidas). conta com ajuda de 2 empregados ambos auferem salario igual no valor de 1.750.00mt. tem tido um rendimento de 10.000.00mt e consegue poupar 1.000.00mt na sua conta bancaria. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria. Futuramente pretende adquirir mais empréstimos para ampliar o seu estabelecimento.
texts.en:
Efraimo was born in the district of Namaacha. He is 25 years old and finished high school. He lives with his partner and has one son. He also supports his grandfather, who lives with him in his house.
He runs a business out of his home selling staple goods (food, hygiene products, drinks). He has two employees, whom he pays 1750 meticals a month. He earns 10,000 meticals a month and is able to save 1,000 meticals in his bank account. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to increase the quantity of merchandise he carries. In the future he'd like to request more loans to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy staple goods (food, hygiene products, drinks) for his shop.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is 35 years old and married to Ongechi. They have three children.

He has been in the business of baking cakes(mandazi) for the last seven years, and he earns a monthly income of KES 126,000.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 60,000. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan to expand his business to other localities and use the profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy jikos and baking trays to increase his output.

loans.name: Weimar Andres

texts.es: El joven Weimar a sus 22 años de edad es propietario de una pequeña tienda que compro hace 7 meses con el dinero de unos ahorros y el apoyo de su familia. El Joven Weimar desearía tener más surtido en su tienda con el ánimo de poder mejorar sus ventas y así mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia. El invierno es una dificultad para el señor Weimar puesto que este conlleva a que pocos clientes compren en su tienda, sin embargo este joven es emprendedor y convierte esta dificultad en una oportunidad. El sueño del Joven Weimar en ver crecer su tienda y a futuro tenerla como un supermercado.
texts.en: Weimar, 22, owns a small store that he bought 7 months ago with savings and help from his family.  He would like to better stock the store so that he can increase his sales.  The extra income will help him to improve his family's quality of life.  The winter has been difficult for Weimar because fewer people come to his store to shop in the winter.  He's an enterprising young man, though, and is turning the challenge to an opportunity.  Weimar's goal is to grow his business and to one day own a supermarket.

loans.use: to stock his general store.

loans.name: Nyanluak

texts.en:
Nyanluak is 30 years old, a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. 

She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for one year.

Nyanluak is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items like maize grains.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, age 28 years, is married to Cosmus and they are blessed with two children, age 12 and 4 years.

She does quarrying and has been doing it for eight years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 20,000.

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. She will use the loan to buy quarrying tools and pay wages. Margaret hopes to have modern, sophisticated quarrying machines in the future.

loans.use: To buy tools for quarrying and to pay wages.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha de 34 anos, vive na casa própria com sua familia e responsabiliza se pela sua irmã e neta que vivem com ela, Consegue poupar  1.000.00mt por mes.
É  proprietària de um salão de cabelaria na sua residência onde faz tratamento de cabelos a homens e mulheres, trabalha das 7h as 20h conta com ajuda de dois trabalhadores  que  auferem ambos  1.500.00mt mensalmente.  Para alêm do salão e também  é docente e passa a maior parte do tmpo no trabalho.  com o ordenado que  ganha  aplica nas dispesas da casa. Tem tido um rendimento de 4.000.00mt, este  é seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende adquirir mais produtos para satisfazer a sua clientela nesta  quedra festiva.
Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros créditos e remodelar o seu salão dando mais conforto aos seus clientes.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Namaacha. She's 34 years old and lives with her family in a house she owns. She is responsible for her sister and her granddaughter who live with her. She is able to save 1.000mt a month.
She owns a hair salon that she runs from her home. She provides hair treatment for men and women and works from 7a.m. to 8p.m. She gets help from two workers who both earn 1.500mt a month. Apart from that, she is a teacher and spends most of her time at work. She uses her salary to pay for home expenses. She has been getting an income of 4.000mt.
This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 15.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase more products in order to satisfy her customers during this festive season. She is confident that she will be able to repay in advance so she can get other loans and renovate her salon in order to provide more comfort for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Solomon Kalunge

texts.en:
Solomon is a married man. He has two children, age 12 and 24 years. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as flour, milk, bread, margarine, etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a conducive environment. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as the high cost of goods to be sold. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy breads, soda, sugar, flour, etc. His business goal is to diversify the store within five years.

loans.use: To buy more stock of breads, soda, flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying more maize for the kenkey and fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Amuor

texts.en: Amuor is a 30-year-old married woman with no children. She has run a food stall in Bor, South Sudan, for one year. Amuor is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions, oil, and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase onions, oil, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Vanis

texts.en:
Vanis, 39, is married and has five children between the ages of two and 24. She runs a farm supplies shop that has been in operation for the last three years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 50,000.

This is her fifth loan with KADET LTD, and she has successfully repaid the previous loans. She will use the funds to buy more stocks of animal feeds. Vanis hopes to own a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds

loans.name: James Kinyanjui

texts.en: James is a 54-year-old married man. He has 5 children between the ages of 7 and 28. He describes himself as having potential. He operates a tailoring shop where he sells men suits. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located at a shopping centre, and his primary customers are local people. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothing materials. His business goal is to venture into dairy farming within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy additional jewelry to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes, jewelry, “Bamako cloths,” and other items

loans.name: Tabisa

texts.en: Tabisa is a 30-year-old married woman with three children who are all in school. She has run a business selling tea in Bor, South Sudan, for two years. Tabisa is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase additional clothes

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 26 years old and married to Patrick. They have two children.

She has been selling used clothing for the last 4 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 28,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES 50,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the profits to open up another second-hand clothing shop and to pay for school fees.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Nancy a sus 47 años de edad es una emprendedora quien desde hace más de 5 años y luego de quedar viuda, decide empezar un negocio con el cual pudiera sacar adelante a sus tres hijos. Actualmente, la señora Nancy tiene un pequeño taller de confección en su casa, en el cual produce ropa para niño y bebe. La señora Nancy requiere de la compra de telas para poder realizar sus prendas y así poder vender su producción y obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. El sueño de la señora Nancy es tener su propia línea de ropa para dama y brindarles una buena educación a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Nancy, age 47, is an entrepreneur who became a widow over five years ago.  She then decided to start a business in which she would be able to get her three children ahead.

Nancy currently has a small sewing workshop in her house.  She makes clothes for children and babies.

Nancy needs to buy fabric in order to be able to make the garments.  Then she will be able to sell her production and get the needed income to support her children.

Nancy’s dream is to have her own line of women’s clothing.  She also dreams of giving her three childen a good education.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Achok

texts.en:
Achok is a 30-year-old a married woman with five children. Two of them are in school. 

She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Achok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more of the cloth and scarfs.

loans.name: Anyieth

texts.en:
Anyieth is a 37-year-old a married woman with three children who are not in school. 

She has had a business of selling tea in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Anyieth is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize for the preparation of the banku for sale.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 40 years old, and married to Wairimu. They have four children.

Nelson has been in the welding business for the last 11 years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his fourth loan, this one for KES 45,000. He repaid his previous loans on time. 

He intends to use this loan to buy more welding machines and to improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy more welding machines.

loans.name: Aluong

texts.en:
Aluong is 38-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. For three years, she has had a charcoal selling business in Bor, South Sudan.

Aluong is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from the loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, pepper, tomatoes, cassava dough and firewood.

loans.name: Rubiela De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Rubiela a sus 57 años de edad es una gran trabajadora a pesar de sus dificultades de salud y quien ha salido adelante con sus tres hijos, luego de que su ex esposo se fuera del país y la dejara sola con la responsabilidad de su hogar. Desde hace 30 años, la señora Rubiela trabaja en su propia tienda en la cual vende frutas, verduras, comidas rápidas y productos de la canasta familiar, trabajando todos los días con la ayuda de una de sus hijas en el horario de 6:00 a.m a 10:00 p.m. La señora Rubiela necesita realizarle a su tienda mejoras en el piso y el techo puesto que el invierno ha deteriorado sus instalaciones, además comprar surtido de productos de la canasta familiar que son los más demandados por sus clientes. El sueño de la señora Rubiela es tener un restaurante y sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Rubiela, age 57, is a very hard-worker in spite of her health problems.  She has gotten her three children ahead after her ex-husband went away from the country and left her alone with the responsibility of the household.

For 30 years Rubiela has worked in her own store.  She sells fruit, vegetables, fast food, and staples.  She works every day with the help of one of her daughters.  Her schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.

Rubiela needs to make some improvements to the floor and the roof of her store.  The winter has damaged her facilities.  She will also buy a stock of staple products, which are in the most demand by her customers.

Rubiela’s dream is to have a restaurant and to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to repair the floor and walls and to buy staples to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the purchase of more cloth making fabric

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es socio del Banco Comunal Musuq Wasi, tiene 43 años, es madre de 2 hijos, es socio de Finca desde hace 2 años.
Félix vende verduras y también las reparte en los mercados, él tiene un pequeño terreno y todo lo que saca es para poder comprar semillas y así el puede trabajar bien, da gracias a Finca que le ayudan cuando el mas necesita y las capacitaciones le ayudan a poder mejorar, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semillas, su mayor sueño es poder hacer su casa y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Félix is a member of the “Musuq Wasi” communal bank.  He’s 43 years old and the father of two children.

He sells vegetables and also delivers them to markets.  He has a small plot of land and everything he gets from the harvest allows him to buy seeds, allowing him to work well.  He’s thankful to FINCA, for helping him when he most needs it.  The training also helps him to improve.

He will use the money from this loan to buy seeds.  His greatest dream is to build his house and have a store.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Rómulo Antonio

texts.es:
Rómulo es socio del Banco Comunal Musuq Wasi, tiene 50 años, es padre de 7 hijos, y socio de Finca Peru desde hace 10 años.
Rómulo tiene una tienda de abarrotes y una granja de cuyes, el es Apicultor, él recuerda que con el primer crédito que tuvo compró cajas de madera para las abejas, se siente muy bien en Finca, le gusta la unidad que hay en su banquito y siente que en todos estos años ha progresado, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de comida para los cuyes, y su mayor sueño es seguir construyendo su casa para poder hacer un Restaurante.
texts.en:
Rómulo is a member of the Musuq Wasi communal bank.  He’s the father of seven children and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 10 years.

Rómulo has a grocery store, a Guinea pig farm, and he’s a beekeeper.  He recalls that he used the money from the first loan to buy wooden bee boxes.  He feels comfortable in FINCA and likes the unity within the little bank.  He feels that he has made progress during all these years and will use the money from this loan to buy feed for his Guinea pigs.  His biggest dream is to continue building his house and build a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 46 years old and is married to a businessman. They have seven children, all of whom go to school. For the past ten years, she has sold clothes.
