She has requested this loan to buy more clothes to sell. With her profits, she will renovate her house. She would like to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nyanthic

texts.en: Nyanthic is a 35 year-old married woman with six children — three of them in school. She has had a food-stall business in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Nyanthic is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase beans and sugar to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bean and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk to produce kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves) to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 57 years old, married to Lucy. They have three dependants. He has been in the animal feed business for 5 years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 15,000. He is applying for his second loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more stock of animal feeds.He paid the previous loan in time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He hopes to use the profits to expand the business and re-pay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar, tiene una tienda de abarrotes, es madre de 5 hijos es socia de Finca hace 14 años
Elizabeth empezó con $5.00 , recuerda mucho a la Morenita con sus consejos y eso es lo que ella mas valora, siempre la recuerda, y desde la fecha nunca se retiró y siempre trato de invertir bien sus préstamos, hace poco compraron un terreno en el Valle Esmeralda y sembraran cacao, ahora este préstamo esta destina a poder abrir una tienda en el valle Esmeralda porque vieron que eso es lo que falta en ese lugar y esperan que les vaya muy bien.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Despertar communal bank, has a grocery store, and is the mother of five children.  She’s been involved with FINCA for 14 years.

She began with $5 and recalls “La Morenita’s” advice and this is what she most values; she always remembers her.  From the start she never gave up and always did her best to invest her loans well.  A short time ago they bought a piece of land in the “Valle Esmeralda” valley and planted cacao.  She plans to use the money from this loan to open a store in the Esmeralda valley because they noticed that one is needed there.  They expect things to go well.

loans.use: to open a store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Liith

texts.en: Liith is 31 year old, a married woman with six children — five of them in school. She has had a business selling bread in Bor, south Sudan for three year. Liith is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Carmen Eddy

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar, es transportista tiene 3 combis, es socia de Finca desde hace 12 años.
A raíz de una accidente ella estaba muy desanimada y una amiga le invitó a Finca, ya pasaron 12 años y desde la fecha ella no se ha retirado, agradece mucho por todo el apoyo que le brindaron cuando mas lo necesitaba con mucho esfuerzo se pudo comprar 2 carros, y ahora trabaja con ellos, logró poder tener una buena estabilidad económica, he hizo muy buenas amiga en su banco, ella solo tiene una hija los demás son varones y con la ayuda de Finca le ayudo a poder educarla y ahora este préstamo lo invertirá en el titulo de su hija.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Bienestar” communal bank.  She provides transportation services and has three vans.  She’s been involved with FINCA for 12 years.

After an accident, she was very discouraged and her friend invited her into FINCA.  It’s been 12 years and she has not left.  She is very grateful for all the support they gave her when she most needed it.  With great effort, she was able to buy two cars and now she works with them and was able to create good financial stability.

She’s made good friends in the bank.  She only has one daughter; the rest of her children are boys.  With FINACA’s help, she was able to pay for her daughter’s education.  She will use the money from this loan to pay for her daughter’s title.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.es:
Emerenciana es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar, tiene 50 años, ella es transportista, tiene 2 combis, tiene 3 hijos, es socia de Finca hace 16 años.
Emerenciana empezó sin saber como hacer un negocio y en Finca le enseñaron y siempre le apoyaron, solo su esposo trabajaba llevando a la selva verduras con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprarse un carro y un terreno, cuando todo le iba muy bien sufrió una estafa y hasta ahora esta pagando esa deuda, pero Finca siempre le ayudó nunca la dejaron sola, ella valora mucho eso y da gracias que ya falta muy poco para que termine de pagar, pero nunca dejo de trabajar con mucha fuerza, en esos momentos de desesperación recuerda las palabras de la Morenita “En el camino siempre habrá piedras, pero tú, nunca te detengas”, y así lo hizo, ahora este préstamo lo invertirá en los repuestos de los carros y la gasolina, lo que mas anhela es poder tener su propia flota de carros.
texts.en:
Emerenciana is a member of the communal bank “Despertar,” or “to awaken.” She is 50 years old and has 3 children, and has been a member of Finca for 16 years. She works in transportation and owns 2 vans. Emerenciana began without knowing how to run a business. At Finca, they taught her how and have always supported her. 

Her husband had been working carrying vegetables to the forest. With a lot of effort, he was able to purchase a car and a plot of land. When everything was going well for him, he was the victim of fraud. To this day, he is paying off this debt. Finca always supported them and never left them on their own. She really appreciates this and is thankful that they are not far from finishing the payment. 

She never stopped working hard. In moments of desperation, she would remember the words of the Black Madonna, “En el camino siempre habrá piedras, pero tú, nunca te detengas”, “On your path, there will always be stones, but you, never let them stop you.” So she didn’t, and now she will use this loan to invest in spare parts and gasoline. Her greatest wish is to have her own fleet of cars.

loans.use: purchase spare car parts and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy maize to sell and to cook banku dumplings for sale

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en: Ayen is 32 year old and married with five children — three of them in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for four years. Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mari's Group

texts.es:
Mari's Group es una sociedad de mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que desean mejorar su calidad de vida, en esta sociedad María es la presidenta ya que es una mujer alegre, responsable y trabajadora. María tiene 38 años, es soltera y tiene dos hijos, vive en Otavalo en la provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador.

María tiene un local de comidas, negocio que le ayuda a mantener y dar el estudio a sus dos hijos ya que es el único ingreso económico de su familia. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de un horno para asar pollos ya que quiere innovar y variar las comidas en su negocio, esta inversión ayudará a que gane más clientela y así incrementar sus ventas e ingresos.

Su sueño es que su negocio sea más grande y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Mari’s Group is a society of women workers and entrepreneurs who want to improve their quality of life. 

María is 38 years old. She is single and has two children. She lives in Otavalo in the province of Imbabur in northern of Ecuador.

María  has a food stand. Her business helps her to support and pay for the studies of her two children and is the only source of income for her family. This is the first loan that she has asked for through Fodemi. She is going to use the money to buy an oven to cook chickens as she wants to innovate and vary the food in her business. The money from the loan would help her to win more customers, increasing her sales and profits.

Her dream is that her business grows and she wants to have a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy an oven to cook chickens as she wants to innovate and vary the food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice to make porridge to sell

loans.name: Dabora

texts.en: Dabora is a 33 year-old married woman with three children — two of them in school. She has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Dabora is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase beans to sell.

loans.name: Acuario Group

texts.es: Sinónimo de perseverancia es el grupo "Acuario", un grupo de mujeres y hombres optimistas y  luchadores. Este grupo lleva ya formado 1 año y medio, con 9 socios que vienen siendo ejemplo de personas inteligentes, se encuentran emprendiendo negocios que están transformando su entorno. La confianza que hay entre ellos no solo transcurre por el tiempo que llevan como grupo, también son vecinos y viven en la misma zona. Seria grato comentar de cada uno de las integrantes pero faltarían palabras. Por tanto mencionaremos al señor Rodolfo, un integrante de 61 años de edad y padre de 3 hijos. El se dedica al servicio de transporte el cual le ha dado muchos frutos económicos desde hace más de 10 años, pudiendo ahorrar para los gastos de la casa y arreglos de su carro. Con el presente préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de repuestos y remodelación del auto. Acuario un grupo personas  que con esmero y dedicación saben salir adelante con el paso de cada día.
texts.en:
The communal bank Acuario is synonymous with perseverance. They are a group of optimistic women and men. This communal bank was formed one and one-half years ago, with nine members who are examples of intelligent people that are launching businesses that are transforming our environment.

The trust that is between them not only comes about through the time they have been a communal bank, but also because they are neighbors and live in the same area. 

They would be happy to comment about each one of the members but they would lack the words. And so we will mention Rodolfo, a member who is 61 years old, who has a wife and three children. 

He works in the transport service which has given him many economic benefits for more than ten years, and he is able to save money in order to pay household expenses and repairs for the car. With the money from this loan he will buy spare parts for restoring the car. 

The communal bank Acuario is a group of caring and dedicated people who know how to face each passing day.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 39 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de plátanos y este la realiza de forma ambulante, esta actividad la aprendió de forma empírica, ya que por la necesidad que tenia de generar ingresos a su familia tuvo que emprenderla. A su cargo tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando y que con muchos esfuerzos los ha sacado adelante y les ha enseñado a sus hijos el valor de luchar y de seguir adelante. Alejandro está solicitando financiamiento para el abono para la plantación de plátano y poder sacar la cosecha y salir a venderla.
texts.en: Alejandro is 39 years old and he sells bananas on foot.  He learned to do this on his own because he had to earn an income for his family.  He has four children to care for and they attend school.  He’s managed to get them ahead with lots of effort.  He’s shown them the value of selling, working hard, and continuing to move ahead.  Alejandro is asking for this loan to buy fertilizer for his banana plantation so that he can harvest and sell his crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothes and kitchenware.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients and food items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, and other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase utensils to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make and sell food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Diana Janeth

texts.es: La señora Diana es propietaria de una papelería y venta de helados en un local adecuado en la sala de su casa, este negocio lo heredo de su padre quien hace tres años se lo cedió para que ella trabajara. Desde entonces viene trabajando arduamente para generar los ingresos para su familia y el sostenimiento de su bebe de 18 meses de nacido. La señora Diana requiere de la compra de surtido en productos de papelería puesto que esta por iniciar la temporada escolar. El sueño de la señora Diana es ver crecer a su hijo y tener un gran almacén de variedades.
texts.en:
Diana has a paper goods store and also sells frozen treats from a space set up in her home.  She inherited this business from her father who passed it on to her three years ago so she could work.  Since then she’s been working arduously to earn the income that her family needs and to support her 18 month old baby.

Diana needs to buy an assortment of paper products so she can begin the school year.  Her dream is to watch her son grow and to have a large variety store.
.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.es:
Zosimo de 37 años de edad, convive con Antonieta de 32 años, fruto de este amor tienen 5 hijos.
Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de sivia. Zosimo es un agricultor dedicado al cultivo de cacao y café, pero en ocasiones que no tiene trabajo agrícola, se dedica a trabajar como carpintero en un taller de uno de sus vecinos, su ganancia es a destajo. Zosimo en un futuro desea abrir su propia carpintería por que ya cuenta con un ambiente adecuado como para éste rubro de trabajo, lo único que le falta es el capital económico. Es por esta razón que zosimo recurre a solicitar un crédito, a MFP donde fue atendido su pedido. Ahora espera concretar pronto sus planes, el tener un taller de fabricación de muebles de madera. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles, comprará una garlopa (cepilladora eléctrica) para madera.
texts.en:
Zosimo is 37 years old and lives with his partner Antonieta who is 32 years old with whom he has 5 children.

Together they live in their own house located in the district of Sivia. Zosimo is a farmer and grows cocoa and coffee. However, when he has no farming work he works as a carpenter in one of his neighbours' workshops. His profit is by piecework. In the future Zosimo wants to open his own carpentry workshop because he already has a suitable environment for this kind of ​​work; the only thing missing is the working capital. It is for this reason that Zosimo is asking MFP where they attended to his request for a loan. He is now hoping to finalize his plans soon, that is having a workshop making furniture from wood. This will be his first loan with MFP and so he agrees to make his repayments punctually. With the 3,000 soles (PEN) he will buy a joiner (an electric planer) for wood.

.

loans.use: to buy an electric planer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is 32 years old. He lives in Pambak village in the Lori area with his family, which consists of his wife and three children: two daughters and a son. 

Artak has run a cattle-breeding business for several years and his wife helps him in this occupation. Also, with joint efforts, they provide part of the  fodder (feed) for their cows and calves from their small plot of land. As they are missing part of the fodder they need, Artak buys from fellow villagers. The milk, butter, cheese and meat they produce they sell at food market.

Artak needs a 250,000 AMD loan to buy winter stock of fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy winter stock of fodder for his farm animals

loans.use: to buy drinks, sweets, cigarettes, etc. in bulk to add to his business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 38 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador; vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Alejandra de 25 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Kevin de 05 años y Yolider de 04 meses, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo a conseguido Juan, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ya que su notoriedad de cosechar cacao, son de buena calidad y por lo cual sus productos son vendidos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos, ya que esto puede afectar sus ingresos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de sus cultivos, ya que son muy pesados y le quitan mucha energía. Con el crédito solicitado comprará plantas de cacao para incrementarlos en sus tierras y así poder obtener más producción. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos de trabajo. Le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal ya que trabaja con personas responsables. Con los 500 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de cacao para incrementarlos en sus tierras.
texts.en: Juan, 38, is a cheerful and hardworking man. He lives in his own house with his wife Alexandra who is 25 years old and their 2 children, Kevin who is 5 years old and Yolider who is 4 months old. They wish to give their children a better quality of life. The farming land that Juan has managed to acquire with a lot of hard work are the mainstay of his family. His products are in high demand in Santa Rosa as he has a reputation for good quality harvested cocoa which is why his products sell at very good prices. What he likes the most about his work is protecting his plants from the pests that might attack them. He has being doing this job for the last 10 years and considers carrying his sacks of produce the most difficult aspect of his work as they are very heavy and take a lot of energy. With the requested loan he will buy cocoa plants to increase the number he has on his land and so be able to increase production. This will be his 4th loan with MFP and thus hopes to receive your continued support with his work objectives. He likes being a part of his communal bank as he works with responsible people. With the 500 nuevos soles (PEN) he will buy cocoa plants to increase their number on his land.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants.

loans.name: Didier Adolfo

texts.es: El señor Didier a los 31 años de edad cuenta con una discapacidad física para caminar por lo cual para hacer esta actividad debe ser con la ayuda de un bastón.  Lo anterior, no es ningún impedimento para trabajar como barbero en una vereda del municipio de bello localizado al norte de la ciudad de Medellín, la experiencia del señor Didier es ya de cuatro años y los conocimientos los adquirió en un curso que hizo en una institución educativa de Medellín. El señor Didier con la esperanza de mejorar su negocio y prestar un mejor servicio desea comprar sillas para la sala de espera de su barbería y productos con los cuales trabaja tales como gel fijador para el cabello y shampoo. El sueño del señor Didier es tener su propia sala de belleza y brindarle educación a su hijo de 10 años.
texts.en:
Didier, 31, has a physical walking disability, so he has to do this with a cane.  This is no impediment to working as a barber in a district of the town of Bello, located to the north of the city of Medellín.  Didier already has four years of experience, and he acquired his knowledge in a course he took in an educational institute in Medellín.

Hoping to improve his business and offer better service, Didier wants to buy chairs for the waiting room of his barber shop and products he works with such as hair gel, hairspray, and shampoo.

Didier's dream is to have his own beauty shop and give his 10-year-old son an education.

loans.use: to buy chairs and beauty projects such as hair gel and shampoo.

loans.name: El Portal Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “El Portal” está conformado por 15 emprendedores, quienes se desempeñan en diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran pastelería, rotisería, venta de ropa, venta de joyas y perfumería. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Elisa integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila, ocupando el segundo puesto de izquierda a derecha, usa su cabello corto y viste una polera estampada de color verde y blanco.
Ella se dedica a la chocolatería desde hace 15 años, comenta que comenzó como un hobby y después se convirtió en el negocio que tiene. Después se perfeccionó en un curso que se impartió en la ciudad de Concepción.
Ella produce los chocolates en su misma casa y posteriormente los distribuye a sus clientes, quienes hacen sus pedidos. Elisa produce de manera artesanal y para esto cuenta con la implementación necesaria.
Ella aprovecha todas las temporadas de fiestas y celebraciones durante el año. Entre semana santa, día del niño, madre, padre, cumpleaños, navidad, entre otras fechas.
Comenta que con el tiempo se ha hecho de un gran número de clientes, ya que también trabaja a pedido para colegios.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras y confiterías. 
Con el crédito comprará chocolate en cantidad, para preparar sus productos. Además de moldes y coberturas.
Una de sus metas a largo plazo es instalarse con un local establecido.
Elisa vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad, ambos asisten al colegio.
Sus sueños son incrementar su producción y ventas, para recibir mejores ingresos y esto le permita una estabilidad económica al igual que una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad y apoyo que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Biobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called El Portal and is made up of 15 entrepreneurs who work in different areas, including making pastry, roasting chickens, clothing sales, jewelry sales, and perfume shop.  All are in the city of Concepción.  Elisa, a member of the communal bank, is the second from the left in the first row in the photo; she has short hair and is wearing a t-shirt with a green and white pattern.

Elisa has worked making chocolate for 15 years.  She says it began as a hobby and then became her business.  Later she perfected herself in a course that was given in the city of Concepción.  She makes the chocolates in her own house and later distributes them to her customers, who order them.  Elisa works in an artisanal fashion and has the necessary tools for this.

She takes advantage of all the holiday seasons and celebrations throughout the year, between Holy Week, Day of the Child, Mother's Day, Father's Day, birthdays, and Christmas, among other days.  She comments that over time she has acquired a large number of customers because she also works on request for schools.  She buys her merchandise from distributors and in candy shops.

With the loan she will buy lots of chocolate to prepare her products, as well as molds and icings.  

One of her long-term goals is to set herself up in an established location.

She lives with her husband and two children, ages 8 and 5, both of whom attend school.  Her dreams are to increase her production and sales and to receive better income, which will give her better economic stability as well as a better quality of life for her family.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity and support that Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the Biobío River, one of the largest rivers in the country, in the south of Chile in the Biobío region.  It has had an important role in our history, being the site of important battles and a notable settlement, especially during the Arauco War, because it is on the border of Mapuche territory.  Currently the city has important economic and demographic development and is coming to be considered one of the most notable urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial centers of Chile, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy chocolate, molds, and icings

loans.name: Marisela Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Marisela Lucia es mujer que se dedica a hacer manualidades en sus tiempos libres, lo cual también forma parte de su trabajo, ella actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de algunos adornos, como también se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir.

Ella es una joven de 23 años con muchos sueños y metas que piensa cumplir, en la actualidad ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, caracterizada por el incremento de inversión y la inauguración de nuevos centros comerciales, las que permiten a muchas personas obtener un empleo donde son remunerados con todos los beneficios que deben tener, en este nuevo gran mercado iqueño, vive y trabaja Marisela una mujer que día a día se empeña para poder salir adelante.

Marisela trabaja 8 horas diarias y esto le permite atender entre 25 y 30 clientes lo que le genera un ingreso diario de S/.40, en un buen día, gracias a la gran afluencia de público, ella puede ganar hasta S/.150. Ella cree que su negocio continuará creciendo debido a gran afluencia de clientes que tiene, este negocio fue iniciado gracias a que su tía la entusiasmo para que incursionara en el mismo.

Gracias a los prestatarios Kiva Marisela podrá comprar productos que permitirán que amplíe su tienda y también pueda vender en otros lugares. Ella desea duplicar el número de sus clientes en los próximos 6 meses y así poder construir su casa propia como también adquirir una tienda propia en cada ciudad del departamento de Ica.
texts.en:
Marisela Lucía is a woman who works making handicrafts in her spare time, which also is part of her job.  Currently she works buying and selling some adornments as well as making clothing.

She is a 23-year-old young woman with many dreams and goals that she plans to realize.  Currently she lives in the city of Ica, known for the increase in investment and the opening of new shopping centers, which allows many people to get a job in which they are remunerated with all the benefits they ought to have.  Marisela, a woman who strives every day to be able to get ahead, lives in this vast new Ica market. 

Marisela works eight hours a day, which allows her to see between 25 and 30 customers, generating her a daily income of 40 PEN in a good day.  Thanks to the great affluence of the public, she can earn up to 150 PEN.  She believes her business will continue growing because of the great affluence of the customers she has.  She started this business thanks to her aunt who excited her about getting into it.

Thanks to the Kiva lenders, Marisela will be able to buy products that will allow her to expand her store, and that she also can sell in other places.  She wants to double the number of customers in the next six months and so be able to build her own house as well as acquire her own store in every city of the department of Ica.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim lives in Changamwe, Kenya. Salim is married and has three school going children. He owns a three wheeler vehicle – tuktuk. The business has been in operation for the last ten years. Besides this, he also has a battery charging center. 
He is applying for a loan of Ksh 30,000 to repair his three wheeler vehicle. His future ambition is to acquire more three wheeler vehicles. The challenges he faces relate to high utility bills and the high cost of fuel. 
Salim will use the extra income obtained from the business to pay school fees, meet basic expenses and save for the future.

loans.use: To repair his three wheeler vehicle
